the registrant is not required to file reports pursuant to Section&nbsp;13 or
Section&nbsp;15(d)&nbsp;of the Act.&nbsp;Yes </font><font size="2" face="Wingdings" style="font-size:10.0pt;">o</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; No </font><font size="2" face="Wingdings" style="font-size:10.0pt;">x</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Indicate by check mark
whether the registrant (1)&nbsp;has filed all reports required to be filed by
Section&nbsp;13 or 15(d)&nbsp;of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 during the
preceding 12 months (or for such shorter period that the registrant was
required to file such reports), and (2)&nbsp;has been subject to such filing
requirements for the past 90 days.&nbsp;Yes </font><font size="2" face="Wingdings" style="font-size:10.0pt;">x</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; No </font><font size="2" face="Wingdings" style="font-size:10.0pt;">o</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Indicate by check mark if
disclosure or delinquent filers pursuant to Item 405 of Regulation S-K
(&#167;229.405 of this chapter) is not contained herein, and will not be contained,

statements incorporated by reference in Part&nbsp;III of this Form&nbsp;10-K or
any amendment to this Form&nbsp;10-K.&nbsp;Yes </font><font size="2" face="Wingdings" style="font-size:10.0pt;">o</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; No </font><font size="2" face="Wingdings" style="font-size:10.0pt;">x</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Indicate by check
mark whether the registrant is a large accelerated filer, an accelerated filer,
a non-accelerated filer, or a smaller reporting company. See the definitions of
&#147;large accelerated filer&#148;, &#147;accelerated filer&#148; and &#147;smaller reporting company&#148;

smaller reporting company)</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Indicate by check mark
whether the registrant is a shell company (as defined in Rule&nbsp;12b-2 of the
Act).&nbsp;Yes </font><font size="2" face="Wingdings" style="font-size:10.0pt;">o</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160;
No </font><font size="2" face="Wingdings" style="font-size:10.0pt;">x</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">State the aggregate
market value of the voting and non-voting common equity held by non-affiliates
computed by reference to the price at which the common equity was last sold, or
the average bid and asked price of such common equity, as of the last business
day of the registrant&#146;s most recently completed second fiscal quarter.&nbsp;Not
Applicable.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">DOCUMENTS
INCORPORATED BY REFERENCE</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Not applicable.</font></p>

<div style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 6.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;">

<p align="center" style="border:none;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;padding:0in;text-align:center;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

</div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>

  Disagreements with Accountants on Accounting and Financial Disclosure.</a></font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.32%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 3.0pt .0001pt 0in;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6%" valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:6.12%;">

<h1 style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">PART&nbsp;I<a name="Parti_185414"></a></font></b></h1>

<h1 style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></h1>

<h2 style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-.75in;text-transform:uppercase;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;text-transform:none;">ITEM 1.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;text-transform:none;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;text-transform:none;">BUSINESS.</font><a name="Item1_Business__185418"></a></h2>

<h2 style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-.75in;text-transform:uppercase;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></h2>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Unless the context indicates otherwise, all
references to the &#147;Company&#148;, &#147;155&#148;, &#147;we&#148;, &#147;our&#148;, &#147;ours&#148; and &#147;us&#148; refer to 155
East Tropicana, LLC.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Forward-looking Statements</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Certain information included herein contains
statements that may be considered forward-looking, such as statements relating
to projections of future results of operations or financial condition,
expectations for our casino, and expectations of the continued availability of
capital resources. Any forward-looking statement made by us necessarily is
based upon a number of estimates and assumptions that, while considered
reasonable by us, is inherently subject to significant business, economic and
competitive uncertainties and contingencies, many of which are beyond our
control, and are subject to change.&#160;
Actual results of our operations may vary materially from any
forward-looking statement made by us or on our behalf.&#160; Forward-looking statements should not be
regarded as representation by us or any other person that the forward-looking
statements will be achieved.&#160; Readers are
cautioned not to place undue reliance on any forward-looking statements, which
speak only as of the date thereof. We undertake no obligation to publicly
release any revisions to such forward-looking statements to reflect events or
circumstances after the date hereof.&#160;
Some of the contingencies and uncertainties to which any forward-looking
statement contained herein are subject to include, but are not limited to,
those set forth below in the heading &#147;ITEM 1A. Risk Factors.&#148;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Corporate Organization</font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We were formed in June&nbsp;2004 to acquire
the H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo Casino and Resort (the &#147;H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo&#148;), a casino hotel
located in Las Vegas, Nevada from Eastern&nbsp;&amp; Western Hotel Corporation
(&#147;Eastern&nbsp;&amp; Western&#148;).&#160; The
H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo was renovated and re-branded and is now known as Hooters Casino
Hotel.&#160; Our common membership interests
are held two-thirds through Florida Hooters LLC and one-third through EW Common
LLC.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Florida Hooters LLC is a joint venture
between Hooters Gaming LLC and Lags Ventures, LLC.&#160; Hooters Gaming LLC is owned by the holders of
licenses to operate Hooters restaurants in the Tampa Bay, Chicago and Manhattan
areas as well as for wholesale foods, calendars and Nevada hotel/gaming, and
includes most of the original founders of the Hooters brand.&#160; Lags Ventures, LLC is owned by a holder of
the license rights to Hooters restaurants in south Florida.&#160; Pursuant to these license rights, the owners
of Florida Hooters LLC operate 40 Hooters restaurants, publish Hooters
calendars, and operate a Hooters food business.&#160;
The owner of Lags Ventures, LLC is also the founder of the Dan Marino
concept restaurants and owns and operates two Dan Marino concept restaurants.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">EW Common LLC was formed to hold Eastern&nbsp;&amp;
Western&#146;s membership interest in us.&#160;
Eastern&nbsp;&amp; Western owns 90% of EW Common LLC while our
President, Michael Hessling, owns the balance.&#160;
Eastern&nbsp;&amp; Western is beneficially owned by Sukeaki and Toyoroku
Izumi.&#160; Eastern&nbsp;&amp; Western and
its affiliates owned the H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo from November&nbsp;1988 until our
acquisition of the hotel casino in August&nbsp;2004.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our affiliates have granted us assignments of
certain licenses pertaining to the use of the Hooters brand as well as the Dan
Marino, &#147;13&#148; Martini Bar and Pete&nbsp;&amp; Shorty&#146;s concept restaurants,
solely for the purposes of allowing us to operate a Hooters Casino Hotel
located at our property.&#160; Pursuant to the
Hooters license assignment, we are required to pay the owner of the Hooters trademark,
HI Limited </font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Partnership, a royalty
fee.&#160; For more information, see &#147;Item 1.
Business&#151;Intellectual Property&#148; and &#147;Item 13. Certain Relationships and Related
Transactions.&#148;&#160; Hooters of America,&nbsp;Inc.
is the general partner of HI Limited Partnership and we refer to HI Limited
Partnership and Hooters of America,&nbsp;Inc. collectively as &#147;Hooters of
America.&#148;&#160; The original founders of the
Hooters brand sold the trademark rights (excluding certain rights they retained
for themselves) to Hooters of America in 2001.&#160;
As a result, Hooters of America is the trademark owner of the Hooters
brand and the operator and franchisor of Hooters restaurants.&#160; We are not affiliated with Hooters of
America.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Before we received our necessary gaming
licenses and prior to November&nbsp;1, 2005, the H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo was operated by
Eastern&nbsp;&amp; Western pursuant to two separate leases with us.&#160; These leases were terminated when we received
our gaming license.&#160; The following chart
illustrates our corporate structure:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><img width="719" height="398" src="g28231bci001.gif"></font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="1" width="25%" noshade color="black" align="left"></div>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">155 East Tropicana Finance
Corp., which has no assets or operations, was formed for the sole purpose of
facilitating the issuance of our 8 &#190; % Senior Secured Notes due 2012.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Asset
Purchase Agreement</font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:.3pt;">On April&nbsp;30, 2007, the
Company entered into a definitive Asset Purchase Agreement (the &#147;Agreement&#148;)
with Hedwigs Las Vegas Top Tier, LLC (the &#147;Buyer&#148;), and on May&nbsp;3, 2007,
the Company entered into a definitive Casino Operations Lease (the &#147;Lease&#148;)
with the Buyer. On May&nbsp;7, 2007, the Company entered into a First Amendment
to Asset Purchase Agreement with the Buyer. Additionally, on August&nbsp;8,
2007, the Company entered into a Second Amendment to Asset Purchase Agreement
with the Buyer.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:.3pt;">Under the terms of the
Agreement, as amended, the Buyer has offered to purchase essentially all of the
assets of the Company for a purchase price of $95.0 million in cash, the
payment of certain accrued royalties, and the assumption of certain outstanding
liabilities of the Company. The Buyer will also be responsible for the Company&#146;s
$130.0 million in principal amount of 8.75% Senior Secured Notes due 2012. In
connection with the Agreement, as amended, the Company has received three
nonrefundable deposit payments from the Buyer, including (1)&nbsp;a $1.0
million payment on May&nbsp;7, 2007, (2)&nbsp;a $0.5 million payment on August&nbsp;14,
2007 and (3)&nbsp;a $1.5 million deposit payment on November&nbsp;26, 2007. All
deposits will be applied against the purchase price if the transaction closes.
The Agreement, as amended, provides for a closing date on or before December&nbsp;31,
2007, which the Buyer may extend under certain conditions by paying a $0.5
million extension fee for each month the Agreement is extended. Four extension
fees of $0.5 million each were received by the Company on December&nbsp;31,
2007, January&nbsp;31, 2008, February&nbsp;29, 2008 and March 31, 2008. The
extension fees paid are not refundable and will not be credited toward the
purchase price. Notwithstanding the Buyer&#146;s right to extend the closing date,
the Company may terminate the Agreement if the closing has not occurred on or
before June&nbsp;30, 2008.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As
provided in the Agreement, the closing will be subject to the completion of due
diligence, financing, and licensing, among other customary conditions. There
can be no assurance that (i)&nbsp;the conditions to closing under Agreement
will ever be satisfied, or (ii)&nbsp;any transaction contemplated under the
Agreement will be consummated, or (iii)&nbsp;if a transaction is consummated,
it will be on the same or similar terms as currently provided under the
Agreement.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Hooters Casino Hotel</font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We purchased the former H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo in August&nbsp;2004
and commenced renovations in March&nbsp;2005.&#160;
On February&nbsp;3, 2006 the newly renovated and rebranded Hooters
Casino Hotel opened to the public .&#160; Our
property is located one-half block east of the intersection of Tropicana Avenue
and Las Vegas Boulevard, a major intersection on the Las Vegas strip (&#147;The
Strip&#148;) that is within walking distance to approximately 25,000 hotel rooms.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Prior to the renovation, H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo
featured 711 hotel rooms, including 17 suites, and an approximately 24,000
square-foot casino with 532 slot and video poker machines, 16 table games, and
a sports book. The H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo remained open during our renovation, although
only on a limited basis from late October&nbsp;2005 until we opened the
property as the Hooters Casino Hotel on February&nbsp;3, 2006.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Hooters Casino Hotel features the famous
Hooters d&#233;cor, and the Hooters brand is a prominent component of the facility.
Our renovations have refreshed and upgraded the property, and provided several
new restaurant offerings.&#160; The Hooters
Casino Hotel features:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">an approximately 29,000 square foot &#147;Hooters&#148; themed
casino floor with approximately 679 state-of-the-art slot and video poker
machines and 33 table games;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">696 newly renovated hotel rooms, including 17
suites;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">a tropical pool area featuring beach sand, palm
trees, lagoon style waterfall, and Nippers Pool Bar;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">distinctive dining and
entertainment options, including:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .95in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">a world famous Hooters
restaurant;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">4</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .95in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Dan Marino&#146;s, a restaurant
featuring American cuisine which has offered 24 hour dining since October&nbsp;24,
2007;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .95in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .95in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Night Owl Club featuring
nightly entertainment;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .95in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .95in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Bait Shoppe, a retail
store conveniently located at poolside selling Hooters and Pete&nbsp;&amp;
Shorty&#146;s branded merchandise;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .95in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .95in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Porch Dogs, a Caribbean
themed casual indoor-outdoor club offering music and cocktails;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .95in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .95in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Pete&nbsp;&amp; Shorty&#146;s
Tavern, a casual and comfortable restaurant bar featuring a sports book and a
poker room;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .95in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .95in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Lobby Bar, a 24-hour bar
located at the entrance to the casino, featuring service by the world famous
Hooters girls.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .95in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Splurge, a retail store selling Hooters branded
merchandise.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">SASS, a day spa, salon and workout facility.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Renovation</font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The renovation of the Hooters Casino Hotel
commenced in March&nbsp;2005, and the Hooters Casino Hotel opened to the public
on February&nbsp;3, 2006.&#160; Our strategy
is to build on Hooters&#146; reputation as a casual, relaxed, fun, and welcoming
environment.&#160; We believe that Hooters&#146;
strong brand name recognition and our favorable location will generate visitor
traffic.&#160; The key elements of our
renovation of the property are:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Main Entrance.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; We renovated the main entrance to adopt the
Hooters d&#233;cor of natural wood, tin, and orange.&#160;
The Hooters brand is a prominent component of the main entrance and we
replaced the existing doors with new 12-foot high clear glass doors to make the
casino area clearly visible from the outside and the immediate entrance
area.&#160; We also made improvements to the
traffic flow around the entrance areas that we expect will improve pedestrian
traffic into the casino.&#160; In addition, we
added significant new signage to the property, including a large marquee in
front of the property.&#160; We anticipate
that these improvements will result in more walk-in visitors to the casino and
our other attractions and amenities.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Casino.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; We expanded and renovated our casino from approximately
24,000 square feet to approximately 29,000 square feet and designed the casino
to be more inviting and to better use the available space, allowing us to add
new gaming equipment.&#160; We now feature 679
state-of-the-art slot and video poker machines, 30 table games, sports book,
and a poker room.&#160; To make the casino
more inviting, we raised the elevation of the ceiling in some areas for a more
open feeling, updated the ceiling with d&#233;cor of natural wood, tin, and orange,
re-carpeted the gaming area with new Hooters-themed carpet and installed wood
floor in the surrounding area.&#160; In
addition, adjacent to the entrance, we added a Hooters bar, serving beer and
cocktails to casino guests, and a retail store, selling Hooters branded
merchandise.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Dining and Entertainment Options.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; We offer distinctive dining and entertainment
options, including the 200-seat Hooters Restaurant, the 287-seat Dan Marino&#146;s
Fine Food and Spirits, the 100-seat Pete&nbsp;&amp; Shorty&#146;s Tavern, the
200-seat Porch Dogs, and a 350 person occupancy Nippers Pool Bar. The &#147;13&#148;
Martini Bar and Dam Restaurant were both closed in 2007 and the Night Owl
Showroom opened. To house our new Dan Marino&#146;s restaurant, we built a new
building adjacent to the main entrance.&#160;
The restaurant is visible from both outside and inside the
property.&#160; In addition, Dan Marino&#146;s
restaurant features a bar that serves customers from both the casino floor and
the restaurant.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">5</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='5',FILE='C:\JMS\wbruce\08-2823-1\task2827333\2823-1-bc.htm',USER='wbruce',CD='Mar 31 12:43 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Hotel.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; We significantly remodeled our hotel
rooms.&#160; The 696 newly renovated rooms
feature a Caribbean/Florida theme and new furniture, carpets, painted textured
walls, lighting, art-work and bedspreads.&#160;
We also renovated the bathrooms with new paint, fixtures, and upgraded
amenities.&#160; The common hotel areas were
updated with new carpet, paint, doors and signage.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Pool Area.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; We expanded and upgraded the existing pool
area to include tropical heated pools with beach sand, palm trees, three
in-ground Jacuzzis, lagoon style waterfalls and Nippers Pool Bar.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We spent approximately $53.0 million in cash
expenditures for renovations and operating equipment and $10.1 million in
pre-opening expenditures in 2005 and 2006.&#160;
During the renovation, we continued to keep the existing H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo
operations open, although only on a limited basis from late October&nbsp;2005
until the grand opening of the Hooters Casino Hotel on February&nbsp;3, 2006.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Competition</font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We face competition in the market in which we
are located as well as in or near any geographic area from which we attract or
expect to attract a significant number of our customers.&#160; As a result, our casino property faces direct
competition from all other casinos and hotels in Las Vegas and to a lesser
extent, in the Mesquite, Laughlin, Reno and Lake Tahoe areas of Nevada and in
Atlantic City, New Jersey, and in the California gaming market, as well as from
other forms of gaming.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Las Vegas, Nevada.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; The hotel casino industry in Las Vegas is
highly competitive.&#160; The Hooters Casino
Hotel competes on the basis of overall atmosphere, range of amenities, level of
service, price, location, entertainment offered, theme and size.&#160; The Hooters Casino Hotel competes with
numerous resorts and hotel casinos on The Strip and in downtown Las Vegas, as
well as a large number of hotels and motels in and near Las Vegas.&#160; Many competing properties have themes and
attractions which draw a significant number of visitors and compete with our
property for hotel and gaming customers.&#160;
Some of these facilities are operated by companies that have more than
one operating facility, and many have greater name recognition and financial
and marketing resources than us and market to the same target demographic group
as we do. Additional major hotel casinos and significant expansion of existing
properties, containing a significant number of hotel rooms and attractions, are
expected to open in Las Vegas within the coming years.&#160; We seek to differentiate the Hooters Casino
Hotel from other major Las Vegas hotel casino resorts by concentrating on the design,
atmosphere, personal service and amenities that we provide and the added value
of the Hooters brand.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">California Gaming Market.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; Voters in California approved an amendment to
the California constitution in 2000 that gave Native American tribes in California
the right to offer a limited number of slots machines and a range of
house-banked card games.&#160; A number of
Native American tribes have already signed, and others have begun signing,
gaming compacts with the State of California.&#160;
As of March&nbsp;2007, 66 compacts have been approved by the federal
government and casino-style gaming is legal in California on those tribal
lands.&#160; According to the National Indian
Gaming Commission, as of January&nbsp;2007, there are approximately 56
operating tribal casinos in California.&#160;
In addition, several Native American tribes in California have reached
agreements with the State of California that allow for an increased number of
gaming machines within the facilities operated by such tribes in exchange for a
revenue-based payment to the state.&#160; The
competitive impact on our gaming establishments from the continued growth of
gaming in California cannot be definitively determined but, depending on the
nature, extent and location of the growth, the impact could be material.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Other Forms of Gaming.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; We also compete, to some extent, with other
forms of gaming on both a local and national level, including state-sponsored
lotteries, Internet gaming, dockside casinos, riverboat casinos, on- and
off-track wagering and card parlors.&#160; The
recent and continued expansion of legalized </font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">6</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='6',FILE='C:\JMS\wbruce\08-2823-1\task2827333\2823-1-bc.htm',USER='wbruce',CD='Mar 31 12:43 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">casino gaming into new
jurisdictions throughout the United States has increased competition faced by
us and will continue to do so in the future.&#160;
Additionally, if gaming were legalized or expanded in jurisdictions near
any geographic area from which we attract or expect to attract a significant
number of our customers, we could face additional competition which could have
a significant adverse impact on our business, financial condition and results
of operations.&#160; There can be no assurance
that we will be able to continue to compete successfully in our existing
markets or that we will be able to compete successfully against any such future
competition.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Intellectual Property</font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We have entered into an assignment agreement
with Florida Hooters, LLC which grants us the right to use certain intellectual
property in connection with the operation of the Hooters Casino Hotel.&#160; The intellectual property covered by these
agreements is described below.&#160;
Additionally, we have been granted a royalty-free license to the Pete&nbsp;&amp;
Shorty&#146;s mark.&#160; For more detailed
information, see &#147;Item 13. Certain Relationships and Related Transactions.&#148;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Hooters Trademark.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; The Hooters trademark and logo insignia are
the exclusive property of Hooters of America.&#160;
We have an exclusive license to use the Hooters brand in connection with
gaming, casino or combined hotel, gaming and casino operations solely at the
Hooters Casino Hotel property.&#160; Florida
Hooters, LLC originally obtained the license through an assignment from Hooters
Gaming Corporation, an affiliated entity under common ownership with Hooters
Gaming LLC.&#160; The underlying license
agreement was executed between Hooters of America and Hooters Gaming
Corporation, and granted to Hooters Gaming Corporation an exclusive license to
use the licensed intellectual property in connection with gaming, casino or
combined hotel, gaming and casino operations within the State of Nevada.
Hooters Gaming Corporation retained any and all rights and obligations in the
licensed intellectual property pursuant to the license agreement for all
locations within Nevada other than the Hooters Casino Hotel.&#160; Under an Affirmation and Acknowledgement
agreement between Hooters Gaming Corporation and 155 East Tropicana,&nbsp;LLC,
Hooters Gaming Corporation has agreed not to operate (or license or assign its
rights to operate) another Hooters Casino Hotel on The Strip, until such time
as none of the Notes is outstanding.&#160;
Additionally, under the agreement, Hooters Gaming Corporation agreed not
to operate (or license or assign its rights to operate) another Hooters Casino
Hotel in Clark County, Nevada for a period of four years from the issuance of
the Notes or such earlier time as none of the Notes is outstanding.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Combined hotel, gaming and casino operations
contemplated under the license agreement include, but are not limited to, the
right to provide the following within the facility: (i)&nbsp;room service; (ii)&nbsp;restaurant
operations, subject to the consent of Las Vegas Wings,&nbsp;Inc., as the
franchisee of the rights to operate Hooters restaurants in Nevada (which
consent has been obtained); (iii)&nbsp;retail sales facilities in which third
parties are permitted to conduct retail sales of all kinds; and (iv)&nbsp;entertainment
facilities, subject to certain quality standards.&#160; In connection with such operations, we have
the right to (i)&nbsp;sell approved merchandise bearing some or all of the
licensed intellectual property, (ii)&nbsp;use the licensed intellectual
property and Hooters Girls to promote, market, and advertise such facilities
worldwide, and (iii)&nbsp;include Hooters Girls as part of any facility staff.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We are required to pay Hooters of America an
annual fee equal to $500.&#160; In addition,
we pay to Hooters of America a royalty in an amount equal to two percent (2%)
of all net revenues generated in connection with licensed activities (which
includes net revenues generated in connection with hotel, casino, and
restaurant operations).&#160; We are also
required by the license agreement to maintain certain quality standards for the
use of the Hooters brand.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">7</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='7',FILE='C:\JMS\wbruce\08-2823-1\task2827333\2823-1-bc.htm',USER='wbruce',CD='Mar 31 12:43 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Hooters Restaurant Concept.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; Pursuant to a consent from Las Vegas Wings,&nbsp;Inc.,
we have the right to use the Hooters restaurant concept at the hotel
casino.&#160; The consent permits worldwide
promotion, marketing and advertising of the hotel casino and its services.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Dan Marino Concept Restaurants.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; We have an exclusive license to use certain
intellectual property to operate and promote restaurants, taverns, lounges and
bars using the marks &#147;Dan Marino&#146;s Fine Food&nbsp;&amp; Spirits&#148; and &#147;&#145;13&#146;
Martini Bar,&#148; which was closed in 2007 and reopened as Night Owl Showroom.
Florida Hooters, LLC was granted the license from Lags Ventures,&nbsp;Inc., an
affiliated entity under common ownership with Lags Ventures, LLC.&#160; The initial term of the agreement is
20&nbsp;years but may be extended for an additional ten years.&#160; See &#147;Item 13. Certain Relationships and
Related Transactions.&#148;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Pete&nbsp;&amp; Shorty&#146;s.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; Pete&nbsp;&amp; Shorty&#146;s,&nbsp;Inc. has
granted us a nonexclusive, royalty-free license to use the Pete&nbsp;&amp;
Shorty&#146;s mark in connection with a restaurant, bar and lounge at the Hooters
Casino Hotel.&#160; Pursuant to the license
agreement, we can also use the mark in connection with affiliated merchandise,
entertainment and casino services.&#160;
However, Pete&nbsp;&amp; Shorty&#146;s,&nbsp;Inc. maintains the right to
obtain federal and/or state registrations for any and all additional services,
other than restaurant, bar and cocktail lounge services, which we provide at
the Hooters Casino Hotel.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Employees</font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of December&nbsp;31, 2007, we had 966
employees.&#160; Most of our employees are not
covered by a collective bargaining agreement.&#160;
On March&nbsp;9, 2007, all 22 employees in the engineering department voted
to be represented by the Operating Engineers Local #501 and Teamsters #995
jointly in collective bargaining negotiations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Regulation and Licensing</font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The ownership and operation of casino gaming
facilities in Nevada are subject to the Nevada Gaming Control Act and the
regulations promulgated thereunder (&#147;Nevada Act&#148;), and various local
regulations.&#160; In addition, our gaming
operations are subject to the licensing and regulatory control of the </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Nevada Gaming
Commission (&#147;Nevada Commission&#148;), the Nevada State Gaming Control Board (&#147;Nevada
Board&#148;), and the Clark County Liquor and Gaming Licensing Board (&#147;CCLGLB&#148;
together with the Nevada Commission and the Nevada Board, the &#147;Nevada Gaming
Authorities&#148;)</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">.&#160; We received
our license from the Nevada Gaming Authorities as a limited-liability company
licensee in October&nbsp;2005 and are registered with the Nevada Commission as
a publicly traded corporation, referred to as a &#147;Registered Corporation&#148;.&#160; In addition, Florida Hooters LLC and EW
Common LLC are registered with the Nevada Gaming Authorities as intermediary
companies and licensed as the members of 155 East Tropicana, LLC.&#160; Hooters Gaming LLC, Lags Ventures, LLC, and
Eastern&nbsp;&amp; Western are registered with the Nevada Gaming Authorities as
holding companies and were found suitable as members of Florida Hooters LLC and
EW Common LLC, respectively.&#160; Also, Messrs.&nbsp;Lageschulte,
DiGiannantonio, Ranieri, Droste, Johnson, Blakely, S. Izumi, T. Izumi and
Hessling are individually licensed as our managers.&#160; Neil Kiefer and Deborah Pierce also hold
individual licenses as our officers.&#160;
Finally, because we pay a percentage of our net profits directly earned
from our gaming activities to Hooters Gaming Corporation, it is licensed by the
Nevada Gaming Authorities as well.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The laws, regulations and supervisory
procedures of the Nevada Gaming Authorities are based upon declarations of
public policy which are concerned with, among other things:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">the prevention of unsavory or unsuitable persons
from having a direct or indirect involvement with gaming at any time or in any
capacity;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">8</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='8',FILE='C:\JMS\wbruce\08-2823-1\task2827333\2823-1-bc.htm',USER='wbruce',CD='Mar 31 12:43 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">the establishment and maintenance of responsible
accounting practices and procedures;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">the maintenance of effective controls over the
financial practices of licensees, including the establishment of minimum
procedures for internal fiscal affairs and the safeguarding of assets and
revenues, providing reliable record keeping and requiring the filing of
periodic reports with the Nevada Gaming Authorities;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">the prevention of cheating and fraudulent practices;
and</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">providing a source of state and local revenues
through taxation and licensing fees.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Changes in these laws, regulations and
procedures could have an adverse effect on our business, financial condition
and results of operations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Corporations and other entities that operate
casinos in Nevada are required to be licensed by the Nevada Gaming
Authorities.&#160; A gaming license for such
activities requires the periodic payment of fees and taxes and is not transferable.&#160; As a Registered Corporation, we are required
to periodically submit detailed financial and operating reports to the Nevada
Commission and to furnish any other information that the Nevada Commission may
require.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Nevada Gaming Authorities may investigate
any individual who has a material relationship to or material involvement with
us in order to determine whether such individual is suitable or should be
licensed as a business associate of a gaming licensee.&#160; Our owners, officers, managers and certain
key employees are required to be licensed by the Nevada Gaming
Authorities.&#160; The Nevada Gaming
Authorities may deny an application for licensing for any cause that they deem
reasonable.&#160; A finding of suitability is
comparable to licensing, and both require submission of detailed personal and
financial information followed by a thorough investigation.&#160; Changes in licensed positions must be
reported to the Nevada Gaming Authorities and, in addition to their authority
to deny an application for a finding of suitability or licensure, the Nevada
Gaming Authorities have jurisdiction to disapprove a change in a corporate
position.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">If the Nevada Gaming Authorities were to find
an owner, officer, manager or key employee unsuitable for licensing or unsuitable
to continue having a relationship with us, we would have to sever all
relationships with that person.&#160; In
addition, the Nevada Commission may require us to terminate the employment of
any person who refuses to file appropriate applications.&#160; Determinations of suitability or of questions
pertaining to licensing are not subject to judicial review in Nevada.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As licensees, we are required to submit
detailed financial and operating reports to the Nevada Commission.&#160; Substantially all material loans, leases,
sales of securities and similar financing transactions by us must be reported
to the Nevada Commission.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">If it were determined that we violated the
Nevada gaming laws, our gaming licenses and registrations with the Nevada
Commission could be limited, conditioned, suspended or revoked, subject to
compliance with certain statutory and regulatory procedures.&#160; In addition, we and the persons involved
could be subject to substantial fines for each separate violation of the Nevada
laws at the discretion of the Nevada Commission.&#160; Further, the Nevada Commission could appoint
a supervisor to operate our gaming properties and, under certain circumstances,
earnings generated during the supervisor&#146;s appointment (except for the
reasonable rental value of our gaming properties) could be forfeited to the
State of Nevada.&#160; Limitation,
conditioning or suspension of any gaming license or the appointment of a
supervisor could (and revocation of any gaming license would) materially adversely
affect our operations.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">9</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='9',FILE='C:\JMS\wbruce\08-2823-1\task2827333\2823-1-bc.htm',USER='wbruce',CD='Mar 31 12:43 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Since we do not intend to register or sell
any of our equity securities, every holder of our equity securities is required
to be licensed by the Nevada Gaming Authorities.&#160; In addition, as 155 East Tropicana, LLC has
been licensed by the Nevada Gaming Authorities and has become a Registered
Corporation, none of its membership interests can be issued, sold, assigned,
transferred, pledged, or otherwise disposed of without the prior approval of
the Nevada Board and the Nevada Commission.&#160;
In addition, the pledge of our equity interests as security for the
Notes was approved by the Nevada Board and the Nevada Commission at the time
155 East Tropicana, LLC was licensed by and registered with the Nevada
Commission, which was necessary in order for such pledge to remain effective.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">If certain exemptions are granted under the
Nevada Act to a Registered Corporation, then any person who acquires more than
5% of a Registered Corporation&#146;s voting securities is required to report the
acquisition to the Nevada Commission.&#160;
The Nevada Act requires that beneficial owners of more than 10% of a
registered corporation&#146;s voting securities apply to the Nevada Commission for a
finding of suitability within 30&nbsp;days after the Chairman of the Nevada
Board mails the written notice requiring the filing for a finding of
suitability.&#160; Under certain
circumstances, an &#147;institutional investor,&#148; as defined in the regulations of
the Nevada Commission, which acquires more than 10%, but not more than 15%, of
our voting securities may apply to the Nevada Commission for a waiver of such
finding of suitability if that institutional investor holds the voting
securities for investment purposes only.&#160;
An institutional investor will not be deemed to hold voting securities
for investment purposes unless the voting securities were acquired and are held
in the ordinary course of business as an institutional investor and not for the
purpose of causing, directly or indirectly, the election of a majority of the
members of our board of managers, any change in our corporate charter, bylaws,
management, policies or operations, or any of our gaming affiliates, or any
other action which the Nevada Commission finds to be inconsistent with holding
our voting securities for investment purposes only.&#160; Activities which are not deemed to be
inconsistent with holding voting securities for investment purposes only
include:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">voting on all matters voted on by stockholders;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">making financial and other inquiries of management
of the type normally made by securities analysts for informational purposes and
not to cause a change in its management, policies or operations; and</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">other activities as the Nevada Commission may
determine to be consistent with such investment intent.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">If the beneficial holder of voting securities
who must be found suitable is a corporation, partnership or trust, it must
submit detailed business and financial information including a list of
beneficial owners.&#160; The applicant is
required to pay all costs of investigation.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Under the Nevada Act, under certain
circumstances, an institutional investor as defined in the Nevada Act, which
intends to acquire not more than 15% of any class of securities of a
privately-held corporation, limited partnership or limited-liability company
that is also a registered holder or intermediary company of the holder of a
gaming license, may apply to the Nevada Commission for a waiver of the usual
prior licensing or finding of suitability requirements if such institutional
investor holds such securities only for investment purposes.&#160; An institutional investor shall not be deemed
to hold securities only for investment purposes unless the securities were
acquired and are held in the ordinary course of business as an institutional
investor, do not give the institutional investor management authority, and do
not, directly or indirectly, allow the institutional investor to vote for the
election or appointment of members of the board of directors, a general partner
or manager, cause any change in the articles of organization, operating
agreement, other organic document, management, policies or operations, or cause
any other action that the Nevada Commission finds to be inconsistent with
holding </font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">10</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='10',FILE='C:\JMS\wbruce\08-2823-1\task2827333\2823-1-bc.htm',USER='wbruce',CD='Mar 31 12:43 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">securities only for
investment purposes.&#160; Activities that are
not deemed to be inconsistent with holding securities only for investment
purposes include:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">nominating any candidate for election or appointment
to the entity board of directors or equivalent in connection with a debt
restructuring;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">making financial and other inquiries of management
of the type normally made by securities analysts for informational purposes and
not to cause a change in the entity management, policies or operations; and</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">such other activities as the Nevada Commission may
determine to be consistent with such investment intent.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Any person who fails or refuses to apply for
a finding of suitability or a license within 30&nbsp;days after being ordered
to do so by the Nevada Commission or the Chairman of the Nevada Board, may be
found unsuitable.&#160; The same restrictions
apply to a record owner if the record owner, after request, fails to identify
the beneficial owner.&#160; Any stockholder
found unsuitable and who holds, directly or indirectly, any beneficial
ownership of the common stock of a registered corporation beyond the period of
time as may be prescribed by the Nevada Commission may be guilty of a criminal
offense.&#160; We may become subject to
disciplinary action if, after receipt of notice that a person is unsuitable to
be a stockholder or to have any other relationship with us, we:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">pay that person any dividend or interest upon voting
securities;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">allow that person to exercise, directly or
indirectly, any voting right conferred through securities held by that person;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">pay remuneration in any form to that person for
services rendered or otherwise; or</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">fail to pursue all lawful efforts to require the
unsuitable person to relinquish his voting securities for cash at fair market
value.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Additionally, the CCLGLB has taken the
position that it has the authority to approve all persons owning or controlling
the stock of any corporation controlling a gaming license.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We may be required to disclose to the Nevada
Board and the Nevada Commission the identities of all holders of our 8 &#190;%
Senior Secured Notes due 2012 (our &#147;Notes&#148;).&#160;
The Nevada Commission may, in its discretion, require the holder of any
debt security of a Registered Corporation, including our Notes, to file
applications, be investigated and be found suitable to own the debt security of
a Registered Corporation.&#160; If the Nevada
Commission determines that a person is unsuitable to own a debt security, then
pursuant to the Nevada Act, the Registered Corporation can be sanctioned,
including the loss of its approvals, if without the prior approval of the
Nevada Commission, it:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">pays to the unsuitable person any dividend,
interest, or any distribution whatsoever;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">recognizes any voting right by the unsuitable person
in connection with debt securities;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">pays the unsuitable person remuneration in any form;
or</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">makes any payment to the unsuitable person by way of
principal, redemption, conversion, exchange, liquidation or similar
transaction.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
