<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Limitations on Collateral&#151;<i>The collateral securing
the Notes does not include any of our gaming assets or certain other excluded assets.</i></font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Notes and any guarantees thereof are
secured by a security interest in substantially all of our and any guarantors&#146;
existing and future assets (other than certain excluded assets), a pledge of
our equity interests and the equity interests in any guarantors.&#160; As of December&nbsp;31, 2007, there are no
subsidiary guarantors.&#160; The collateral
does not include gaming licenses or any gaming equipment or other assets
securing furniture, fixtures and equipment financing, and there are no
restrictions on the amount of gaming equipment financed in this manner.&#160; The collateral also does not include
contracts, agreements, licenses (including gaming and liquor licenses) and
other rights that by their express terms prohibit the assignment thereof or the
grant of a security interest therein.&#160;
Some of these may be material to us and such exclusion could have a
material adverse effect on the value of the collateral.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Value of Collateral Securing the Notes&#151;<i>The fair
market value of the collateral securing the Notes may not be sufficient to pay
the amounts owed under the Notes.</i></font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The proceeds of any sale of collateral
following an event of default with respect to the Notes may not be sufficient
to satisfy, and may be substantially less than, amounts due on the Notes.&#160; No appraisal has been made of the
collateral.&#160; The total value of the
collateral is likely less than the amount due on the Notes.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The value of the collateral in the event of
liquidation will depend upon market and economic conditions, the availability
of buyers and similar factors.&#160; By its
nature, some or all of the collateral may not have a readily ascertainable
market value or may not be saleable or, if saleable, there may be substantial
delays in its liquidation.&#160; To the extent
that liens, security interests and other rights granted to other parties
(including the lenders under our Credit Facility) encumber assets owned by us,
those parties have or may exercise rights and remedies with respect to the
property subject to their liens that could adversely affect the value of that
collateral and the ability of the trustee under the indenture governing the
Notes or the holders of the Notes to realize or foreclose on that
collateral.&#160; Consequently, we cannot give
assurance that liquidating the collateral securing the Notes would produce
proceeds in an amount sufficient to pay any amounts due under the Notes after
also satisfying the obligations to pay any creditors with prior claims on the
collateral.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In addition, under the intercreditor
agreement between the trustees under the indenture governing the Notes and the
lenders under our Credit Facility, the right of the lenders to exercise
remedies with respect to the collateral could delay liquidation of the
collateral.&#160; The gaming licensing
process, along with bankruptcy laws and other laws relating to foreclosure and
sale, as discussed below, also could substantially delay or prevent the ability
of the trustee or any holder of the Notes to obtain the benefit of any
collateral securing the Notes.&#160; Such
delays could have a material adverse effect on the value of the collateral.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The indenture governing the Notes also
permits us to designate one or more of our restricted subsidiaries as an
unrestricted subsidiary.&#160; If we designate
a restricted subsidiary as an unrestricted subsidiary, all of the liens on any
collateral owned by the unrestricted subsidiary or any of its subsidiaries and
any guarantees of the Notes by the unrestricted subsidiary or any of its
subsidiaries will be released under the indenture but not necessarily under our
Credit Facility.&#160; Designation of an
unrestricted subsidiary will reduce the aggregate value of the collateral
securing the Notes to the extent that liens on the assets of the unrestricted
subsidiary and its subsidiaries are released.&#160;
In addition, the creditors of the unrestricted subsidiary and its
subsidiaries will have a prior claim (ahead of the Notes) on the assets of such
unrestricted subsidiary and its subsidiaries.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">21</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='21',FILE='C:\JMS\tmyhrea\08-2823-1\task2816268\2823-1-be.htm',USER='tmyhrea',CD='Mar 27 14:11 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">If the proceeds of any sale of collateral are
not sufficient to repay all amounts due on the Notes, the holders of the Notes
(to the extent not repaid from the proceeds of the sale of the collateral),
would have only an unsecured claim against our remaining assets.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Lien Subordination of Notes&#151;<i>The lien on the collateral
(other than the renovation disbursement and interest reserve accounts) securing
the Notes are contractually subordinated pursuant to the intercreditor
agreement to the liens securing our Credit Facility.</i></font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The security interests securing the Notes and
any guarantees of the Notes are contractually subordinated to up to
$15.0&nbsp;million principal amount of debt (plus related interest, fees,
indemnities, costs and expenses) that may be incurred under our Credit Facility,
pursuant to an intercreditor agreement between the trustee under the indenture
governing the Notes and the lenders under our Credit Facility.&#160; In addition, lenders of furniture, fixtures
and equipment financing and other purchase money debt have a security interest
in the assets securing that debt, although those assets, so long as they secure
only such debt, will not secure the Notes.&#160;
The indenture permits unlimited gaming furniture, fixtures and equipment
financing and up to $2.5&nbsp;million of other secured purchase money
financing.&#160; As a result, upon any
distribution to our creditors, whether or not in bankruptcy, liquidation,
reorganization or similar proceedings, or following acceleration of our debt or
an event of default under such debt, the lenders under our Credit Facility and
the lenders of furniture, fixtures and equipment financing and other purchase
money debt will be entitled to be repaid in full from the proceeds of the
assets (other than the renovation disbursement account) securing such debt
before any payment is made to holders of Notes from such proceeds.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Consequently, the liquidation of the
collateral securing the Notes may not produce proceeds in an amount sufficient
to pay the amounts due on the Notes after also satisfying the obligations to
pay our Credit Facility lenders and purchase money lenders, even if the fair
market value of the collateral securing the Notes would be sufficient, absent
our Credit Facility and purchase money debt, to pay all amounts due on the
Notes.&#160; If the proceeds of any sale of
collateral are not sufficient to repay all amounts due on the Notes, the
holders of the Notes (to the extent not repaid from the proceeds of the sale of
the collateral), would have only an unsecured claim against our remaining
assets.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mechanics&#146; Liens&#151;<i>Parties who have provided
services or supplies in connection with the renovation of our hotel casino may
have a lien on the project senior to the security interests securing the Notes
and any guarantees.</i></font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Nevada law provides contractors, subcontractors
and material suppliers with a lien on the property improved by their services
or supplies in order to secure their right to be paid.&#160; If these parties are not paid in full, they
may seek foreclosure on their liens.&#160; In
Nevada, the priority of all mechanics&#146; liens related to a particular
construction project relate back to the date on which work first commenced by
any contractor.&#160; Accordingly,
contractors, subcontractors and suppliers providing goods and services in connection
with the renovation of the hotel casino who after recordation of the security
interests securing the Notes otherwise comply with the applicable requirements
of Nevada law may have a lien on our hotel casino senior in priority to the
security interests, securing the Notes until they are paid in full.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In the event of liquidation, proceeds from
the sale of collateral will be used to pay the holders of any mechanics&#146; liens
then in existence before holders of the Notes.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">22</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='22',FILE='C:\JMS\tmyhrea\08-2823-1\task2816268\2823-1-be.htm',USER='tmyhrea',CD='Mar 27 14:11 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Limited Ability of Holders of the Notes to Exercise Remedies&#151;<i>The rights of the trustee and holders of Notes to exercise remedies
under the indenture governing the Notes are limited by an intercreditor
agreement between the trustee and the lenders under our Credit Facility.</i></font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">A number of the rights and remedies of the
trustee and the holders of the Notes are significantly limited under the
intercreditor agreement.&#160; For instance,
if the Notes become due and payable prior to the stated maturity or are not
paid in full at the stated maturity at a time during which we have debt
outstanding under our Credit Facility, the trustee will not have the right to
foreclose upon the collateral that also secures the obligations under our
Credit Facility (other than the renovation disbursement account) unless and
until the lenders under our Credit Facility fail to take steps to exercise
remedies with respect to or in connection with such collateral within 90 days
following notice to such lenders of the occurrence of an event of default under
the indenture governing the Notes.&#160; In
addition, the intercreditor agreement prevents the trustee and the holders of
the Notes from pursuing remedies with respect to certain of the collateral in
an insolvency proceeding.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The rights and remedies of the trustee also
are subject to additional practical limitations with respect to certain
collateral so long as such collateral also secures our Credit Facility.&#160; The trustee does not and will not have
possession (if certificated) of our equity interests in any guarantors or the
equity interests of 155 East Tropicana, LLC and 155 East Tropicana Finance
Corp. (even though such equity interests will constitute collateral), so long
as such equity interests also secure our Credit Facility.&#160; As a result, so long as such equity interests
also secure our Credit Facility, the trustee (although it will have a perfected
security interest in such equity interests) will not be able to take possession
of such equity interests upon the occurrence of an event of default under the
indenture governing the Notes.&#160; In
addition, the trustee does not have a perfected security interest in certain
other portions of the collateral&#151;including deposit accounts&#151;that consist of
assets that are not perfected by filing a Uniform Commercial Code financing
statement, or that require that the issuers or any guarantor, as applicable, to
cause the trustee to obtain &#147;control&#148; (as defined in the Uniform Commercial
Code) or possession of such assets (and, after commercially reasonable efforts,
the issuers or any such guarantor, as applicable, are unable to cause the
trustee to obtain such control or possession).</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Limited Ability of Holders of Notes to Realize on Collateral&#151;<i>Gaming laws, bankruptcy laws and other factors may delay or otherwise
impede the trustee&#146;s ability to foreclose on the collateral securing the Notes.</i></font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In addition to our intercreditor arrangements
with lenders under our Credit Facility, the gaming laws of the State of Nevada
and the licensing processes, along with other laws relating to foreclosure and
sale, could substantially delay or prevent the ability of the trustee or any
holder of the Notes to obtain the benefit of any collateral securing the
Notes.&#160; For example, if the trustee
sought to operate, or retain an operator for, any of our gaming properties, the
trustee would be required to obtain Nevada gaming licenses.&#160; Potential purchasers of our gaming properties
or the gaming equipment would also be required to obtain a Nevada gaming
license.&#160; This could limit the number of
potential purchasers in a sale of our gaming properties or gaming equipment,
which may delay the sale of and reduce the price paid for the collateral.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In addition, the trustee&#146;s ability to
repossess and dispose of collateral is subject to the procedural and other
restrictions of state real estate, commercial and gaming law, as well as the
prior approval of the lenders under our Credit Facility.&#160; Among other things, if the trustee did
conduct a foreclosure sale, and if the proceeds of the sale were insufficient,
after expenses, to pay all amounts due on the Notes, the trustee might, under
certain circumstances, be permitted to assert a deficiency claim against
us.&#160; There can be no assurance that the
trustee would be able to obtain a judgment for the deficiency or that we would
have sufficient other assets to pay a deficiency judgment.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">23</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='23',FILE='C:\JMS\tmyhrea\08-2823-1\task2816268\2823-1-be.htm',USER='tmyhrea',CD='Mar 27 14:11 2008' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Federal bankruptcy law also could impair the
trustee&#146;s ability to foreclose upon the collateral.&#160; If we or a guarantor become a debtor in a
case under the United States Bankruptcy Code, as amended, or the Bankruptcy
Code, the automatic stay, imposed by the Bankruptcy Code upon the commencement
of a case, would prevent the trustee from foreclosing upon the collateral or
(if the trustee has already taken control of the collateral) from disposing of
it, without prior bankruptcy court approval.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The bankruptcy court might permit us to
continue to use the collateral while the bankruptcy case was pending, even if
the Notes were then in default.&#160; Under
the Bankruptcy Code, holders of Notes and the trustee would be entitled to &#147;adequate
protection&#148; of the interest of holders of Notes in the collateral, if necessary
to protect against any diminution in value during the case.&#160; Because the Bankruptcy Code does not define &#147;adequate
protection,&#148; and because the bankruptcy court has broad discretion, however,
there can be no assurance that the court would require us to provide holders of
Notes with any form of &#147;adequate protection,&#148; or that any protection so ordered
would, in fact, be adequate.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In a bankruptcy case, the court would allow a
claim for all amounts due under the Notes, including all accrued and unpaid
interest through the date of bankruptcy.&#160;
Under the Bankruptcy Code, interest stops accruing on the date of
bankruptcy except under certain specified circumstances, and there can be no
assurance that the court would allow a claim for post-bankruptcy interest.&#160; If the court held that the value of the
collateral securing the Notes was less than the amount due, the trustee would
be permitted to assert a secured claim in an amount equal to the collateral&#146;s
value and an unsecured claim for the deficiency.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">For these and other reasons,
if we or our subsidiaries become debtors in cases under the Bankruptcy Code,
there can be no assurance:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">whether any payments under the Notes would be made;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">whether or when the trustee could foreclose upon or
sell the collateral;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">whether the term or other conditions of the Notes or
any rights of the holders could be altered in a bankruptcy case without the
trustee&#146;s or the investors&#146; consent;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">whether the trustee or investors would be able to
enforce the investors&#146; rights against the guarantors under their guarantees; or</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">whether or to what extent holders of the Notes would
be compensated for any delay in payment or decline in the collateral&#146;s value.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Finally, the trustee&#146;s ability to foreclose
on the collateral on behalf of the holders of Notes may be subject to the
consent of third parties, prior liens (as discussed above) and practical
problems associated with the realization of the trustee&#146;s security interest in
the collateral.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Restrictive Covenants&#151;<i>The indenture governing
the Notes and our Credit Facility contain covenants that significantly restrict
our operations.</i></font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The indenture governing the Notes and the
agreement governing our Credit Facility contain, and any other future debt
agreements may contain, numerous covenants imposing financial and operating
restrictions on our business.&#160; These
restrictions may affect our ability to operate our business, may limit our
ability to take advantage of potential business opportunities as they arise and
may adversely affect the conduct of our current business.&#160; These covenants place restrictions on our
ability and the ability of our restricted subsidiaries to, among other things:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">pay dividends, redeem stock or make other
distributions or restricted payments;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">24</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='24',FILE='C:\JMS\wbruce\08-2823-1\task2826943\2823-1-bg.htm',USER='wbruce',CD='Mar 31 11:29 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">incur debt or issue preferred equity interests;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">make certain investments;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">create liens;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">agree to payment restrictions affecting the
guarantors;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">consolidate or merge;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">sell or otherwise transfer or dispose of assets,
including equity interests of our restricted subsidiaries;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">enter into transactions with our affiliates;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">designate our subsidiaries as unrestricted
subsidiaries; and</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">use the proceeds of permitted sales of our assets.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our failure to comply with our debt-related
obligations could result in an event of default under the Notes and our other
debt.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Ability to Repurchase Notes&#151;<i>Our ability to repurchase
the Notes upon a change of control or an asset sale may be limited.</i></font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Upon the occurrence of specific &#147;change of
control&#148; events and &#147;asset sale&#148; events, in each case as defined in the
indenture governing the Notes, we will be required to offer to repurchase all
outstanding Notes at 101% of the principal amount (in the case of a change of
control) and 100% of the principal amount (in the case of an asset sale), in
each case, plus accrued and unpaid interest to the date of repurchase.&#160; The lenders under our Credit Facility will
have a similar right to be repaid upon a change of control.&#160; Any of our future debt agreements may contain
similar provisions with respect to a change of control or asset sale.&#160; However, we may not have sufficient funds at
the time of the change of control or asset sale to make the required repurchase
of Notes or repayment of our other debt.&#160;
The terms of our Credit Facility also will limit our ability to purchase
Notes until all debt under our Credit Facility is paid in full.&#160; Any of our future debt agreements may contain
similar restrictions.&#160; If we fail to
repurchase any Notes submitted in a change of control or asset sale offer, it
would constitute an event of default under the indenture which would, in turn,
constitute an event of default under our Credit Facility and could constitute
an event of default under our other debt, even if the change of control itself
would not cause a default.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Important corporate events, such as
takeovers, recapitalizations or similar transactions, may not constitute a
change of control under the indenture governing the Notes and thus not permit
the holders of the Notes to require us to repurchase or redeem the Notes.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Required Regulatory Redemption&#151;<i>Noteholders may be
required to be licensed by a gaming authority and, if not so licensed, their
Notes will be subject to redemption.</i></font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We are required to notify the Nevada Board as
to the identity of, and may be required to submit background information
regarding, each record or beneficial owner of the Notes.&#160; For purposes of these rules, &#147;beneficial
interest&#148; includes all direct and indirect forms of ownership or control,
voting power or investment power held through any contract, lien, lease,
partnership, stockholding, syndication, joint venture, understanding,
relationship, present or reversionary right, title or interest, or
otherwise.&#160; The Nevada Board may
determine that holders of the Notes have a &#147;beneficial interest&#148; in the
issuers.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">25</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='25',FILE='C:\JMS\wbruce\08-2823-1\task2826943\2823-1-bg.htm',USER='wbruce',CD='Mar 31 11:29 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">If the Nevada Gaming Authorities require any
person, including a record or beneficial owner of the Notes, to be licensed,
qualified or found suitable, that person must apply for a license,
qualification or finding of suitability within the time period specified by the
gaming authority.&#160; The person would be
required to pay all costs of obtaining a license, qualification or finding of
suitability.&#160; If a holder of the Notes is
unable or unwilling to obtain such license, qualification or finding of
suitability, such agencies and authorities may not grant us or, if already
granted, may suspend or revoke our licenses unless we terminate our
relationship with the holder.&#160; Under
these circumstances, we would be required to repurchase such Notes.&#160; There can be no assurance that we will have
sufficient funds or otherwise will be able to repurchase any or all of the
Notes.&#160; See &#147;Item 1. Business&#151;Regulation
and Licensing.&#148;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Fraudulent Transfer&#151;<i>Under certain
circumstances, a court could cancel the obligations under the Notes or any
guarantees and the liens that secure the Notes and guarantees.</i></font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Unless designated as an unrestricted
subsidiary, each and any domestic subsidiary we form or acquire will be
required to guarantee the Notes and grant a security interest in certain of its
assets (junior to the security interest granted to the lenders under our Credit
Facility) to secure its guarantee.&#160; Under
federal bankruptcy law and comparable provisions of state and federal
nonbankruptcy fraudulent transfer laws, under certain circumstances a court
could avoid (i.e., cancel) a guarantee and the security interest in the
guarantor&#146;s assets, and order the return of any payments made thereunder to the
guarantor or to a fund for the benefit of its other creditors.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">A court might take these actions if it found
that when the guarantor entered into its guarantee (or, in some jurisdictions,
when payments became due on its guarantee), (i)&nbsp;it received less than
reasonably equivalent value or fair consideration for its guarantee, and (ii)&nbsp;any
of the following conditions was then satisfied:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">the guarantor was insolvent or rendered insolvent by
reason of incurring its obligations under its guarantee or granting a security
interest in its assets;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">the guarantor was engaged in a business or
transaction for which its remaining assets constituted unreasonably small
capital; or</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">the guarantor intended to incur, or believed (or
reasonably should have believed) that it would incur, debts beyond its ability
to pay as those debts matured.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In applying these factors, a court would
likely find that a subsidiary guarantor did not receive fair consideration or
reasonably equivalent value for its guarantee, except to the extent that it
benefited directly or indirectly from the Notes&#146; issuance.&#160; The determination of whether a subsidiary was
or was rendered &#147;insolvent&#148; would vary depending on the law of the jurisdiction
being applied.&#160; Generally, an entity
would be considered insolvent if the sum of its debts (including contingent or
unliquidated debts) is greater than all of its property at a fair valuation or
if the present fair salable value of its assets is less than the amount that
will be required to pay its probable liability on its existing debts (including
contingent or unliquidated debts) as they become absolute and matured.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">A court might also avoid a guarantor&#146;s
guarantee and the security interest in its assets, if the court concluded that
the guarantor entered into the guarantee with actual intent to hinder, delay,
or defraud creditors.&#160; If a court avoided
a guarantor&#146;s guarantee, you would no longer have a claim against that
subsidiary, and the claims of creditors of the subsidiary generally would be
entitled to payment in full before the subsidiary paid any dividends or made any
distributions to us for the purpose of our satisfying any claims under the
Notes.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">26</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='26',FILE='C:\JMS\wbruce\08-2823-1\task2826943\2823-1-bg.htm',USER='wbruce',CD='Mar 31 11:29 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Similarly, under federal bankruptcy law and
comparable provisions of state and federal nonbankruptcy fraudulent transfer
laws, under certain circumstances a court could avoid (i.e., cancel) the Notes
and the security interest in an issuer&#146;s assets, and order the return of any
payments made thereunder to the issuer or to a fund for the benefit of its
other creditors.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">A court might take these actions if it found
that when an issuer issued the Notes, (i)&nbsp;it received less than reasonably
equivalent value or fair consideration, and (ii)&nbsp;any of the following
conditions was then satisfied:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">the issuer was insolvent or rendered insolvent by
reason of incurring obligations under the Notes or granting a security interest
in its assets;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">the issuer was engaged in a business or transaction
for which its remaining assets constituted unreasonably small capital; or</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">the issuer intended to incur, or believed (or
reasonably should have believed) that it would incur, debts beyond its ability
to pay as those debts matured.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We used a substantial portion of the proceeds
from the Notes to repay amounts due under existing indebtedness.&#160; To the extent that we used the proceeds of
that indebtedness to make payments to Eastern&nbsp;&amp; Western (the parent of
one of our members), in connection with our acquisition of our hotel casino, a
court might find that we did not receive reasonably equivalent value or fair
consideration for incurring our new debt obligations, under the Notes, to repay
our existing indebtedness.&#160;
Alternatively, a court might find that repayment of the existing
indebtedness, which is guaranteed by certain of our affiliates, was for the
benefit of these affiliates.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Regardless of the factors identified above, a
court might also avoid the obligations of the issuers under the Notes and the
security interest in their assets and order the return of any payments made
under the Notes either to the issuers or to a fund for the benefit of the
issuers&#146; other creditors if the court found that the issuers incurred the
obligations under the Notes with actual intent to hinder, delay, or defraud
creditors of the issuers.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Redemption</font></b><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#151;<b><i style="font-weight:bold;">We may choose to redeem the Notes at anytime on or
after April&nbsp;1, 2009.</i></b></font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Notes are redeemable at
our option on or after April&nbsp;1, 2009.&#160;
This means that we have the right, without a holder&#146;s consent, to redeem
or &#147;call&#148; all or a portion of the Notes at any time or on or after April&nbsp;1,
2009.&#160; This does not mean that holders
have a similar right to require us to repay the Notes.&#160; We may choose to redeem the Notes, for
example, when prevailing interest rates are lower than the rate then borne by
the Notes.&#160; In that case holders would
not be able to reinvest the redemption proceeds in a comparable security at an
effective interest rate as high as the interest rate on the Notes being
redeemed.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Any such redemption right also may adversely
impact a holder&#146;s ability to sell the Notes, and/or the price at which holders
could sell the Notes, as the redemption date approaches.&#160; Holders are advised to consult with a
competent professional on related consequences of purchasing redeemable notes before
purchasing them.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h2 style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-transform:uppercase;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;text-transform:none;">ITEM 1B.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; UNRESOLVED STAFF COMMENTS.</font></b><a name="Item1b_UnresolvedStaffComments__140738"></a></h2>

<h2 style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-transform:uppercase;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></h2>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Not applicable.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">27</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='27',FILE='C:\JMS\wbruce\08-2823-1\task2826943\2823-1-bg.htm',USER='wbruce',CD='Mar 31 11:29 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h2 style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-.75in;text-transform:uppercase;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;text-transform:none;">ITEM 2.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;text-transform:none;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;text-transform:none;">PROPERTIES.</font><a name="Item2_Properties__140741"></a></h2>

<h2 style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-.75in;text-transform:uppercase;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></h2>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our principal properties currently consist of
the following:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Hooters Casino Hotel.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; We own the approximately seven-acre site on
which the Hooters Casino Hotel is located in Las Vegas, Nevada.&#160; The Hooters Casino Hotel consists of an
approximately 29,000 square-foot casino with 696 guest rooms located in the
hotel casino building and within two towers.&#160;
In addition, a six-level, 556-space parking garage is located adjacent
to the hotel casino, and 202 additional surface parking spaces are located on
the site.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Executive Offices and Conference
Facility.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; We own an
approximately two-acre site consisting of a one-level, 17,472 square-foot
executive office building and conference facility and a 183-space parking lot.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our Credit Facility and our Notes are secured
by liens on all of our real property.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h2 style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-.75in;text-transform:uppercase;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;text-transform:none;">ITEM 3.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;text-transform:none;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;text-transform:none;">LEGAL PROCEEDINGS.</font><a name="Item3_LegalProceedings__140744"></a></h2>

<h2 style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-.75in;text-transform:uppercase;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></h2>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">From time to time, we are a party to various
claims arising in the normal course of business.&#160; Management believes, however, that there are
no proceedings pending or threatened against us which, if determined adversely,
would have a material adverse effect on our financial condition, results of
operations or liquidity.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h2 style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-.75in;text-transform:uppercase;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;text-transform:none;">ITEM 4.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;text-transform:none;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;text-transform:none;">SUBMISSION OF MATTERS
TO A VOTE OF SECURITY HOLDERS.</font><a name="Item4_SubmissionOfMattersToAVoteO_140748"></a></h2>

<h2 style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-.75in;text-transform:uppercase;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></h2>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Not
applicable.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h1 style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">PART&nbsp;II<a name="Partii_140750"></a></font></b></h1>

<h1 style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></h1>

<h2 style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-.75in;text-transform:uppercase;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;text-transform:none;">ITEM 5.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;text-transform:none;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;text-transform:none;">MARKET FOR
REGISTRANT&#146;S COMMON EQUITY AND RELATED STOCKHOLDER MATTERS AND ISSUER PURCHASES
OF EQUITY SECURITIES.</font><a name="Item5_MarketForRegistrantsCommonE_140755"></a></h2>

<h2 style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-.75in;text-transform:uppercase;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></h2>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Not applicable.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">28</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>

<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h2 style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-.75in;text-transform:uppercase;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;text-transform:none;">ITEM 6.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;text-transform:none;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;text-transform:none;">SELECTED FINANCIAL
DATA.</font><a name="Item6_SelectedFinancialData__140805"></a></h2>

<h2 style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-.75in;text-transform:uppercase;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></h2>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.3pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
historical selected financial data of 155 East Tropicana, LLC and of the H&#244;tel
San R&#233;mo Casino and Resort set forth below should be read in conjunction with &#147;Item
7. Management&#146;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of
Operations&#148; and &#147;Item 8. Financial Statements and Supplementary Data.&#148;&#160; The statement of operations data for the
periods ended December&nbsp;31, 2007, 2006 and 2005, and the balance sheet data
at December&nbsp;31, 2007 and 2006 of 155 East Tropicana, LLC are derived from,
and are qualified by reference to, the audited financial statements included in
&#147;Item 8. Financial Statements and Supplementary Data.&#148;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.3pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="1" width="25%" noshade color="black" align="left"></div>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We obtained our gaming and
liquor licenses, thereby completing the final stage of the acquisition of
substantially all the assets and certain liabilities of the hotel casino, in October&nbsp;2005.&#160; The results of operation reflect the casino
and hotel operations from November&nbsp;1, 2005 through December&nbsp;1, 2005.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(2)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We were considered a
development stage company until November&nbsp;1, 2005.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(3)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net revenues for 2005
include related party lease income of $5.4 million received from Eastern&nbsp;&amp;
Western for the lease of the hotel casino from January&nbsp;1, 2005 through October&nbsp;31,
2005.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(4)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Excludes depreciation
expense, pre-opening expense, related party royalties expense, and loss on
disposal of assets.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(5)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Interest expense, net of
interest income.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(6)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Includes current portion of
long-term debt.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">29</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.3pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following historical information of the H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo Casino and
Resort is derived from its audited financial statements for 2003 through
2005.&#160; H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo Casino and Resort&#146;s
audited financial statements and related notes thereto as of October&nbsp;31,
2005 and for the year then ended appear elsewhere in this Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10-K.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="9%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:9.98%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">4,824</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:3.32%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="11%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:11.56%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">49,103</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.82%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="51%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:51.14%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Division equity (deficit)</font></p>

  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3,860</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:3.32%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">7,473</font></p>

  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(15,791</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.82%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>

<h3 style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 5.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="1" width="25%" noshade color="black" align="left">

</font></b></h3>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The completion of the final
stage of the acquisition of the H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo Casino and Resort occurred in October&nbsp;2005,
upon receipt of our gaming and liquor licenses.&#160;
The results of operation reflect the casino and hotel operations from January&nbsp;1,
2005 through October&nbsp;31, 2005 when the</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">30</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='30',FILE='C:\JMS\wbruce\08-2823-1\task2826943\2823-1-bg.htm',USER='wbruce',CD='Mar 31 11:29 2008' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo Casino and
Resort ceased operations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(2)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In connection with the August&nbsp;3,
2004 contribution of the H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo Casino and Resort real property and
non-gaming assets to us, Eastern&nbsp;&amp; Western entered into lease
arrangements to lease back the hotel casino until we received all of the
necessary government and regulatory approvals to operate the hotel casino.&#160; In October&nbsp;2005, we received the
necessary gaming and liquor licenses; therefore, the lease arrangements were
terminated on October&nbsp;31, 2005.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following selected quarterly financial data of
155 East Tropicana, LLC for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2007 and 2006 is
derived from the quarterly condensed consolidated financial statements of 155
East Tropicana, LLC . The financial data for the fourth quarter of 2007 and
2006 are derived from the annual consolidated financial statements of 155 East
Tropicana, LLC included in &#147;Item 8 Financial Statements and Supplementary Data.&#148;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
