  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.92%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="14%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:14.08%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(4,856</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.92%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="14%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:14.1%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1,633</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.92%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="14%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:14.1%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(529</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.92%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="14%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:14.16%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">824</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.92%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="14%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:14.1%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(6,194</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.8%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="18%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:18.06%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net loss</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.92%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="14%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:14.08%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(7,596</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.92%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="14%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:14.1%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(4,735</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.92%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="14%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:14.1%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(3,737</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.92%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="14%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:14.16%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(2,373</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.92%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="14%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:14.1%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(18,441</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="1" width="25%" noshade color="black" align="left"></div>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net revenues issued in
previous quarters have been reduced for the reclassification (from casino
expense) of slot participation fees.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h2 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-.75in;text-transform:uppercase;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;text-transform:none;">ITEM 7.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;text-transform:none;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;text-transform:none;">MANAGEMENT&#146;S
DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATION.</font><a name="Item7_ManagementsDiscussionAndAna_185801"></a></h2>

<h2 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-.75in;text-transform:uppercase;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></h2>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
following discussion should be read in conjunction with, and is qualified in
its entirety by, the financial statements and related notes thereto and other
financial information included in &#147;Item 8. Financial Statements and
Supplementary Data.&#148;&#160; Certain statements
in this Management&#146;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results
of Operations are forward-looking.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Overview for 155 East Tropicana, LLC</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">155
East Tropicana, LLC (&#147;we&#148;, &#147;us&#148;, &#147;our&#148;, or &#147;155&#148;) was formed on June&nbsp;17,
2004 to acquire the H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo Casino and Resort (&#147;H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo&#148;), from
Eastern&nbsp;&amp; Western Hotel Corporation (&#147;Eastern&nbsp;&amp; Western&#148;).
Our common membership interests are held two-thirds through Florida Hooters LLC
and one-third through EW Common LLC.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">31</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='31',FILE='C:\JMS\wbruce\08-2823-1\task2827333\2823-1-bi.htm',USER='wbruce',CD='Mar 31 12:48 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Florida
Hooters LLC is a joint venture between Hooters Gaming LLC and Lags Ventures,
LLC. The owners of Hooters Gaming LLC, which include most of the original
founders of the Hooters brand, hold licenses to sell wholesale foods and
calendars and to operate hotel casinos in Nevada and Hooters restaurants in
Tampa Bay, Florida, Chicago, Illinois, and downtown Manhattan in New York. Lags
Ventures, LLC is owned by a holder of the license rights to Hooters restaurants
in South Florida and the State of Nevada. Pursuant to these license rights, the
owners of Florida Hooters LLC operate 40 Hooters restaurants, publish Hooters
calendars, and operate a Hooters foods business. The owner of Lags Ventures,
LLC is also the founder of the Dan Marino concept restaurants and owns and
operates 2 Dan Marino concept restaurants.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Eastern&nbsp;&amp;
Western owns 90% of EW Common LLC, while our President owns the balance.
Eastern&nbsp;&amp; Western owned the H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo from November&nbsp;1988
until our acquisition of the H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo in 2004.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our
affiliates have granted us assignments of certain license agreements pertaining
to the use of the Hooters brand as well as the Dan Marino, &#147;13&#148; Martini Bar and
Pete&nbsp;&amp; Shorty&#146;s concept restaurants, which will allow us to operate
the Hooters Casino Hotel. The original founders of the Hooters brand sold the
trademark rights (excluding certain rights they retained for themselves) to
Hooters of America in 2001. As a result, Hooters of America is the trademark
owner of the Hooters brand and the operator and franchisor of Hooters
restaurants. Pursuant to the Hooters license assignment, we are required to pay
Hooters of America a royalty fee, which totaled approximately $1.2 million for
the year ending December&nbsp;31, 2007. Aside from the abovementioned royalty
fee, we are not otherwise affiliated with Hooters of America.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In
August&nbsp;2004, we agreed to the acquisition of the real property and other
assets of the H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo for approximately $74.6 million including
transaction costs and expenses, and as adjusted for final purchase price
adjustments.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On
March&nbsp;29, 2005, we issued $130.0&nbsp;million aggregate principal amount
of 8&#190;% Senior Secured Notes due 2012, or the old notes, in a private placement.
The old notes were subsequently exchanged with new notes, or (&#147;Notes&#148;),
registered under the Securities Act of 1933 on Form&nbsp;S-4. Interest payments
on the Notes are due semi-annually, on each April&nbsp;1 and October&nbsp;1. We
used the proceeds from the offering to refinance existing indebtedness, and
used the remaining proceeds (together with cash from operations and proceeds
from equipment financing) to renovate the hotel casino and to provide working
capital.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In
connection with the offering, we formed a wholly owned subsidiary, 155 East
Tropicana Finance Corp., solely for facilitating the offering as a co-issuer of
the old notes.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We
also entered into a $15.0&nbsp;million senior secured credit facility (&#147;Credit
Facility&#148;) concurrently with the offering. At December&nbsp;31, 2007, $6.3
million was outstanding on the Credit Facility.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Prior
to November&nbsp;1, 2005 we conducted no business operations other than in
connection with the acquisition and subsequent leasing of the H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo.
Through October&nbsp;31, 2005, Eastern&nbsp;&amp; Western held the gaming
license in Nevada and owned all gaming assets by the H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo. Under a
casino lease and hotel lease, Eastern&nbsp;&amp; Western operated the H&#244;tel San
R&#233;mo. After obtaining the necessary gaming and liquor licenses to operate the
hotel casino in October&nbsp;2005, we assumed operations of the hotel casino on
November&nbsp;1, 2005 and the leases with Eastern&nbsp;&amp; Western were
terminated.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">32</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='32',FILE='C:\JMS\wbruce\08-2823-1\task2827333\2823-1-bi.htm',USER='wbruce',CD='Mar 31 12:48 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Casino
revenue is derived primarily from patrons wagering on slot machines, table
games and other gaming activities. Table games include blackjack, craps,
roulette, and specialty games. Casino revenue is defined as the win from gaming
activities, computed as the difference between gaming wins and losses, not the
total amount wagered. &#147;Table game drop&#148; and &#147;slot handle&#148; are casino industry
specific terms used to identify the amount wagered by patrons for a casino
table game or slot machine, respectively. &#147;Table game hold&#148; and &#147;slot hold&#148;
represent the percentage of the total amount wagered by the patron that the
casino has won. Hold is derived by dividing the amount won by the casino (&#147;table
game win&#148; and &#147;slot win&#148;) by the amount wagered by the patron. Casino revenue
is recognized at the end of each gaming day.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Casino
revenues vary from time to time due to general economic conditions, table game
hold, slot hold, and occupancy percentages at the Hooters Casino Hotel and
other hotels in Las Vegas. Casino revenues also vary depending upon the amount
of gaming activity as well as variations in the odds for different games of
chance. Casino revenues, room revenues, food and beverage revenues, and other
revenues vary due to general economic conditions and competition.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Room&nbsp;revenue
is derived from rooms and suites rented to guests. &#147;Average daily rate&#148; is an
industry specific term used to define the average amount of revenue per rented
room per day. &#147;Occupancy percentage&#148; defines the total percentage of rooms
occupied, and is computed by dividing the number of rooms occupied by the total
number of rooms available. Room&nbsp;revenue is recognized at the time the room
is provided to the guest.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Food,
beverage and entertainment revenues are derived from food and beverage sales in
the food, bar and entertainment outlets of the hotel casino, including
restaurants, room service, bars, entertainment showroom and banquets. Food,
beverage, and entertainment revenue is recognized at the time food and/or
beverage is provided to the guest. &#147;Covers&#148; are the number of patrons served in
a food outlet. &#147;Average check&#148; is the average amount of food and beverage
revenue charged to patrons on their restaurant checks.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
following table summarizes the combined results of operations of 155 East
Tropicana, LLC and the results of operations of the H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo as if there
had been no change in ownership during 2005 (in thousands):</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">33</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='33',FILE='C:\JMS\wbruce\08-2823-1\task2827333\2823-1-bi.htm',USER='wbruce',CD='Mar 31 12:48 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">
 <tr>
  <td width="29%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:29.1%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.94%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="11%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:11.88%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">155 E. Tropicana, LLC</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.92%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="11%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:11.88%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">155 E. Tropicana, LLC</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.92%;">

  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1,976</font></p>

  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">-100.0</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.66%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">%</font></p>

<h2 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-transform:uppercase;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></h2>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Comparison of Year Ended December&nbsp;31, 2007 with the Year ended December&nbsp;31,
2006</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In
comparing the ended December&nbsp;31, 2007 to 2006, it should be noted that the
Hooters Casino Hotel was open for business for the full year ended December&nbsp;31,
2007. The results of operations for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006
include the month of January&nbsp;2006 when the property was essentially closed
for remodeling and the first eleven months of operations of the Hooters Casino
Hotel from February&nbsp;3, 2006 through December&nbsp;31, 2006.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In spite of the negative
effect of remodeling in January&nbsp;2006, net operating revenues for the year
ended December&nbsp;31, 2007 were $65.0 million, a decrease of $1.7 million or
3%, from $66.7 million generated during the previous year. A decrease of $0.9
million in net revenue was the result of increased promotional allowances
because of increased slot club cash back of $0.4 million and other
complimentaries given away. Entertainment complimentaries totaled $0.5 million
given away to promote trips to the property&#160;
The media and excitement that accompanied the grand opening of the
Hooter&#146;s Casino Hotel in February&nbsp;2006 caused a three month spike in
revenues resulting from trial visitations.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">34</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='34',FILE='C:\JMS\wbruce\08-2823-1\task2827333\2823-1-bi.htm',USER='wbruce',CD='Mar 31 12:48 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The decline in gross revenues in 2007 is largely
attributable to a decline in casino revenues.&#160;
Table games and slot revenues both declined, due to a decrease in casino
table drop and coin-in volumes.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Casino.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;"> Casino revenues decreased by $2.3 million or 8.8%
to $23.5 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2007, compared to $25.8
million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006.&#160; This decline in casino revenue is the result
of a general decline in the property&#146;s visitor traffic.&#160; According to the Nevada Gaming Control Board,
although the Las Vegas Strip in total enjoyed a marginal increase in gaming
revenue of 2.1% for 2007 compared to 2006, the smaller Strip properties, such
as we are, reported declines in gaming revenue.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Table
games revenue was $9.5 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2007, a
decrease of $1.5 million or 14% compared to table game revenue of $11.0 million
from the year ending December&nbsp;31, 2006. During the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2007, table game volume (or drop) was reduced by $7.4 million or 11.0%, in
addition to a lower hold percentage. The hold percentage for table game win was
16.8% in 2007 compared to 17.1% for the year ended 2006.&#160; The table games generated an average win per
table of $873 per day for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2007 as compared to
$1,013 per day after the opening of the Hooters Casino on February&nbsp;3
through December&nbsp;31, 2006.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">According
to Gaming Revenue Reports published by the Nevada Gaming Control Board, the
average win per table for the five Las Vegas Strip casinos with average gaming
revenue of $12 to $36 million for 2007 was $773 and table game revenue fell by
$4.4 million or 13.6% in 2007 as compared to 2006.&#160; The average win per table game for the seven
Las Vegas Strip casinos with an average gaming revenue of $36 to $72 million
was $997 in 2007 and table game revenue fell by $8.1 million or 7.4% in 2007 as
compared to 2006.&#160; Our table games win
per table for 2007 is within industry norms, although (as occurred in a
slightly lesser degree in comparable Strip properties), our table games revenue
has dropped from 2006.&#160;&#160; We believe that
this is indicative of an overall softening of the Las Vegas Strip casino
revenues that has affected smaller properties the hardest.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160;Slot revenue (net of participation fees) was
$13.2 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2007, which was a decrease
of $1.1 million or 8.0% compared to $14.3 million in the same period in 2006.
With the exception of $0.1 million, the entire slot revenue for 2006 was
generated after grand opening through December&nbsp;31, 2006.&#160; The average win per machine per day (before
deducting participation fees) was $62 for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2007
as compared to $73 from February&nbsp;3, 2006 to December&nbsp;31, 2006. Our
decrease in slot revenue is not inconsistent with other competitors.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">According
to Nevada Gaming published reports, the average win per unit for the five Las
Vegas Strip casinos with an average gaming revenue of $12 to $36 million for
2007 was $73 in 2007 and slot revenue fell by $9.5 million or 10.4% in 2007 as
compared to 2006.&#160; The average win per
unit for the seven Las Vegas Strip casinos with an average gaming revenue of
$36 to $72 million was $116 for 2007 and slot revenue fell by $6.7 million or
2.4% in 2007 as compared to 2006.&#160;&#160;&#160; We
believe that our slot revenue win per unit can be increased to a more
competitive level in future periods by focusing on special slot promotions,
direct marketing programs and other programs targeted to increase casino
traffic.&#160; Those programs were instituted
in late 2007 and early 2008.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Casino expenses of $13.4
million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2007 were up $0.3 million from
$13.1 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006 due to increased casino
marketing costs, offset partially by decreased operating expenses on the casino
floor. The profit margin for casino operations</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">35</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='35',FILE='C:\JMS\wbruce\08-2823-1\task2827333\2823-1-bi.htm',USER='wbruce',CD='Mar 31 12:48 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">decreased from 49.3% during the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2006 to 42.9% during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2007.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Food, beverage, and entertainment. </font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160;Food, beverage, and entertainment revenue
decreased $0.3 million or 1.3% to $23.3 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2007 compared to $23.6 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006.
Beverage revenue of $8.7 million (which includes complimentary beverages)
decreased by $1.2 million, or 13%, from $10.0 million during the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2006. This decrease is due largely to the closing of the &#147;13&#148; Martini Bar and a
decline in other bar revenues.&#160; Our
showroom, which opened mid April&nbsp;2007, generated $0.8 million in
entertainment ticket revenues for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2007, of
which $0.5 million was complimentary revenues.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Food
revenue increased from $13.6 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006
to $13.7 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2007 an increase of $0.1
million or 1%. The increase was due to a $1.1 million food revenue increase in
Marino&#146;s. Marino&#146;s offered a new dinner special, which generated additional
revenue.&#160; In addition, the Dam 24-hour
coffee shop was closed on October&nbsp;24, 2007 and Marino began operations at
that time as a 24-hour restaurant.&#160; For
the months of November&nbsp;and December&nbsp;2007, Marino&#146;s revenue increased
$0.5 million or 194%, largely due to this change in operations.&#160; The increase in Marino&#146;s food revenue was
partially offset by a decrease of $0.5 million at the Dam 24-hour coffee shop
for 2007 compared to 2006.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160;Food, beverage, and entertainment expenses
decreased from $18.9 million during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006 to
$17.7 million during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2007, a decrease of $1.2
million. The profit margin for food, beverage, and entertainment operations
increased to 24% for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2007 from 19.7% in the
same period in 2006 due to cost control. We saved $0.4 million in food
operating expenses in November&nbsp;and December&nbsp;2007 as a result of
closing the Dam 24-hour restaurant on October&nbsp;24, 2007.&#160; We generated these savings because we were
able to consolidate our front-of-the-house serving staff and close kitchen operations
for the Dam restaurant to more efficiently operate out of the Marino&#146;s
kitchen.&#160; The additional savings were the
result of various cost savings that were initiated throughout the year such as
reducing staffing levels to match business levels, cutting entertainment costs,
closing sushi and deli operations and reducing other miscellaneous expenses.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Hotel and other. </font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160;Hotel
and other revenue (which includes hotel room revenue, retail, spa, and other
miscellaneous revenue) increased $1.8 million to $24.4 million for the year
ended December&nbsp;31, 2007 from $22.6 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2006.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Room&nbsp;revenue
was $18.3 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2007 compared to $16.2
million in the same period in 2006. This increase was a result of an increase
in occupancy, offset by a decrease in average daily room rates. Average daily
room rates decreased slightly from $91 for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2006 to $74 for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2007, while occupancy rates
increased from 78.6% for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006 to 89.6% for the
year ended December&nbsp;31, 2007. Occupancy rates increased largely because of
successful targeted marketing efforts in southern California and increased
sales through the wholesalers, internet providers and our group sales.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Sales
from our retail outlets selling Hooters logo merchandise decreased 6.0 % from
$5.1 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006 to $4.8 million for the
year ended December&nbsp;31, 2007 due to a general decline in traffic. Other
miscellaneous revenue remained constant.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">36</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Hotel and other expenses
increased to $9.2 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2007 from $8.8
million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006. These increases in expenses
were largely due to operating the hotel for a full twelve months in 2007, as
compared to eleven month of operations in 2006.&#160;
Hotel operations cut costs in several areas.&#160; The profit margin for hotel and other of
62.3% improved for 2007 compared to 61.3% for 2006. Retail sales generated a
profit margin of 42.91% for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2007 compared to
47.69% for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">General and administrative.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;"> General and administrative
expense includes costs associated with marketing, information technology, and
finance, accounting, and property operations. General and administrative
expense decreased $0.2 million to $18.0 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2007 compared to $18.2 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006. This
decrease was principally due to decreases in advertising and marketing expenses
for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2007 as compared to 2006.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Depreciation and amortization expense.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;"> Depreciation and
amortization expense of $6.2 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2007
increased by $0.4 million, or 7.0%, from $5.8 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2006. This increase in depreciation expense was due to recording a full twelve
months of depreciation in 2007 compared to eleven months in 2006 and also depreciation
on additional asset purchases.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Related party royalties expense. </font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Beginning on February&nbsp;3,
2006, we incurred related party royalty fees pursuant to agreements with
Hooters Gaming Corporation, Lags Ventures,&nbsp;Inc., and Las Vegas Wings,&nbsp;Inc.
These related party royalties expense totaled $1.4 million and $1.5 million
during the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2007 and 2006, respectively. The
payment of the related party royalties is restricted under the Notes indenture.
The fees can only be paid after the close of the fiscal year and only if our
debt coverage ratio is 1.5 to 1 for that fiscal year. The payments of the
royalty fees are further limited to the sum of 2% of revenue and 3% of EBITDA,
as defined in the indenture.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Interest income.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;"> Interest income was $90,953 for the year
ended December&nbsp;31, 2007, compared to $498,607 for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2006. In 2006, the Company earned interest on construction funds, which were
used during 2006 to pay for construction costs.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Interest expense.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;"> Interest expense was $12.7 million for the
year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006, compared to $13.2 million for the year ended
December&nbsp;31, 2007, an increase of $0.5 million. The increase in interest
expense is largely attributable to $5.3 million in interest expense on the
Credit Facility and the equipment purchase agreements we entered into during
2006 and 2007.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Provision for income taxes.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;"> 155 is a limited-liability
company and are treated as a partnership for federal income tax purposes.
Accordingly, a provision for federal income taxes is not recorded on our
consolidated financial statements. Taxable income or loss will be included in
the income tax returns of the members.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Comparison of Year Ended December&nbsp;31, 2006 (155 East Tropicana,
LLC) with the Year Ended December&nbsp;31, 2005 (Combined)</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.3pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
results of operations for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006 includes the
months of January&nbsp;2006 when the property was essentially closed for
remodeling and the first eleven months of operations of</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">37</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='37',FILE='C:\JMS\wbruce\08-2823-1\task2827333\2823-1-bi.htm',USER='wbruce',CD='Mar 31 12:48 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">the
Hooters Casino Hotel from February&nbsp;3, 2006 through December&nbsp;31,
2006.&#160; Net operating revenues for the
year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006 were $66.7 million, an increase of $39.2
million or 147.3%, from $27.5 million of combined net operating revenues for
155 and H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo during the same period in the previous year.&#160; Included in the net revenues for the year
ended December&nbsp;31, 2006 were $66.4 million generated by the Hooters Casino
Hotel operations beginning on February&nbsp;3, 2006.&#160; The significant increase in net operating
revenues was due to increased activity in all areas of the casino and hotel
operations following the opening of the newly renovated Hooters Casino Hotel.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.3pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.3pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Expenses
before interest, depreciation, related-party royalties, pre-opening expenses,
and loss on disposal totaled $59.1 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2006.&#160; This level of spending against net
revenues of $66.7 million did not result in adequate cash flow from operations
to cover debt service and capital expenditures.&#160;
We targeted certain operating expenses and reduced these expenses
starting in June&nbsp;2006.&#160; Expenses
before interest, depreciation and related party royalties were cut from $17.4
million in the second quarter of 2006 to $15.4 million in the third
quarter.&#160; The decline in third quarter
expenses resulted largely from cutting marketing costs by $1.0 million, payroll
costs by $0.2 million and other operational expenses by $0.9 million.&#160; Expenses before interest, depreciation and
related party royalties were then cut from $15.4 million in the third quarter
of 2006 to $14.4 million in the fourth quarter of 2006, a decline of $1.0
million.&#160; The decline in fourth quarter
expenses resulted largely from cutting marketing costs by $0.6 million, food
and beverage costs by $0.3 million, and other general and administrative
expenses by $0.2 million.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.3pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Casino.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; Casino
revenues increased by $15.9 million to $25.8 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2006, compared to $9.9 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2005.&#160; Casino revenue of $25.7 million was generated
after the grand opening on February&nbsp;3, 2006.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Table
games revenue was $11.0 million in 2006, an increase of $7.8 million, or
241.0%, from the prior year&#146;s table games win of $3.2 million.&#160; With the exception of $0.1 million, all table
games revenue was generated after the grand opening.&#160; Table games drop increased to $64.4 million,
or by 280.3%, for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006 compared to the same
period in 2005, but the table games hold percentage decreased from 19.1% in
2005 to 17.1% in 2006.&#160; The table games
generated an average win per table of $1,013 per day after February&nbsp;3,
2006 as compared to $568 for the same period in 2005.&#160; According to the Gaming Revenue Reports
published by the Nevada Gaming Control Board, the average win per table per day
for Las Vegas Strip casinos with annual gaming revenue of $36.0 to $70.0
million was $1,069 for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Slot
revenue of $14.3 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006 was an
increase of 115.9% compared to $6.6 million in 2005.&#160; With the exception of $0.1 million, the
entire slot revenue was generated after the grand opening.&#160; The average win per machine per day was $73
from February&nbsp;3, 2006 to December&nbsp;31, 2006 compared to $40 for the
same period in 2005.&#160; According to the
Gaming Revenue Reports published by the Nevada State Gaming Control Board, the
average win per machine per day for Las Vegas Strip casinos with annual gaming
revenue of $36.0 to $70.0 million was $111 for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2006.&#160; Management began implementing
strategies in 2006 to increase slot play.&#160;
In the summer of 2006, we began to add new slot machines to the floor
and reconfigure the floor to make it more inviting.&#160; We continued by targeting our marketing
efforts at increasing slot play through more aggressive slot club awards,
modifications to the pay tables on the slot machines to award more and larger
payouts, direct mailing campaigns, and other promotions and programs aimed at
increasing the flow of customers to the casino floor.&#160; These programs began in the fourth quarter of
2006 and continued to be implemented in early 2007.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.3pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Casino
expenses increased by 107.1% to $13.1 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2006 compared to $6.3 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2005 due to
increases in payroll and other</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">38</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='38',FILE='C:\JMS\wbruce\08-2823-1\task2827333\2823-1-bi.htm',USER='wbruce',CD='Mar 31 12:48 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">operational
expenses.&#160; However, the profit margin for
casino operations increased from 36.3% during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2005
to 49.3% during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006 due to payroll and other
operational expenses being proportionally lower during 2006 in comparison to
revenue.&#160; The percentage of expenses in
comparison to revenue for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2006 and 2005 were
27.7% and 34.9%, respectively, for payroll expenses and 22.5% and 26.1%,
respectively, for other operational expenses.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.3pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Food and beverage.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; Food and beverage revenue was $23.6 million
for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006 as compared to $6.2 million for 2005,
an increase of 279.9%.&#160; The increase in
food revenues was a result of increased customer volume after the grand
opening.&#160; Beverage revenue (which
includes complimentary beverages) increased by $7.9 million, or 381.6%, from
$2.1 million during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2005.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Food
and beverage expenses increased from $6.1 million during the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2005 to $19.0 million during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006, an increase
of $12.9 million.&#160; The increase was due
to increases in payroll, cost of sales, and other operational expenses
associated with the increase in business volume and the increase in number of
food and beverage outlets from five to ten after the grand opening.&#160; The profit margin for food and beverage
operations increased from 1.6% during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2005 to
19.7% during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006 operational efficiencies in
payroll and cost of sales.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Hotel and other.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; Hotel
and other revenue (which includes hotel room revenue, retail, spa and other
miscellaneous revenue) increased by $9.3 million, or 69.5%, to $22.7 million
for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006 from $13.4 million for the year ended
December&nbsp;31, 2005.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Room&nbsp;revenue
increased to $16.3 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006 compared
to $12.4 million in 2005.&#160; For the months
of February&nbsp;through December&nbsp;2006, room revenue was $15.9 million
with an occupancy rate of 79.7% and average daily room rate of $90.&#160; This compares to room revenue of $11.2
million for the same eleven months in 2005, with an occupancy rate of 84.0% and
an average daily rate of $66.&#160; Subsequent
to the remodeling of the rooms, which were completed in February&nbsp;2006, we
have been able to increase room rates due to the improved product; however,
occupancy rates were not as strong due to the slow start-up in marketing our
rooms in the first two quarters of 2006.&#160;
The occupancy rates have steadily climbed though each quarter beginning
with 66.3% in the period from February&nbsp;3 to March&nbsp;31,2006, then to
73.9% in the second quarter, 80.7% in the third quarter and 83.4% in the fourth
quarter of 2006.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Retail
revenue was $5.5 million or 24.2% of hotel and other revenue in the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2006 and has increased from $0.9 million during the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2005 due to the strength of Hooters brand merchandise.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Hotel
and other expenses increased by 105.8% from $4.3 million during the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2005 to $8.8 million during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006 due to
significant increases in payroll and other expenses in hotel and retail
operations.&#160; The profit margin for room
was 61.3% during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006 compared to 68.8% for
the same period in 2005 due to increases in payroll expense and upgraded room
amenities.&#160; Retail sales generated a
profit margin of 35.3% in 2006.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">General and administrative.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; General and administrative expense includes
costs associated with corporate marketing, information technology, finance,
accounting, and property operations.&#160;
General and administrative expense increased $10.1 million to $18.2
million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006 compared to $8.1 million for
the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2005.&#160;
This increase was principally due to increases in advertising and
marketing expenses for the rebranding of the hotel casino and payroll</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">39</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">expenses
for increased staffing under the Hooters Casino Hotel operations for the year
ended December&nbsp;31, 2006.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Depreciation and amortization expense.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; Depreciation and amortization expense of $5.8
million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006 increased by $3.5 million, or
155.0%, from $2.3 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2005.&#160; The increase in depreciation and amortization
expense was due to additional depreciation of fixed asset additions placed in
service beginning February&nbsp;3, 2006.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Pre-opening expenses.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; Pre-opening expenses are costs associated
with the start-up activities for the new Hooters Casino Hotel and consist of
salaries and wages, legal, professional, general, and other general
administrative expenses.&#160; Pre-opening
expenses increased by $0.5 million to $5.3 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2006 compared to $4.8 million during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2005,
largely due to increased training expenses during the month of January&nbsp;2006
and the costs of the grand opening celebration for the Hooters Casino Hotel in February&nbsp;2006.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Related party royalties expenses.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; Beginning on February&nbsp;3, 2006, related
party royalty fees were incurred pursuant to agreements with Hooters Gaming
Corporation, Lags Ventures,&nbsp;Inc., and Las Vegas Wings,&nbsp;Inc.&#160; These related party royalties expenses
totaled $1.5 million during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006.&#160; The payment of the related party royalties is
restricted under the Notes indenture.&#160;
The fees can only be paid after the close of the fiscal year and only if
our debt coverage ration is 1.5 to 1 for that fiscal year.&#160; The payments of the royalty fees are further
limited to the sum of 2% of revenue and 3% of EBITDA as defined in the
indenture.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Loss on disposal of assets.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; The loss on disposal of assets in 2006 of
$1.2 million is the result of retiring and replacing certain old slot machines
and other equipment and carpeting on the casino floor in connection with the
Hooters Casino Hotel remodel.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Interest income.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160;
Interest income was $0.5 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2006, compared to $2.0 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2005.&#160; The decrease resulted from greater interest
income earned during 2005 on the investment of the $130.0 million in Notes
proceeds.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Interest expense.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160;
Interest expense was $12.7 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2006, compared to $10.2 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2005, an
increase of $2.5 million.&#160; The increase
in interest expense is largely attributable to twelve full months of interest
expense totaling $11.4 million on the $130.0 million in Notes during the year
ended December&nbsp;31, 2006 compared to nine full months of interest expense
totaling $8.5 million during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2005.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Loss on extinguishment of debt.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; The loss on extinguishment of debt in 2005
was related to the payoff of our bank loan with the proceeds of the old notes.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Related party lease income.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; During the period from August&nbsp;3, 2004
through October&nbsp;31, 2005, we leased the hotel casino to Eastern&nbsp;&amp;
Western under two separate lease agreements.&#160;
Pursuant to the casino lease agreement, the casino, showroom, liquor
servicing areas and other casino related areas were leased for $125,000 per
month.&#160; Pursuant to the hotel lease
agreement for the hotel, restaurants, and other areas of the hotel casino
property, rental income was $250,000 per month, plus a percentage rent equal to
100% of all revenues received by Eastern&nbsp;&amp; Western from the operation
of the hotel and restaurants, less operating expenses and working capital
reserves, as defined in the hotel lease agreement.&#160; For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2005, a
total of $5.4 million was received in rental income under the casino and hotel leases.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">40</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Related party lease expense.&#160; </font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During the
period from August&nbsp;3, 2004 through October&nbsp;31, 2005, Eastern&nbsp;&amp;
Western leased the hotel casino from us (see Related Party Lease Income in the
paragraph above).&#160; Rental expense of $5.4
million was incurred under the casino and hotel leases for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2005.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Provision for income taxes.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; Income of the H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo is included in
the tax return of S.I. Enterprises,&nbsp;Inc.&#160;
The provision for income taxes was a benefit of $0.4&nbsp;million for
the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2005, predicated on loss before taxes of $1.0
million.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">155
East Tropicana, LLC is a limited-liability company and is treated as a
partnership for federal income tax purposes.&#160;
Accordingly, a provision for federal income taxes is not recorded on 155
East Tropicana, LLC&#146;s consolidated financial statements.&#160; Taxable income or loss will be included in
the income tax returns of the members.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Liquidity and Capital Resources (155 East Tropicana, LLC)</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">For the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2007, we used $6.3 million of cash in operating activities, largely due to our
net loss of $14.1 million, which was offset by $9.1 million of non-cash
depreciation and amortization charges, and payment-restricted related party
royalty fees.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">For the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2007, $0.9 million of cash was used in investing activities, as a result of
capital expenditures.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">For
the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2007, we were provided $6.8 million of cash
from financing activities. We received $5.3 million in proceeds from issuance
of long-term debt and $3.5 million in payments related to the asset purchase
agreement. This was partially offset by $2.0 million in principal payments on
equipment debt.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Notes&#146; indenture contains certain provisions which restrict or limit our
ability to, among other things, incur more debt, pay dividends, redeem stock or
make other distributions, enter into transactions with affiliates or transfer
or sell assets.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We entered into our $15.0 million Credit Facility concurrently with the
offering of the old notes.&#160; Our Credit
Facility is a four-year revolving credit facility of $15.0 million, maturing on
March&nbsp;30, 2009, and currently has outstanding draws of $6.3 million at December&nbsp;31,
2007.&#160; All outstanding principal and
interest under our Credit Facility is due and payable on March&nbsp;30, 2009.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We
entered into equipment financing of $0.3 million during the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2007, of which $163,303 was outstanding at December&nbsp;31, 2007.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Capital
expenditures of approximately $1.0 million are anticipated in 2008.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Subsequent
to December&nbsp;31, 2007, we collected three $500,000 extension fee payments
in January, February and March 2008. It is possible that we may receive
additional extension fee payments of $500,000 each in April and May&nbsp;2008
if the Buyer elects to extend the closing date of the asset purchase beyond April
30, 2008.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We
believe that we have the flexibility to cover operational contingencies,
working capital needs, capital expenditures, and debt service obligations
during 2008 through the use of cash (which totaled $5.9 million at December&nbsp;31,
2007, including $3.8 million required in daily operations), our cash flow from
operations, our ability to draw against our $15.0 million Credit Facility,
other available equipment financing and the receipt of extension fee</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">41</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='41',FILE='C:\JMS\wbruce\08-2823-1\task2827333\2823-1-bi.htm',USER='wbruce',CD='Mar 31 12:48 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">payments
called for under the Purchase Agreement that have been received subsequent to December&nbsp;31,
2007.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Contractual
Obligations</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
following table summarizes the contractual commitments of 155 East Tropicana,
LLC as of December&nbsp;31, 2007:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">130,152</font></p>

  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.96%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.3%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:10.84%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">55</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.9%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr height="0">
  <td width="208" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="15" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="10" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="81" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="15" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="10" style="border:none;"></td>
