  <td width="15" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="10" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="81" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="15" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="10" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="81" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="15" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="10" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="81" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="14" style="border:none;"></td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="1" width="25%" noshade color="black" align="left"></div>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The long-term debt
represents the $6.3 million in outstanding draws against our Credit Facility as
of December&nbsp;31, 2007 due on March&nbsp;30, 2009 and the $130.0 million
Notes issued on March&nbsp;29, 2005 and due on 2012.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(2)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We entered into various
equipment purchase agreements in connection with the renovation and rebranding
of the Hooters Casino Hotel.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(3)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Operating contracts
represent various contracts for services in connection with the operations of
the Hooters Casino Hotel.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 2.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; <b><i style="font-weight:bold;">Critical Accounting
Policies and Estimates</i></b></font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 2.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Management
has identified the following critical accounting policies that affect the more
significant judgments and estimates used in the preparation of 155 East
Tropicana, LLC&#146;s consolidated financial statements and H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo&#146;s
combined financial statements.&#160; The
preparation of the financial statements in conformity with accounting
principles generally accepted in the United States requires management to make
estimates and judgments that affect the reported amounts of assets and
liabilities, revenue and expenses, and related disclosures of contingent assets
and liabilities.&#160; On an on-going basis,
management evaluates those estimates, including those related to asset
impairment, accruals for slot marketing points, compensation and related
benefits, revenue recognition, allowance for doubtful accounts, contingencies,
and litigation.&#160; These accounting
policies are stated in the notes to the financial statements and in relevant
sections of the management discussion and analysis.&#160; These estimates are based on the information
currently available to management and on various other assumptions that
management believes to be reasonable under the circumstances.&#160; Actual results could vary from those
estimates and estimates and assumptions may be changed in the future.&#160; Changes in these estimates and assumptions
may have a material affect on the results of operations and financial condition
of 155 East Tropicana, LLC and the results of operations and financial
condition of the H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">42</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='42',FILE='C:\JMS\wbruce\08-2823-1\task2827333\2823-1-bi.htm',USER='wbruce',CD='Mar 31 12:48 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We
believe that the following critical accounting policies affect significant
judgments and estimates used in the preparation of the consolidated financial
statements:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Cash and Cash Equivalents</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">.&#160; We consider all highly liquid investments
purchased with original maturities of three months or less to be cash
equivalents.&#160; The carrying amount of cash
and equivalents approximates its fair value.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Accounts Receivable.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;"> Accounts receivable are due
within one year and are recorded net of amounts estimated to be
uncollectible.&#160; We reserve an estimated
amount for receivables to reduce the receivables to their net realizable value
which approximate fair value.&#160; Historical
collection rates and customer relationships of the previously operated H&#244;tel
San R&#233;mo were considered in determining the reserve for 155 East Tropicana,
LLC.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Inventories.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; Inventories
are stated at the lower of cost (using the first-in, first-out method) or
market values.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Property and Equipment.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; Property and equipment are stated at
cost.&#160; Costs of improvements are
capitalized. Cost of normal repairs and maintenance are charged to expense as
incurred.&#160; Upon the sale or retirement of
property and equipment, the cost and related accumulated depreciation are
removed from the respective accounts, and the resulting gain or loss, if any,
is included in the accompanying consolidated statements of operations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Depreciation
is provided on a straight-line basis over the estimated useful life of the
assets.&#160; The service lives of assets are
generally 30 to 40&nbsp;years for buildings and 3 to 10&nbsp;years for
furniture and equipment.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
carrying values of our assets are reviewed when events or changes in
circumstances indicate that the carrying amount of the asset may not be
recoverable in accordance with Financial Accounting Standards Board, or the
FASB Statement No.&nbsp;144, Accounting for the Impairment or Disposal of
Long-lived Assets, or SFAS No.&nbsp;144.&#160;
Under SFAS No.&nbsp;144, an asset impairment is determined to exist when
events or changes in circumstances indicate that the carrying amount of an
asset may not be recoverable and if estimated future cash flows, undiscounted
and without interest charges, are less than the carrying amount.&#160; If it is determined that an impairment has
occurred, then an impairment loss is recognized in the consolidated statement
of operations and the related assets are adjusted to their estimated fair value
less sales costs.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Deferred Financing Costs.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; Deferred financing costs consist of loan
origination and commitment fees and are amortized to interest expense over the
term of the related financing on a straight line basis which approximates the
effective interest rate method.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Intangible Assets.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; Intangible assets represent (1)&nbsp;the
value of intellectual property related to the Hooters brand contributed to us
pursuant to an assignment agreement with Florida Hooters LLC, (2)&nbsp;the
value of the slot club customer list acquired from Eastern&nbsp;&amp; Western,
and (3)&nbsp;the excess of the purchase price over the fair market value of the
H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo assets acquired, or Goodwill.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In
June&nbsp;2001, the FASB issued Statement of Financial Accounting Standards No.&nbsp;142,
<i>Goodwill and Other Intangible Assets</i>, or
SFAS No.&nbsp;142. We evaluate the amortization periods and possible impairment
of its intangible assets in accordance with SFAS No.&nbsp;142.&#160; The intellectual property related to the
Hooters brand contributed to us and the Goodwill are intangible assets not
subject to amortization.&#160; The slot
customer list is being amortized using the straight line method over five years.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">43</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='43',FILE='C:\JMS\wbruce\08-2823-1\task2827333\2823-1-bi.htm',USER='wbruce',CD='Mar 31 12:48 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Jackpots and Prizes.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;"> We have progressive slot
machines.&#160; As coins are played, the
amount available to win increases and will be paid out when the jackpot is
awarded.&#160; In accordance with industry practice,
we record the liability and expense related to such progressives as incurred.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Casino Revenues and Promotional Allowances.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; In accordance with industry practice, we
recognize as casino revenue the net win from gaming activities, which is the
difference between gaming wins and losses.&#160;
The retail value of rooms, food, and beverage furnished to customers
without charge is included in gross revenues and then deducted as promotional
allowances.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Participation Fees.&#160; </font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Participation
fees paid to slot machine manufacturers are classified as a reduction of
revenue instead of a casino expense.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Player Club Points.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; Our slot club allows customers to earn
certain complimentary products and services, based on the volume of the
customer&#146;s gaming activity.&#160;&#160; 155 East Tropicana,
LLC and H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo have recorded a liability for the estimated cost of the
complimentary products and services earned by customers.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">155
East Tropicana, LLC&#146;s slot club program allows customers to redeem points
earned from their gaming activity for complimentary food, beverage, rooms,
entertainment, and merchandise.&#160; At the
time redeemed, the retail value of complimentaries under the program is
recorded as revenue with a corresponding offsetting amount included in
promotional allowances.&#160; The cost
associated with complimentary food, beverage, rooms, entertainment, and
merchandise redeemed under the program is recorded in casino costs and
expenses.&#160; Beginning in March&nbsp;2007,
slot points may be redeemed for cash and the cash rebates are recorded as a
promotional allowance,</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Advertising.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; Prepaid
advertising costs are expensed the first time the advertising takes place.&#160; Advertising costs are included in general and
administrative expenses.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Capitalized Interest.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; The interest cost associated with a major
construction project is capitalized and included in the cost of the
project.&#160; When no debt is incurred
specifically for a project, interest is capitalized on amounts expended on the
project using the weighted-average cost of our outstanding borrowings.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Income Taxes.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; 155
East Tropicana, LLC is a limited-liability company and is taxed as a
partnership for federal income tax purposes.&#160;
Accordingly, no provision for federal income taxes has been recorded in
the accompanying consolidated financial statements since the taxable income or
loss is included in the income tax return of the members.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">H&#244;tel
San R&#233;mo accounted for income taxes under Statement of Financial Accounting
Standards (&#147;SFAS&#148;) No.&nbsp;109, <i>Accounting for Income
Taxes</i>, or SFAS No.&nbsp;109, whereby deferred tax assets and
liabilities are recognized for the future tax consequences attributable to
differences between the financial statements carrying amounts of existing
assets and liabilities and their respective tax bases.&#160; Deferred tax assets and liabilities were
measured using enacted tax rates expected to apply to taxable income in the
years in which those temporary differences are expected to be recovered or
settled.&#160; Under SFAS No.&nbsp;109, the
effect on deferred tax assets and liabilities of a change in tax rates is
recognized in income in the period that included the enactment date.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Pre-opening Expenses.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; Pre-opening costs are expensed as incurred,
consistent with Statement of Position 98-5, Reporting on the Costs of Start-up
Activities.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">44</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='44',FILE='C:\JMS\wbruce\08-2823-1\task2827333\2823-1-bi.htm',USER='wbruce',CD='Mar 31 12:48 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Use of Estimates.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; The
preparation of financial statements in conformity with generally accepted
accounting principles in the United States requires management to make
estimates and assumptions that affect the reported amounts of assets and
liabilities and disclosure of contingent assets and liabilities at the date of
the financial statements, and the reported amounts revenues and expenses during
the reporting periods. Actual results could differ from those estimates.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Reclassifications.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; Certain reclassifications, having no effect
on net loss, have been made to the previously issued consolidated financial
statements to conform to the current period&#146;s presentation of the Company&#146;s
financial statements.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Recently Issued Accounting
Pronouncements.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In September&nbsp;2006, the
Financial Accounting Standards Board, (&#147;FASB&#148;) issued SFAS No.&nbsp;157 <i>Fair Value Measurements</i>, which defines
fair value, establishes a framework for measuring fair value in GAAP, and
expands disclosures about fair value measurements.&#160; SFAS 157 does not require any new fair value
measurements, but provides guidance on how to measure fair value by providing a
fair value hierarch used to classify the source of the information.&#160; SFAS 157 is effective for financial
statements issued for fiscal years beginning after November&nbsp;15, 2007 and
interim periods within these fiscal years.&#160;
In February&nbsp;2008, FASB issued FASB Staff Position (&#147;FSP&#148;) FAS
157-2, which defers the effective date of SFAS 157 to fiscal years beginning
after November&nbsp;15, 2008, and interim periods within those fiscal years,
for nonfinancial assets and nonfinancial liabilities that are recognized or
disclosed at fair value in an entity&#146;s financial statements on a recurring
basis.&#160; We are evaluating SFAS 157 and
have not yet determined the determined the impact the adoption will have on the
consolidated financial statements.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In February&nbsp;2007, the
FASB issued SFAS No.&nbsp;159, <i>The Fair
Value Option for Financial Assets and Financial Liabilities</i>.
SFAS&nbsp;159 permits entities to choose to measure many financial instruments
and certain other items at fair value. The objective of the guidance is to
improve financial reporting by providing entities with the opportunity to
mitigate volatility in reported earnings caused by measuring related assets and
liabilities differently without having to apply complex hedge accounting
provisions. SFAS 159 is effective as of the beginning of the first fiscal year
after November&nbsp;15, 2007. Early adoption is permitted as of the beginning
of the fiscal year on or before November&nbsp;15, 2007, provided the provisions
of SFAS 157 are also applied.&#160; We are
evaluating our options provided for under this statement and their potential
impact on the consolidated financial statements when implemented.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In December&nbsp;2007, the
FASB issued SFAS 160, &#147;Noncontrolling Interests in Consolidated Financial
Statements-An Amendment of ARB No.&nbsp;51&#148;.&#160;
SFAS 160 establishes new accounting and reporting standards for the
noncontrolling interest in a subsidiary and for the deconsolidation of a
subsidiary.&#160; Specifically, this statement
requires the recognition of a noncontrolling interest as equity in the
consolidated financial statements and separate from the parent&#146;s equity.&#160; In addition, the amount of net income attributable
to the noncontrolling interest should be included in consolidated net income on
the face of the income statement.&#160; SFAS
160 is effective for fiscal years, and interim periods within those fiscal
years, beginning on or after December&nbsp;15, 2008.&#160; Early adoption is prohibited.&#160; We are evaluating SFAS 160 and have not yet
determined the impact the adoption will have on the consolidated financial
statements.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In December&nbsp;2007, the
FASB issued SFAS 141R, &#147;Business Combinations&#148;.&#160;
Under SFAS 141R, an acquiring entity will be required to recognize all
the assets acquired and liabilities assumed in a</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">45</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='45',FILE='C:\JMS\wbruce\08-2823-1\task2827333\2823-1-bi.htm',USER='wbruce',CD='Mar 31 12:48 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">transaction at the
acquisition-date fair value, with limited exceptions, replacing SFAS 141&#146;s
cost-allocation process.&#160; SFAS 141R also
includes a substantial number of new disclosure requirements.&#160; SFAS 141R is to be applied prospectively to
business combinations for which the acquisition date is on or after the
beginning of the first annual reporting period beginning on or after December&nbsp;15,
2008.&#160; Early adoption is prohibited.&#160; We will adopt SFAS 141R in the first quarter
of 2009.&#160; The impact on our accounting
for future business combinations once adopted will be dependent upon
acquisitions that are made in the future.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">ITEM 7A.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Quantitative
and Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk.</font></b><a name="Item7a_QuantitativeAndQualitative_142632"></a></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
following discusses our exposure to market risk related to changes in interest
rates, equity prices and foreign currency exchange rates.&#160; We do not believe that their respective
exposure to market risk is material.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Market
risk is risk of loss arising from changes in market rates and prices, such as
interest rates, foreign currency exchange rates and commodity prices.&#160; At December&nbsp;31, 2007, we had
$130,000,000 aggregate principal amount of the Notes, slot equipment purchase
agreements of $2.0 million carrying an imputed interest rate of 3.33%, and
hotel equipment purchase agreements of $0.3 million carrying an imputed
interest rate of 11.88%.&#160;&#160; The Notes
carry a fixed interest rate of 8.75 %, provided no events of default have
occurred.&#160; Since the Notes and equipment
purchase agreements have fixed interest rates, there is no market risk
associated with these loans.&#160; We have
market risk associated with funds that may be borrowed on our
$15.0&nbsp;million Credit Facility, due to an interest rate that floats with
the LIBOR or prime rate.&#160; The term of our
Credit Facility</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">will mature on March&nbsp;30, 2009.&#160; At December&nbsp;31, 2007, $6.3 million was
outstanding under the variable rate Credit Facility, carrying interest at
8.54%.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">We do not have any significant
foreign currency exchange rate risk or commodity price risk and do not
currently trade any market sensitive instruments.</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">46</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='46',FILE='C:\JMS\wbruce\08-2823-1\task2827333\2823-1-bi.htm',USER='wbruce',CD='Mar 31 12:48 2008' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<h2 style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-.75in;text-transform:uppercase;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;text-transform:none;">ITEM 8.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;text-transform:none;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;text-transform:none;">FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
AND SUPPLEMENTARY DATA.</font><a name="Item8_FinancialStatementsAndSuppl_140936"></a></h2>

<h2 style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-.75in;text-transform:uppercase;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></h2>

TO FINANCIAL STATEMENTS</font></b></p>

  </td>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-variant:normal !important;">Report of
Independent Registered Public Accounting Firm</font></b><a name="ReportOfIndependentRegisteredPubl_141143"></a></h3>

<h3 align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></h3>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">To
the Members of 155 East Tropicana, LLC</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We
have audited the accompanying consolidated balance sheets of 155 East
Tropicana, LLC and subsidiary as of December&nbsp;31, 2007 and 2006, and the
related consolidated statements of operations, members&#146; equity (deficit), and
cash flows for each of the three years in period ended December&nbsp;31,
2007.&#160; These financial statements are the
responsibility of the Company&#146;s management.&#160;
Our responsibility is to express an opinion on these financial
statements based on our audits.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We
conducted our audits in accordance with the standards of the Public Company
Accounting Oversight Board (United States). Those standards require that we
plan and perform the audit to obtain reasonable assurance about whether the
financial statements are free of material misstatement. We were not engaged to
perform an audit of the Company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting.
Our audits included consideration of internal control over financial reporting
as a basis for designing audit procedures&#160;
that are appropriate in the circumstances, but not for the purpose of
expressing an opinion on the effectiveness of the Company&#146;s internal control
over financial reporting.&#160; Accordingly,
we express no such opinion. An audit also includes examining, on a test basis,
evidence supporting the amounts and disclosures in the financial statements,
assessing the accounting principles used and significant estimates made by
management, and evaluating the overall financial statement presentation. We
believe that our audits provide a reasonable basis for our opinion.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In
our opinion, the consolidated financial statements referred to above present
fairly, in all material respects, the consolidated financial position of 155
East Tropicana, LLC and subsidiary at December&nbsp;31, 2007 and 2006, and the
consolidated results of their operations and its cash flows for each of the
three years in the period ended December&nbsp;31, in conformity with U.S.
generally accepted accounting principles.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">/s/ Ernst&nbsp;&amp; Young LLP</font></p>

<p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Las
Vegas, Nevada</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">March&nbsp;19,
2008</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">48</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>

<h3 align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-variant:normal !important;">155 EAST

  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.3%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="15%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:15.7%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(13,007,332</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 1.5pt .7pt;width:2.18%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">The
accompanying notes are an integral part of these consolidated financial</font></i><i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">
statements.</font></i></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">51</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">The
accompanying notes are an integral part of these consolidated financial</font></i><i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">
statements.</font></i></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">52</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">155 East

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">155 East Tropicana, LLC <br>
(A Nevada Limited-Liability Company)</font></b><a name="a155EastTropicanaLlcaNevadaLimite_142645"></a></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-variant:normal !important;">NOTES TO
CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS</font></b></h3>

<h3 align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></h3>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">December&nbsp;31, 2007</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1.&nbsp;&nbsp;Organizational and Basis of Presentation</font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">155 East Tropicana, LLC, a
Nevada limited-liability company (the &#147;Company&#148;) was incorporated on June&nbsp;17,
2004 to acquire the real and personal property of the H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo Casino and
Resort (the &#147;H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo&#148;) in Las Vegas, Nevada with the intention of
renovating the existing casino and hotel facility with a &#147;Hooters&#148; entertainment
concept and theme.&#160; The renovations were
completed and the H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo property was reopened as the new Hooters
Casino Hotel on February&nbsp;3, 2006.&#160;
The Company&#146;s business is concentrated at the one casino and hotel
property in Las Vegas, Nevada.&#160; The
renovations were financed by the Company and its wholly owned subsidiary, 155
East Tropicana Finance Corp. through a $130 million Senior Secured Notes
offering on March&nbsp;29, 2005.&#160; The
Company&#146;s membership interests are held two-thirds through Florida Hooters LLC
and one-third through EW Common LLC.&#160; The
initial capitalization of the Company was provided by Florida Hooters LLC in
the form of a $5.1&nbsp;million cash contribution and the assignment of rights
with respect to the Hooters trademark and logo and other intellectual property
and by EW Common LLC in the form of a $25.0&nbsp;million deemed capital
contribution.&#160; The deemed capital
contribution from EW Common LLC carries with it a priority return of four percent
on the contribution annually as described in Note 10.&#160; The payment of this priority return is
subject to meeting certain financial covenants associated with the Company&#146;s
debt.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Florida Hooters LLC is a
joint venture between Hooters Gaming LLC and Lags Ventures, LLC.&#160; Hooters Gaming LLC is owned by the holders of
licenses to operate Hooters restaurants in the Tampa Bay, Florida, Chicago,
Illinois and downtown Manhattan in New York as well as for the sale of
wholesale foods and calendars and Nevada hotel/gaming and includes most of the
original founders of the Hooters brand.&#160;
Pursuant to these license rights, the owners of Florida Hooters LLC
operate 40 Hooters restaurants, publish Hooters calendars and operate a Hooters
food business.&#160; Lags Ventures, LLC is
owned by a holder of the license rights to Hooters restaurants in South Florida
and the State of Nevada.&#160; The owner of
Lags Ventures, LLC is also the founder of the Dan Marino concept restaurants
and owns and operates two Dan Marino concept restaurants.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">EW Common LLC is owned 90%
by Eastern&nbsp;&amp; Western Hotel Corporation (&#147;Eastern&nbsp;&amp; Western&#148;)
and 10% by Michael J. Hessling, president of the Company.&#160; Eastern&nbsp;&amp; Western and its affiliates
owned the real property and non-gaming assets of H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo from November&nbsp;1988
until the Company&#146;s acquisition of the H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo in August&nbsp;2004.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Florida Hooters LLC and EW
Common LLC entered into a joint venture agreement for the purpose of forming
the Company and documenting the terms of their investments and business
venture.&#160; Under the terms of the joint venture
agreement, the venture progressed in three stages.&#160; The first stage involved the formation of the
Company and the conveyance of all the real and non-gaming personal</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">54</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='54',FILE='C:\JMS\lrichar\08-2823-1\task2826981\2823-1-fa-01.htm',USER='lrichar',CD='Mar 31 11:35 2008' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">155 East Tropicana, LLC </font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(A Nevada Limited-Liability Company)</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-variant:normal !important;">NOTES TO
CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (CONTINUED)</font></b></h3>

<h3 style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></h3>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">1.&nbsp;&nbsp;Organizational and
Basis of Presentation (continued)</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">property owned by and
associated with the H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo, the leaseback under operating lease
arrangements of these assets to Eastern&nbsp;&amp; Western pursuant to the
casino and hotel lease agreements described in Note&nbsp;8, and the
contribution through assignment agreements of certain intellectual property
rights to the Company by the respective members of Florida Hooters LLC.&#160; The second stage related to the raising of
financing to fund the redesign and renovation of the H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo into the
Hooters Casino Hotel, the refinancing of the Company&#146;s current debt structure
and other working capital requirements, which was completed on March&nbsp;29,
2005.&#160; The final stage involved the
securing of all licenses necessary to conduct gaming at the hotel casino and
the subsequent termination of the hotel and casino leases.&#160; In October&nbsp;2005, the Company secured the
necessary gaming and liquor licenses and on November&nbsp;1, 2005, assumed the
operations of the existing H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo.&#160;
The hotel and casino leases with Eastern&nbsp;&amp; Western were
terminated on October&nbsp;31, 2005.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Pursuant to the joint
venture agreement, Florida Hooters LLC and EW Common LLC entered into an
operating agreement.&#160; Under the terms of
the operating agreement, Florida Hooters LLC has the right to appoint six
managers and EW Common LLC has the right to appoint three managers to a
management board.&#160; Certain transactions,
including key operational matters, the sale of all or substantially all of the
Company&#146;s assets, a merger or consolidation and various governance matters
require the unanimous approval of the management board.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Prior to November&nbsp;1,
2005, the Company had conducted no business other than in connection with the
acquisition and subsequent leasing of the H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo, and was considered a
development stage company.&#160; The H&#244;tel San
R&#233;mo is a division of S.I. Enterprises,&nbsp;Inc., a Nevada corporation.&#160; Through October&nbsp;31, 2005, Eastern&nbsp;&amp;
Western held the gaming license in Nevada and owned all gaming assets used by
H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo.&#160; Commencing November&nbsp;1,
2005, all operations, assets and liabilities of the former H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo hotel
and casino are included in the Company&#146;s financial statements, and effective
that date the Company was no longer in the development stages.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.3pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On February&nbsp;3, 2006,
the new Hooters Casino Hotel was opened for business.&nbsp; The Hooters Casino
Hotel features a casino floor with 679 slot and video poker machines, 33 table
games, 696 hotel rooms including 17 suites, a tropical pool area, retail
outlets, a day spa, and dining and entertainment options which include a
Hooters restaurant, and Dan Marino&#146;s restaurant, (which began offering 24 hour
service as of October&nbsp;24, 2007, when the coffee shop was closed) a sports
bar, and several bars and Night Owl Showroom. The renovations included a
redesign of the main entrance, a renovation and expansion of the casino and
restaurant areas, a remodel of the hotel rooms and a renovation and expansion
of the pool area.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Significant intercompany
transactions between the Company and its wholly owned subsidiary have been
eliminated in consolidation.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">55</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">155 East Tropicana, LLC </font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(A Nevada Limited-Liability Company)</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-variant:normal !important;">NOTES TO
CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (CONTINUED)</font></b></h3>

<h3 align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></h3>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">2.&nbsp;&nbsp;Summary of
Significant Accounting Principles</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.3pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Cash and Cash Equivalents.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; The Company considers all highly liquid investments
purchased with original maturities of three months or less to be cash
equivalents.&#160; The carrying amount of cash
and equivalents approximates its fair value.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Accounts Receivable.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;"> Accounts
receivable are due within one year and are recorded net of amounts estimated to
be uncollectible.&#160; The Company reserves
an estimated amount for receivables to reduce the receivables to their net
realizable value which approximate fair value.&#160;
Historical collection rates and customer relationships of the previously
operated H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo were considered in determining the reserve.&#160; Bad debt expense was $160,880, $ 233,027, and
$10,000 for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2007 and 2006 and 2005.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Inventories.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; Inventories are stated at the lower of cost
(using the first-in, first-out method) or market value.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Property and Equipment.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; Property and equipment are stated at
cost.&#160; Costs of improvements are
capitalized. Cost of normal repairs and maintenance are charged to expense as
incurred.&#160; Upon the sale or retirement of
property and equipment, the cost and related accumulated depreciation are
removed from the respective accounts, and the resulting gain or loss, if any,
is included in the accompanying consolidated statements of operations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Depreciation is provided on
a straight-line basis over the estimated useful life of the assets.&#160; The service lives of assets are generally 30
to 40&nbsp;years for buildings and 3 to 10&nbsp;years for furniture and
equipment.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The carrying values of the
Company&#146;s assets are reviewed when events or changes in circumstances indicate
that the carrying amount of the asset may not be recoverable in accordance with
<i>Financial Accounting Standards Board (FASB)
Statement No.&nbsp;144, Accounting for the Impairment or Disposal of Long-lived
Assets</i>.&#160; Under SFAS No.&nbsp;144,
an asset impairment is determined to exist when events or changes in
circumstances indicate that the carrying amount of an asset may not be
recoverable and if estimated future cash flows, undiscounted and without
interest charges, are less than the carrying amount.&#160; If it is determined that an impairment has
occurred, then an impairment loss is recognized in the consolidated statement
of operations and the related assets are adjusted to their estimated fair value
less sales costs.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">56</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='56',FILE='C:\JMS\wbruce\08-2823-1\task2827333\2823-1-fa-03.htm',USER='wbruce',CD='Mar 31 12:52 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">155 East Tropicana, LLC</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(A Nevada Limited-Liability Company)</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-variant:normal !important;">NOTES TO
CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (CONTINUED)</font></b></h3>

<h3 align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></h3>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">2.&nbsp;&nbsp;Summary of
Significant Accounting Principles (continued)</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Deferred Financing Costs.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; Deferred financing costs consist of loan
origination and commitment fees and are amortized to interest expense over the
term of the related financing on a straight line basis which approximates the
effective interest rate method.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Intangible Assets.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; Intangible assets represent (1)&nbsp;the
value of intellectual property related to the Hooters brand contributed to the
Company pursuant to an assignment agreement with Florida Hooters LLC, (2)&nbsp;the
value of the slot club customer list acquired for Eastern&nbsp;&amp; Western,
and (3)&nbsp;the excess of the purchase price over the fair market value of the
assets acquired (&#147;Goodwill&#148;). </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160;The
intellectual property related to the Hooters brand contributed to the Company
and the Goodwill are intangible assets not subject to amortization.&#160; The slot customer list is being amortized
using the straight line method over five years.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.3pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In accordance with SFAS 142, &#147;Goodwill and Other
Intangible Assets&#148;, the Company tests for impairment of goodwill and
indefinite-lived intangible assets annually. For the years ending December&nbsp;31,
2007 and 2006, we utilized the Income Approach for goodwill, which focuses on
the </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">income</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">-producing
capability of the respective property during the fourth quarter of each fiscal
year. The underlying premise of this approach is that the value of an asset can
be measured by the present worth of the net economic benefit (cash receipts
less cash outlays) to be received over the life of the subject asset. The steps
followed in applying this approach include estimating the expected after-tax
cash flows attributable to the property and converting these after-tax cash
flows to present value through discounting. The discounting process uses a rate
of return, which accounts for the both the time value of money and investment
risk factors. The present value of the after-tax cash flows is the totaled to
arrive at an indication of the fair value of the assets. If the fair value of
the assets exceeds the carrying value, the impairment is measured based on the
difference between the calculated fair value and the carrying value. We
determined that there was no impairment during 2007 or 2006.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Jackpots and Prizes.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;"> The Company
has progressive slot machines.&#160; As coins
are played, the amount available to win increases and will be paid out when the
jackpot is awarded.&#160; In accordance with
industry practice, the Company records the liability and expense related to
such progressives as incurred.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Participation Fees.&#160; </font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Participation fees paid to
slot machine manufacturers are classified as a reduction of revenue.&#160; During the years ended December&nbsp;31,
2007, 2006 and 2005, the Company paid participation fees totaling $1,442,263,
$1,245,181 and $34,040, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Casino Revenues and Promotional
Allowances</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">.&#160; In
accordance with industry practice, the Company recognizes as casino revenue the
net win from gaming activities, which is the difference between gaming wins and
losses.&#160; The retail value of rooms, food,
and beverage furnished to customers without charge is included in gross
revenues and then deducted as promotional allowances.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">57</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='57',FILE='C:\JMS\wbruce\08-2823-1\task2827333\2823-1-fa-03.htm',USER='wbruce',CD='Mar 31 12:52 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">155 East Tropicana, LLC </font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(A Nevada Limited-Liability Company)</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-variant:normal !important;">NOTES TO
CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (CONTINUED)</font></b></h3>

<h3 align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></h3>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">2.&nbsp;&nbsp;Summary of
Significant Accounting Principles (continued)</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The estimated departmental
cost of providing such promotional allowances is included in casino costs and
expenses and consists of the following for the years ended December&nbsp;31,
2007, 2006 and 2005 (dollars in thousands):</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.3pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
