  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">123</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:.94%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Player Club Points.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; The Company&#146;s slot club allows customers to
earn certain complimentary products and/or cash, based on the volume of the
customer&#146;s gaming activity.&#160; The Company
has recorded a liability for the estimated cost of the products and/or cash
earned by customers.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s slot club
program allows customers to redeem points earned from their gaming activity for
complimentary food, beverage, rooms, entertainment, and merchandise.&#160; At the time redeemed, the retail value of
complimentaries under the program is recorded as revenue with a corresponding
offsetting amount included in promotional allowances.&#160; The cost associated with complimentary food,
beverage, rooms, entertainment, and merchandise redeemed under the program is
recorded in casino operating expenses.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In February&nbsp;2001, the
Emerging Issues Task Force (&#147;EITF&#148;) of the Financial Accounting Standards Board
(&#147;FASB&#148;) reached a consensus in EITF Issue No.&nbsp;00-22, &#147;Accounting for &#145;Points&#146;
and Certain Other Time-Based or Volume-Based Sales Incentive Offers, and Offers
for Free Products to be Delivered in the Future.&#148;&#160; EITF Issue No.&nbsp;00-22 requires that the
redemption of points for cash be recognized as a reduction of revenue.&#160; In accordance with EITF Issue No.&nbsp;00-22,
the Company has recorded the retail value of points earned and redeemed for
complimentary services/cash rebates as promotional allowances.&#160; Such amounts totaled $535,905, $114,150 and
$13,895 for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2007, 2006 and 2005 respectively.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Advertising.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; Prepaid advertising costs are expensed the
first time the advertising takes place.&#160;
Prepaid advertising included in prepaid expenses was $293,427 and
$99,296 at December&nbsp;31, 2007, and 2006 respectively.&#160; Advertising costs included in general and
administrative expenses were $4,379,402, $6,029,798 and $157,778 for the years
ended December&nbsp;31, 2007, 2006, and 2005, respectively.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">58</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='58',FILE='C:\JMS\wbruce\08-2823-1\task2827333\2823-1-fa-03.htm',USER='wbruce',CD='Mar 31 12:52 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">is <b>155 East Tropicana, LLC <br>
(A Nevada Limited-Liability Company)</b></font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-variant:normal !important;">NOTES TO
CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (CONTINUED)</font></b></h3>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">2.&nbsp;&nbsp;Summary of
Significant Accounting Principles (continued)</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.3pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Capitalized Interest.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; The interest cost associated with a major construction
project is capitalized and included in the cost of the project.&#160; When no debt is incurred </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">specifically</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;"> for a project, interest is
capitalized on amounts expended on the project using the weighted-average cost
of the Company&#146;s outstanding borrowings.&#160;
Capitalized interest was $-0-, $202,873 and $692,059 for the years ended
December&nbsp;31, 2007, 2006, and 2005 respectively.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Income Taxes.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; The Company is a limited-liability company
and is taxed as a partnership for federal income tax purposes. Accordingly, no
provision for federal income taxes has been recorded in the accompanying
consolidated financial statements since the taxable income or loss is included
in the income tax return of the members.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Pre-opening Expenses.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; Pre-opening costs are expensed as incurred,
consistent with Statement of Position 98-5, <i>Reporting on the Costs of
Start-up Activities</i>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Use of Estimates.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; The preparation of financial statements in
conformity with generally accepted accounting principles in the United States
requires management to make estimates and assumptions that affect the reported
amounts of assets and liabilities and disclosure of contingent assets and
liabilities at the date of the financial statements, and the reported amounts
revenues and expenses during the reporting periods. Actual results could differ
from those estimates.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Reclassifications.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; Certain reclassifications, having no effect
on net loss, have been made to the previously issued consolidated financial
statements to conform to the current period&#146;s presentation of the Company&#146;s
financial statements.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Recently Issued Accounting
Pronouncements.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In September&nbsp;2006, the
FASB issued SFAS&#160; No.&nbsp;157, <i>Fair Value Measurements</i>, which defines
fair value, establishes a framework for measuring fair value in GAAP, and
expands disclosures about fair value measurements.&#160; SFAS 157 does not require any new fair value
measurements, but provides guidance on how to measure fair value by providing a
fair value hierarch used to classify the source of the information.&#160; SFAS 157 is effective for financial
statements issued for fiscal years beginning after November&nbsp;15, 2007 and
interim periods within these fiscal years.&#160;
In February&nbsp;2008, FASB issued FASB Staff Position (&#147;FSP&#148;) FAS
157-2, which defers the effective date of SFAS 157 to fiscal years beginning
after November&nbsp;15, 2008, and interim periods within those fiscal years,
for nonfinancial assets and nonfinancial liabilities that are recognized or
disclosed at fair value in an entity&#146;s financial statements on a recurring
basis.&#160; We are evaluating SFAS 157 and
have not yet determined the determined the impact the adoption will have on the
consolidated financial statements.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">59</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='59',FILE='C:\JMS\wbruce\08-2823-1\task2827333\2823-1-fa-03.htm',USER='wbruce',CD='Mar 31 12:52 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">155 East Tropicana, LLC <br>
(A Nevada Limited-Liability Company)</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-variant:normal !important;">NOTES TO
CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (CONTINUED)</font></b></h3>

<h3 align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></h3>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">2.&nbsp;&nbsp;Summary of
Significant Accounting Principles (continued)</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.3pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In February&nbsp;2007, the
FASB issued SFAS No.&nbsp;159, <i>The Fair
Value Option for Financial Assets and Financial Liabilities</i>.
SFAS&nbsp;159 permits entities to choose to measure many financial instruments
and certain other items at fair value. The objective of the guidance is to
improve financial reporting by providing entities with the opportunity to
mitigate volatility in reported earnings caused by measuring </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">related</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;"> assets and liabilities
differently without having to apply complex hedge accounting provisions. SFAS
159 is effective as of the beginning of the first fiscal year after November&nbsp;15,
2007. Early adoption is permitted as of the beginning of the fiscal year on or
before November&nbsp;15, 2007, provided the provisions of SFAS 157 are also
applied.&#160; We are evaluating our options
provided for under this statement and their potential impact on the
consolidated financial statements when implemented.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In December&nbsp;2007, the
FASB issued SFAS 160,&#148;Noncontrolling Interests in Consolidated Financial
Statements-An Amendment of ARB No.&nbsp;51&#148;.&#160;
SFAS 160 establishes new accounting and reporting standards for the
noncontrolling interest in a subsidiary and for the deconsolidation of a
subsidiary.&#160; Specifically, this statement
requires the recognition of a noncontrolling interest as equity in the
consolidated financial statements and separate from the parent&#146;s equity.&#160; In addition, the amount of net income attributable
to the noncontrolling interest should be included in consolidated net income on
the face of the income statement.&#160; SFAS
160 is effective for fiscal years, and interim periods within those fiscal
years, beginning on or after December&nbsp;15, 2008.&#160; Early adoption is prohibited.&#160; We are evaluating SFAS 160 and have not yet
determined the impact the adoption will have on the consolidated financial
statements.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In December&nbsp;2007, FASB
issued SFAS 141R, &#147;Business Combinations&#148;.&#160;
Under SFAS 141R, an acquiring entity will be required to recognize all
the assets acquired and liabilities assumed in a transaction at the
acquisition-date fair value, with limited exceptions, replacing SFAS 141&#146;s
cost-allocation process.&#160; SFAS 141R also
includes a substantial number of new disclosure requirements.&#160; SFAS 141R is to be applied prospectively to
business combinations for which the acquisition date is on or after the
beginning of the first annual reporting period beginning on or after December&nbsp;15,
2008.&#160; Early adoption is prohibited.&#160; We will adopt SFAS 141R in the first quarter
of 2009.&#160; The impact on our accounting
for future business combinations once adopted will be dependent upon
acquisitions that are made in the future.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">60</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='60',FILE='C:\JMS\wbruce\08-2823-1\task2827333\2823-1-fa-03.htm',USER='wbruce',CD='Mar 31 12:52 2008' -->

<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">155 East Tropicana, LLC <br>
(A Nevada Limited-Liability Company)</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-variant:normal !important;">NOTES TO
CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (CONTINUED)</font></b></h3>

</table>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">4.&nbsp;&nbsp;Intangible Assets</font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.3pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Intangible assets consist of
the following at December&nbsp;31, 2007 and 2006 (dollars in thousands):</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.3pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Intellectual property.&#160; </font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company has entered into
an assignment agreement with Florida Hooters LLC which grants the Company the
right to use certain intellectual property in connection with the operations of
the Hooters Casino Hotel.&#160; The
intellectual property consists of (i)&nbsp;an exclusive license for the Hooters
trademark and logo insignia in connection with gaming, casino or combined
hotel, gaming and casino operations, (ii)&nbsp;a non-exclusive license to use
the Hooters restaurant concept, (iii)&nbsp;an exclusive license to operate and
promote restaurants, taverns, lounges and &#147;Dan Marino&#146;s Fine Food&nbsp;&amp;
Spirits&#148; (iv)&nbsp;a non-exclusive, royalty-free license to use </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">the</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;"> Pete&nbsp;&amp; Shorty&#146;s
mark at a restaurant, bar and lounge, in each case solely for purposes of a
Hooters Casino Hotel located at the H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo property.&#160; These intangible assets were initially valued
at $1.1&nbsp;million by management when contributed, pending completion of a
third party valuation.&#160; The intangible
assets were subsequently valued at $4.2 million by an independent third party
appraiser and are reflected as such in on the accompanying consolidated balance
sheet at December&nbsp;31, 2007 and 2006.&#160;
Management believes the intellectual property acquired through the
assignment agreements to be indefinite-lived intangibles.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">61</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='61',FILE='C:\JMS\wbruce\08-2823-1\task2827333\2823-1-fa-03.htm',USER='wbruce',CD='Mar 31 12:52 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">155 East Tropicana, LLC <br>
(A Nevada Limited-Liability Company)</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-variant:normal !important;">NOTES TO
CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (CONTINUED)</font></b></h3>

<h3 align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></h3>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">4.&nbsp;&nbsp;Intangible
Assets (continued)</font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.3pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Hooters trademark and
logo insignia are the exclusive property of HI Limited Partnership.&#160; Florida Hooters LLC originally obtained the
license for the trademark and logo insignia through an assignment from Hooters
Gaming Corporation, an affiliated entity under common ownership with Hooters
Gaming LLC.&#160; Hooters Gaming Corporation
is owned directly or indirectly by certain members of the Company or members of
the Company&#146;s management board.&#160; The
underlying license agreement was executed<b>  </b>between
HI&nbsp;Limited Partnership and Hooters Gaming Corporation and granted to
Hooters Gaming Corporation an exclusive license to use the licensed
intellectual property in connection with gaming, casino or combined hotel,
gaming and casino operations within the State of Nevada.&#160; Hooters Gaming Corporation retained any and
all rights and obligations in the licensed intellectual property pursuant to
the license agreement for all locations within the State of Nevada other than
the Hooters Casino Hotel.&#160; The Company
began the use of the licensed intellectual property in connection with licensed
gaming activities when the hotel casino was reopened as the new Hooters Casino
Hotel on February&nbsp;3, 2006</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.3pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Hooters restaurant
concept is the exclusive property of Hooters of America,&nbsp;Inc., an
unrelated party. Florida Hooters LLC originally obtained the right for use of
the Hooters restaurant concept at the Hooters Casino Hotel through an
assignment from Hooters Gaming </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Corporation</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">, who in turn, was granted
the right from Las Vegas Wings,&nbsp;Inc., an affiliated entity under common
ownership with Lags Ventures, LLC.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Pursuant to the terms of the
assignment agreement with Florida Hooters LLC related to the Hooters trademark,
logo, and restaurant concept and Lags Ventures, LLC related to the Dan Marino&#146;s
concept restaurants, the Company must pay fees and royalties to Hooters Gaming
Corporation, HI Limited Partnership, Las Vegas Wings,&nbsp;Inc. and Lags
Ventures,&nbsp;Inc.&#160; Payments to Hooters
Gaming<b>  </b>Corporation are accrued at three
percent of all net profits directly earned from the gaming activities at the
Hooters Casino Hotel.&#160; HI Limited
Partnership will be paid an annual fee equal to $500.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In addition, the Company is
required to pay HI Limited Partnership a royalty in an amount equal to two
percent of all net revenues generated in connection with licensed activities
which includes net revenues generated in connection with the Hooters restaurant
operation.&#160; Las Vegas Wings, Inc is paid
a consent fee equal to four percent of gross sales from any Hooters branded
restaurant and three percent of the gross cash sales of any merchandise with a
Hooters logo, on or near the Hooters Casino Hotel.&#160; Lags Ventures,&nbsp;Inc. is paid a fee by the
Company equal to six percent of net revenues generated by the Dan Marino&#146;s Fine
Food and Spirits and located in the Hooters Casino Hotel. Payment of these fees
is restricted under the indenture governing the Notes.&#160; Use of the Pete&nbsp;&amp; Shorty&#146;s mark
partly owned by certain members of the Company&#146;s management board is
royalty-free.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">62</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='62',FILE='C:\JMS\wbruce\08-2823-1\task2827333\2823-1-fa-03.htm',USER='wbruce',CD='Mar 31 12:52 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">155 East Tropicana, LLC <br>
(A Nevada Limited-Liability Company)</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-variant:normal !important;">NOTES TO
CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (CONTINUED)</font></b></h3>

<h3 align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></h3>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">4.&nbsp;&nbsp;Intangible
Assets (continued)</font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.3pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Hooters Gaming Corporation,
HI Limited Partnership, and Las Vegas Wings,&nbsp;Inc. agreed to subordinate
payment of their respective fees in favor of certain payments required under
the Company&#146;s operating agreement.&#160;
Payment is further subject to meeting certain financial ratios
associated with the Company&#146;s Notes</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Slot customer list.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; As part of the acquisition of the real
property and other assets of the H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo (see Note 2), the Company
acquired the slot customer list valued by a third-party appraiser at
$260,000.&#160; It is being amortized over
five years using the straight line method.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Goodwill.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; As part of the allocation of the purchase
price of the H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo (see Note 2), the Company recorded goodwill from
the acquisition of H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo, representing the excess of the purchase
price over the fair market value of assets acquired.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">5.&nbsp;&nbsp;Long-term Debt</font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="letter-spacing:.3pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Notes
Offering</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="letter-spacing:.3pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.3pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On March&nbsp;29, 2005, the
Company issued $130.0 million aggregate principal amount of 8&#190;% Senior Secured
Notes due 2012, in a private placement (the &#147;old notes&#148;).&#160; On August&nbsp;5, 2005, the Company
successfully exchanged all of the old notes for new notes (&#147;the Notes&#148;).&#160; The Notes have </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">substantially</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;"> identical terms as the old
notes, except that the Notes have been registered under the Securities Act of
1933.&#160; Interest payments on the Notes are
due semi annually, on April&nbsp;1 and October&nbsp;1.&#160; The Notes are secured by all of the Company&#146;s
and, to the extent in existence, subsidiary guarantors&#146;&#160; 1)&#160;
existing and future assets&#160; (other
than certain excluded existing and future assets), 2) the Company&#146;s equity
interest in any guarantors and 3) existing renovation disbursement and interest
reserve accounts as described below.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Notes are redeemable at the option of the
Company on or after April&nbsp;1, 2009. The indenture governing the Notes
contains certain provisions which restrict or limit the Company&#146;s ability to,
among other things, incur more debt, pay dividends, redeem stock or make other
distributions, enter into transactions with affiliates or transfer or sell
assets. The Company used the proceeds from the Notes to retire existing
indebtedness and (together with cash from operations and proceeds from equipment
financing), renovate and construct the Hooters Casino Hotel and provide for
general working capital needs.&#160; Related
to this retirement of the then existing indebtedness, the Company recognized a
loss on extinguishment of debt in the amount of $2,246,526 during the year
ended December&nbsp;31, 2005.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">63</font></p>

<div align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='63',FILE='C:\JMS\wbruce\08-2823-1\task2827333\2823-1-fa-03.htm',USER='wbruce',CD='Mar 31 12:52 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">155 East Tropicana, LLC <br>
(A Nevada Limited-Liability Company)</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-variant:normal !important;">NOTES TO
CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (CONTINUED)</font></b></h3>

<h3 align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></h3>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">5.&nbsp;&nbsp;Long-term Debt
(continued)</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Senior Secured Credit Facility</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company entered into a $15.0 million senior secured credit facility
(the &#147;Credit Facility&#148;) concurrently with the offering of the old notes.&#160; The Credit Facility is a four-year revolving
credit facility of $15.0 million, maturing on March&nbsp;30, 2009. The Credit
Facility has no financial covenant requirements.&#160; The Company drew $6.3 million against the
Credit Facility as of December&nbsp;31, 2007.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">At the Company&#146;s option, the interest rate will be either the agent for
the lender&#146;s prime rate plus 2.00% per annum or LIBOR plus 3.50% per
annum.&#160; As of December&nbsp;31, 2007, the
Credit Facility carried an interest rate of 8.54% per annum.&#160; All the obligations under the Credit Facility
are secured by first priority liens on and security interest in all of the
Company&#146;s and any guarantor&#146;s existing and future properties and assets.&#160; The lien on the collateral that secures the
Notes are contractually subordinated to the liens securing the principal amount
of borrowings under the Credit Facility of up to $15.0 million (plus related
interest, fees, indemnities, costs and expenses).&#160; The Credit Facility required the Company to
pay unused commitment fees of 0.50% per annum on any unused portion of the
Credit Facility, and, if terminated prior to the third anniversary date, a
prepayment premium of 1.00% of the maximum credit amount for each year or
partial year remaining from the termination date to the third anniversary date.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Intercreditor
Agreement</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.3pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Concurrently with the
closing of the old notes offering and the Credit Facility, the Company entered
into an intercreditor agreement, which defines the rights of the lenders under
the Credit Facility in relation to the rights of the trustee and the holders of
the Notes with respect to<b>  </b>the collateral
securing the Notes. The intercreditor agreement, among other things, provides
that the liens securing the Notes and any guarantees thereof are contractually
subordinated (other than the security interests in the renovation disbursement
account, which will be senior, and interest reserve account, which will not
secure the Credit Facility) to the liens securing the principal amount of
indebtedness of up to $15.0 million (plus related interest, fees, indemnities,
costs and expenses) under the Credit Facility. The trustee&#146;s ability to
exercise rights and remedies in respect of the collateral are also subject to
the terms of the intercreditor agreement.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Equipment Purchase Agreements</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During
the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2007, and 2006 the Company entered into loan
agreements to purchase approximately $0.3 million and $6.2 million in
equipment, respectively.&#160; The loans,
which are collateralized by the equipment purchased, have terms ranging from 12
months to 5 years.&#160; Interest rates
imputed on slot equipment purchases of $6.0 million and hotel equipment
purchase of $0.5 million were 3.3% and 11.8%, respectively.&#160; At December&nbsp;31, 2007 and 2006, $2.3
million and $4.0 million were outstanding under these agreements, respectively.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">64</font></p>

<div align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">155 East Tropicana, LLC <br>
(A Nevada Limited-Liability Company)</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-variant:normal !important;">NOTES TO
CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (CONTINUED)</font></b></h3>

<h3 style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></h3>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">5.&nbsp;&nbsp;Long-term Debt
(continued)</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.3pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Scheduled </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">maturities</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;"> of long-term debt are as
follows (amount in thousands):</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.56%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="82%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:82.88%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2010</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.58%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="11%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:11.96%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">41</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.56%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="82%" valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:82.88%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2011</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.58%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="11%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:11.96%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.56%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="82%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:82.88%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2012</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.58%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="11%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:11.96%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">130,000</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.56%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>

 <tr>
  <td width="82%" valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:82.88%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Thereafter</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.58%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="11%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:11.96%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#151;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.56%;">

  </td>

  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">138,587</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.56%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>

</table>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">6. Membership Interests</font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The initial capital
contributions and membership interests in the Company for Florida Hooters LLC
and EW Common LLC were established in exchange for the following:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Florida
Hooters LLC contributed $5.0&nbsp;million in cash and the intellectual property
described in Note&nbsp;4 for a 66 </font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.0pt;position:relative;top:-3.0pt;">2</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">/</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.0pt;">3</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">% membership
interest in the Company. Further, all pre-development costs incurred by Florida
Hooters LLC are credited to the Florida Hooters LLC capital account.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">EW
Common LLC received a 33 </font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.0pt;position:relative;top:-3.0pt;">1</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">/</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.0pt;">3</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">% membership
interest with priority return for a $20.0&nbsp;million deemed initial capital
contribution as part of the Company&#146;s acquisition of the real property and
non-gaming assets of the H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo. In October&nbsp;2005, the Company
secured their gaming and liquor licenses and on November&nbsp;1, 2005, assumed
the operations of the hotel casino.&#160; Upon
obtaining the necessary licenses to operate the hotel casino, the Company
acquired the gaming assets from Eastern&nbsp;&amp; Western consisting primarily
of slot machines and customer lists and credited the capital account of EW
Common LLC for an additional $5.0 million.&#160;
A 4% priority rate of return on the membership interest held by EW
Common LLC commenced accruing upon completion of the renovation and the
re-opening of Hooters Casino Hotel.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">7.&nbsp;&nbsp;Profit-Sharing
Plan</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.3pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Company</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;"> has a deferred compensation
plan established pursuant to Section&nbsp;401(k)&nbsp;of the Internal Revenue
Code for all regular full-time employees not covered by a collective bargaining
agreement who have completed at least three months of continuous service.&#160; The Company&#146;s<b>  </b>contributions
to the plan are at the</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">65</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">155 East Tropicana, LLC <br>
(A Nevada Limited-Liability Company)</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-variant:normal !important;">NOTES TO
CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (CONTINUED)</font></b></h3>

<h3 style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></h3>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">7.&#160; Profit-Sharing Plan (continued)</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">discretion of the Company&#146;s
management board. The Company&#146;s plan allows for a Company match of 25% of each
dollar contributed by the employee, not to exceed 1% of a participant&#146;s annual
compensation.&#160; Contributions of
approximately $77,000 and $66,000 were made by the Company in 2007 and 2006, </font><b><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;</font></b><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">respectively. There were no
such contributions made during 2005.&#160;
Amounts expensed under the plan for administrative expenses for the
years ended December&nbsp;31, 2007, 2006 and 2005 totaled $12,145, $5,046 and
$2,556, respectively.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">8.&#160; Lease Agreements</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.3pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company, as lessor,
entered into a casino lease and hotel lease with Eastern&nbsp;&amp; Western
covering the real property and non-gaming assets of the H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo acquired
by the Company.&#160; The leases were
subsequently terminated on October&nbsp;31, 2005 and the operations of the
hotel and casino were assumed by the Company on November&nbsp;1, 2005.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Prior to its termination on October&nbsp;31,
2005, the casino lease covered those portions of the H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo containing
the showroom, gaming and liquor servicing areas, the casino floor where gaming
activities occur, surveillance areas, count rooms, the cashier&#146;s cage and other
areas ancillary to the casino footprint.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Minimum monthly base-rent
payments of $125,000 were due from August&nbsp;3, 2004 until the termination of
the lease on October&nbsp;31, 2005.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.3pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Under the provisions of the
casino lease, Eastern&nbsp;&amp; Western was allowed to deposit $30,000 into a &#147;Capital
Reserve Account&#148; each month for capital improvements to the casino such as the
purchase of gaming devices.&#160; The casino
lease also provided for Eastern&nbsp;&amp; Western </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">to</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;"> fund $120,000 each month to a &#147;Change in
Control Reserve&#148; and $55,000 to establish an &#147;Expense Reserve&#148; to be used for
the payment of legal, accounting, and professional fees and other general
business expenses including licensing renewal costs.&#160; To the extent that these reserves were not
used, they were paid to Eastern&nbsp;&amp; Western at the termination of the
lease.&#160; On December&nbsp;12, 2005, a
payment of $1,127,628 was made to Eastern&nbsp;&amp; Western by the Company for
the balance of the reserves at October&nbsp;31, 2005, which was treated by the
Company as a purchase price adjustment.&#160;
Rental income earned under the casino lease totaled $1,250,000 for the
year ended December&nbsp;31, 2005.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Hotel Lease</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.3pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The hotel lease between
Eastern&nbsp;&amp; Western and the Company covered those portions of the H&#244;tel
San R&#233;mo containing all non-casino areas, </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">including</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;"> the hotel.&#160; The hotel lease was terminated on October&nbsp;31,
2005.&#160;&#160; Minimum lease payments due under
the hotel lease consisted of a minimum rent and a percentage rent.&#160; The minimum rent was $250,000 per month.&#160;&#160; The percentage rent was equal to 100% of all</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">66</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='66',FILE='C:\JMS\wbruce\08-2823-1\task2827333\2823-1-fa-03.htm',USER='wbruce',CD='Mar 31 12:52 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">155 East Tropicana, LLC <br>
(A Nevada Limited-Liability Company)</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-variant:normal !important;">NOTES TO
CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (CONTINUED)</font></b></h3>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">8.&#160; Lease
Agreements (continued)</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">revenues
received from the operations of the hotel, less actual operational expenses
(including minimum rent).&#160; The minimum
rent was paid on a monthly basis on the first of each month and the percentage
rent was paid in arrears on the first of each month.&#160; Percentage rental income earned for the year
ended December&nbsp;31, 2005 was $1,689,324. The total rental income earned
under the hotel lease was $4,189,324 for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2005.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">9.&nbsp;&nbsp;Related Party Transactions</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Royalties
Expense</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.3pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Pursuant to agreements
related to the use of certain trademarks (see Note 4), the Company must pay
fees and royalties to related parties. &nbsp;A fee equal to 3% of all net
profits earned from gaming activities is payable to Hooters Gaming Corporation,
a consent fee equal to 6% of net revenues generated by the Dan Marino&#146;s
Restaurant is payable to Lags Ventures,&nbsp;Inc. and a fee of 4% of cash sales
from Hooters branded restaurant, and 3% of the gross sales with any merchandise
with a Hooters logo, is payable to Las Vegas Wings,&nbsp;Inc.&nbsp; The total
fees accrued at December&nbsp;31, 2007 for Hooters Gaming Corporation, Lags
Venture,&nbsp;Inc. and Las Vegas Wings,&nbsp;Inc. were $1.5 million, $0.5
million, and $0.9 million, respectively.&#160;
As the Hooters Casino Hotel opening did not occur until February&nbsp;2006,
no fees were accrued by the Company for these royalties during the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2005.&#160; The payment of these royalty fees
is restricted under the indenture governing the Notes.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Hawkeye
Construction and Millwork,&nbsp;Inc.</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.3pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Hawkeye Construction and
Millwork,&nbsp;Inc. are co-owned by David Lageschulte, a member of the Company&#146;s
management board and an indirect beneficial owner of 33.27% of the Company&#146;s
membership interests.&#160; Hawkeye
Construction and Millwork,&nbsp;Inc. managed the construction and renovation of
the Hooters Casino Hotel and received as compensation for such services 2% of
the construction and furniture, fixtures and equipment costs, not to exceed a
total of $600,000.&#160; The Company&#146;s
payments to Hawkeye Construction and Millwork,&nbsp;Inc. in relation to the
construction and renovation management agreement totaled $0.1 million and $0.5
million for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2006 and 2005, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Provident
Advertising&nbsp;&amp; Marketing,&nbsp;Inc.</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.3pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The majority shareholder of
Provident Advertising&nbsp;&amp; Marketing,&nbsp;Inc. (&#147;Provident&#148;) is Edward
C. Droste, a member of the Company&#146;s management board and an indirect
beneficial owner of 3.96% of the Company&#146;s membership interests.&#160; Provident was engaged by the Company to
provide services related to the planning and development of an initial
advertising and marketing plan and for the continued development and
implementation of a strategic marketing plan for the Hooters Casino Hotel.&#160; They continue to be involved as the Company&#146;s
advertising firm.&#160; In addition, the
Company purchases Hooters logo items from Provident for uniforms and for resale
in the Company&#146;s gift shops.&#160; The fees
paid to</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">67</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">155 East Tropicana, LLC <br>
(A Nevada Limited-Liability Company)</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-variant:normal !important;">NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED
FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (CONTINUED)</font></b></h3>

<h3 align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></h3>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">9.
Related Party Transactions (Continued)</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Provident
during the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2007, 2006, and 2005 totaled $1.8
million, $3.0 million, and $0.3 million, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.3pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Notes issued by the Company require the Company to engage an independent
valuation firm to determine that the related party transactions are valued at
arm&#146;s-length prices if the total expenditures to Provident aggregate $2.5
million. In 2006, a nationally-recognized </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">valuation firm issued a favorable opinion that the
related party transactions with Provident had been conducted in a manner
consistent with the arm&#146;s-length standard.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">10.&nbsp;&nbsp;Commitments and Contingencies</font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;letter-spacing:-.1pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;">Litigation</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.3pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.3pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">From
time to time, the Company is a party to various claims arising in the normal
course of business.&#160; Management believes,
however, that there are no proceedings pending or threatened against the
Company which, if determined adversely, would have a material adverse effect on
the Company&#146;s financial condition, results of operations or liquidity.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;letter-spacing:-.1pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;">Contractual
Commitments</font></i></b></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;letter-spacing:-.1pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.3pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company has entered into
operational contracts totaling $6.13 million at December&nbsp;31, 2007.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Hooters of America Royalty Payments</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:10.1pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.3pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Beginning on February&nbsp;3,
2006, the Company was required to pay the owner of the Hooters trademark,
Hooters of America, a royalty fee equal to 2% of all net revenues of the hotel
and casino (excluding the Dan Marino&#146;s Restaurant and 13 Martini Bar) and 1% of
revenues from the Pete and Shorty&#146;s Tavern less miscellaneous expenses.&#160; The total fees paid to Hooters of America
were approximately $1.2 million and $1.3 million for the years ended December&nbsp;31,
2007 and 2006, respectively.&#160; These fees
are included in general and administrative expenses on the accompanying condensed
consolidated statements of operations.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:10.1pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Preferred Return</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:10.1pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.3pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s membership
interests include an EW Common LLC preferred account which accumulates a
preferred return rate of 4% per annum on the $25.0 million account
balance.&#160; Such preferred return began
accumulating on March&nbsp;1, 2006, and accumulates whether or not there are
profits or funds available for the payment of the preferred return.&#160; Under the Notes indenture, the preferred
return to EW Common LLC is payable only if the Company&#146;s coverage ratio of
EBITDA to fixed charges (as defined in the indenture and after giving effect to
the payment of the preferred return) is 1.5 to 1 for the fiscal year as
measured after the close of the fiscal year.&#160;
As of December&nbsp;31, 2007, $1.8 million relating to the preferred
account has accumulated, but has not been paid.&#160;
As the Company&#146;s coverage ratio of</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">68</font></p>
