<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">East Tropicana, LLC <br>
(A Nevada Limited-Liability Company)</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-variant:normal !important;">NOTES TO
CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (CONTINUED)</font></b></h3>

<h3 align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></h3>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">10.&nbsp;&nbsp;Commitments and Contingencies
(continued)</font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">EBITDA
to fixed charges did not meet this defined ratio, no liability has been
recorded in the accompanying consolidated financial statements at December&nbsp;31,
2007.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">11.&nbsp;&nbsp;Asset
Purchase Agreement</font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.3pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:.3pt;">On April&nbsp;30, 2007, the Company entered into a
definitive Asset Purchase Agreement (the &#147;Agreement&#148;) with Hedwigs Las Vegas
Top Tier, LLC (the &#147;Buyer&#148;), and on May&nbsp;3, 2007, the Company entered into
a definitive Casino Operations Lease (the &#147;Lease&#148;) with the Buyer. On May&nbsp;7,
2007, the Company entered into a First Amendment to Asset Purchase Agreement
with the Buyer. Additionally, on August&nbsp;8, 2007, the Company entered into
a Second Amendment to Asset Purchase Agreement with the Buyer.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.3pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Under
the terms of the Agreement, as amended, the Buyer has offered to purchase
essentially all of the assets of the Company for a purchase price of $95.0
million in cash, the payment of certain accrued royalties, and the assumption
of certain outstanding liabilities of the Company. The Buyer will also be
responsible for the Company&#146;s $130.0 million in principal amount of 8.75%
Senior Secured Notes due 2012.&#160; In
connection with the Agreement, as amended, the Company has received three
nonrefundable deposit payments from the Buyer, including (1)&nbsp;a $1.0
million payment on May&nbsp;7, 2007 and (2)&nbsp;a $0.5 million payment on August&nbsp;14,
2007 and a $1.5 million deposit payment on November&nbsp;26, 2007.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.3pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">All
deposits will be applied against the purchase price if the transaction closes.
The Agreement, as amended, provides for a closing date on or before December&nbsp;31,
2007, which the Buyer may extend under certain conditions by paying $0.5
million for each month the Agreement is extended. Four extension fees of $0.5
million each were received by the Company on December&nbsp;31, 2007, January&nbsp;31,
2008, February&nbsp;29, 2008 and March 31, 2008.&#160; The extension fees paid are not refundable
and will not be credited toward the purchase price. Notwithstanding the Buyer&#146;s
right to extend the closing date, the Company may terminate the Agreement if
the closing has not occurred on or before June&nbsp;30, 2008.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.3pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As
provided in the Agreement, the closing will be subject to the completion of due
diligence, financing, and licensing, among other customary conditions. There
can be no assurance that (i)&nbsp;the conditions to closing under Agreement
will ever be satisfied, or (ii)&nbsp;any transaction contemplated under the
Agreement will be consummated, or (iii)&nbsp;if a transaction is consummated,
it will be on the same or similar terms as currently provided under the
Agreement.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">69</font></b></p>

<div style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:11.0pt;">

<hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left">

</font></b></div>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div>

<h3 align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></h3>

<h3 align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-variant:normal !important;">Report of
Independent Registered Public Accounting Firm</font></b><a name="ReportOfIndependentRegisteredPubl_141107"></a></h3>

<h3 align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></h3>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">To S.I.
Enterprises, Inc:</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We
have audited the accompanying combined balance sheet of H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo Casino and Resort, a division of S.I. Enterprises,&nbsp;Inc.,
a Nevada corporation (the &#147;Division&#148;) as of October&nbsp;31, 2005, and
the related combined statements of operations, division equity (deficit), and
cash flows for the ten months ended October&nbsp;31, 2005.&#160; These financial statements are the
responsibility of the Division&#146;s management.&#160;
Our responsibility is to express an opinion on these financial
statements based on our audits.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We
conducted our audits in accordance with the standards of the Public Company
Accounting Oversight Board (United States). Those standards require that we
plan and perform the audit to obtain reasonable assurance about whether the
financial statements are free of material misstatement. We were not engaged to
perform an audit of the Division&#146;s internal control over financial reporting.
Our audits included consideration of internal control over financial reporting
as a basis for designing audit procedures that are appropriate in the
circumstances, but not for the purpose of expressing an opinion on the
effectiveness of the Division&#146;s internal control over financial reporting.
Accordingly, we express no such opinion. An audit also includes examining, on a
test basis, evidence supporting the amounts and disclosures in the financial
statements, assessing the accounting principles used and significant estimates
made by management, and evaluating the overall financial statement
presentation. We believe that our audits provide a reasonable basis for our
opinion.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In
our opinion, the combined financial statements referred to above present
fairly, in all material respects, the combined financial position of H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo Casino and Resort at October&nbsp;31,
2005, and the results of its combined operations and its combined cash flows
for the ten months ended October&nbsp;31, 2005&#160;
in conformity with U.S. generally accepted accounting principles.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">/s/ Ernst&nbsp;&amp; Young LLP</font></p>

<p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Las
Vegas, Nevada</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">February&nbsp;9,
2006</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">70</font></p>

<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="letter-spacing:.3pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">H&#244;tel
San R&#233;mo Casino and Resort</font></b><a name="HtelSanRmoCasinoAndResort_142119"></a></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(Division of S.I. Enterprises,&nbsp;Inc.)</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-variant:normal !important;">COMBINED
BALANCE SHEET</font></b></h3>

<h3 align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></h3>

  <td width="83%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:83.26%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.24%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:12.32%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">October&nbsp;31,</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="letter-spacing:.3pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">H&#244;tel
San R&#233;mo Casino and Resort</font></b><a name="HtelSanRmoCasinoAndResort_142350"></a></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(Division of S.I. Enterprises,&nbsp;Inc.)</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

accompanying notes are an integral part of these combined financial</font></i><i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;"> statements.</font></i></p>

<p align="center" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">The accompanying notes are an integral part of these combined financial</font></i><i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;"> statements.</font></i></p>

<p align="center" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="letter-spacing:.3pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">H&#244;tel
San R&#233;mo Casino and Resort</font></b><a name="HtelSanRmoCasinoAndResort_145648"></a></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(Division of S.I. Enterprises,&nbsp;Inc.)</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-variant:normal !important;">NOTES TO COMBINED
FINANCIAL STATEMENTS</font></b></h3>

<h3 align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></h3>

<p align="center" style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">October&nbsp;31, 2005</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:normal;margin:0in 1.0pt .0001pt 0in;page-break-after:avoid;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1.&#160; Organization and Basis of Presentation</font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:normal;margin:0in 1.0pt .0001pt 0in;page-break-after:avoid;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The accompanying combined financial statements present the operations
of H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo Casino and Resort (&#147;H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo&#148;), a division of S.I.
Enterprises,&nbsp;Inc. (the &#147;Parent Company&#148;), a Nevada Corporation, which is
located in Las Vegas, Nevada.&#160; H&#244;tel San
R&#233;mo commenced gaming operations on February&nbsp;16, 1990.&#160; The accompanying combined financial
statements represent the assets, liabilities and operations of the hotel and
gaming facilities and include certain accounts of Eastern&nbsp;&amp; Western
Hotel Corporation (&#147;Eastern&nbsp;&amp; Western&#148;) and I&amp;P Corporation,
Colorado (&#147;I&amp;P&#148;), both Nevada corporations.&#160;
The
accompanying financial statements have been prepared as of the last day of
operations, October&nbsp;31, 2005, of H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo by Eastern&nbsp;&amp;
Western as 155 East Tropicana, LLC assumed the operations of the hotel and
casino as of November&nbsp;1, 2005 upon which it secured its gaming and liquor
licenses. Through October&nbsp;31, 2005, Eastern&nbsp;&amp; Western held
the gaming license in Nevada and owned all gaming assets used by H&#244;tel San
R&#233;mo.&#160; I&amp;P owned the real property
and non-gaming assets of H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo until August&nbsp;3, 2004, at which
time they were acquired by 155 East Tropicana, LLC (see Note 2) and then leased
back to H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo pursuant to the casino lease and hotel lease
arrangements (see Note 7).&#160; Members of
the Izumi family are 100% owners of the Parent Company, which owns 100% of
Eastern&nbsp;&amp; Western and owns 100% of I&amp;P.&#160; The principal business of Eastern&nbsp;&amp;
Western prior to the merger of I&amp;P into Eastern&nbsp;&amp; Western, was the
owner and operator of the hotel.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On July&nbsp;28, 2004, I&amp;P was merged with and into Eastern&nbsp;&amp;
Western, with Eastern&nbsp;&amp; Western assuming all assets and liabilities of
I&amp;P including the real property and non-gaming assets of H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Certain reclassifications, having no effect on net loss, have been made
to the previously issued combined financial statements to conform to the
current period&#146;s presentation of the H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo&#146;s financial statements.&#160; All significant intercompany accounts and
transactions have been eliminated in the combined financial statements.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:normal;margin:0in 1.0pt .0001pt 0in;page-break-after:avoid;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2.&#160; Acquisition by 155 East Tropicana, LLC</font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:normal;margin:0in 1.0pt .0001pt 0in;page-break-after:avoid;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In August&nbsp;2004, 155 East Tropicana, LLC (&#147;155&#148;) agreed to the
acquisition of the real property and other assets of H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo for
approximately $72.5&nbsp;million including transaction costs and expenses.&#160; 155 is a joint venture between Florida
Hooters LLC and EW Common LLC.&#160; EW Common
LLC was formed to hold Eastern&nbsp;&amp; Western&#146;s membership interest in
155.&#160; EW Common&nbsp;LLC is owned 90% by
Eastern&nbsp;&amp; Western and 10% by Michael J. Hessling, the executive vice
president and chief operating officer of H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo.&#160; Initially, 155 acquired $67.5 million of the
real property and non-gaming assets and agreed that the remaining $5.0 million
in gaming assets would be transferred to 155 upon obtaining the gaming and
liquor licenses necessary to take over operations of the hotel and casino.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">75</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='75',FILE='C:\JMS\brosent\08-2823-1\task2817237\2823-1-fc-01.htm',USER='brosent',CD='Mar 27 17:28 2008' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="letter-spacing:.3pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo Casino and Resort</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(Division of S.I. Enterprises,&nbsp;Inc.)</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-variant:normal !important;">NOTES TO COMBINED
FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (CONTINUED)</font></b></h3>

<h3 align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></h3>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">2.&#160; Acquisition by 155 East Tropicana, LLC
(continued)</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In
October&nbsp;2005, 155 secured the necessary gaming and liquor licenses and on November&nbsp;1,
2005, assumed the operations of the hotel and casino.&#160; On November&nbsp;1, 2005, the remaining H&#244;tel
San R&#233;mo gaming assets were also transferred to 155 in exchange for an
additional $5.0 million interest in 155 with a priority return.&#160; The casino and hotel leases were terminated
on October&nbsp;31, 2005.&#160;&#160; Immediately
prior to the acquisition in 2004, the real property and non-gaming assets of
H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo with a net book value of $25,956,004 and long-term debt of
$43,745,708 were transferred to EW Common&nbsp;LLC.&#160; Because EW Common&nbsp;LLC and H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo
are entities under common control, these transfers were reflected as division
equity transactions.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The acquisition was funded by 155 through a term loan totaling
$48.5&nbsp;million which was used to extinguish the H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo&#146;s existing
indebtedness of $43.7&nbsp;million, a commitment to pay the former owner of
H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo $1.3&nbsp;million and the issuance to EW Common LLC of a 33</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.0pt;position:relative;top:-3.0pt;">1</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">/</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.0pt;">3</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">% membership interest with
priority return valued at $20.0&nbsp;million.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On March&nbsp;29, 2005, 155
successfully completed the issuance of $130 million in principal amount 8&#190;%,
Senior Secured Notes due 2012 (the &#147;old notes&#148;).&#160; On August&nbsp;5, 2005, 155 successfully
exchanged all of the old notes for new notes (the &#147;Notes&#148;).&#160; Proceeds from the Notes offering were used
principally to renovate the H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo into the Hooters Casino Hotel.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">3.&#160; Summary of Significant Accounting Policies</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:35.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Use of Estimates.&#160; </font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The preparation
of financial statements in conformity with accounting principles generally accepted
in the United States requires management to make estimates and assumptions that
affect the reported amount of assets and liabilities and disclosure of
contingent assets and liabilities at the date of the combined financial
statements and the reported amounts of revenues and expenses during the
reporting period.&#160; Actual results could
differ from those estimates.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:35.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Cash and Cash Equivalents.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; Cash and cash equivalents include all cash
balances and highly liquid investments with purchased maturities of three
months or less at the date of purchase.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Allowances for Doubtful Accounts.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; The H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo reserves an estimated
amount for receivables that may not be collected.&#160; Historical collections rates and customer
relationships are considered in determining specific reserves.&#160; Bad debt expense was $45,000 and $48,000 for
the ten months ended October&nbsp;31, 2005 and for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2004, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Inventories.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; Inventories
are stated at the lower of cost (using a first-in, first-out method) or market
value.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">76</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='76',FILE='C:\JMS\jcatlet\08-2823-1\task2822705\2823-1-fc-03.htm',USER='jcatlet',CD='Mar 28 22:40 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="letter-spacing:.3pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo Casino and Resort</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(Division of S.I. Enterprises,&nbsp;Inc.)</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-variant:normal !important;">NOTES TO COMBINED
FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (CONTINUED)</font></b></h3>

<h3 align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></h3>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">3.&#160; Summary of Significant Accounting Policies
(continued)</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:35.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Property and Equipment.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; Property and equipment are recorded at
cost.&#160; Depreciation is calculated using
the straight-line method over the following estimated useful lives:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="74%" style="border-collapse:collapse;margin-left:1.0in;width:74.9%;">
 <tr height="10" style="height:.1in;">
  <td width="252" height="10" valign="top" style="height:.1in;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:189.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Buildings
  and improvements</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="179" height="10" valign="top" style="height:.1in;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:134.6pt;">
  <p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 37.8pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">15 to 31.5 years</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr height="10" style="height:.1in;">
  <td width="252" height="10" valign="top" style="height:.1in;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:189.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Furniture,
  fixtures, and equipment</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="179" height="10" valign="top" style="height:.1in;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:134.6pt;">
  <p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 37.8pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3 to 7 years</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Normal repairs and maintenance are charged to expense when
incurred.&#160; Expenditures that extend the
useful lives of assets are capitalized.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:35.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Long-Lived Assets.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; In accordance with the provisions of
Statement of Financial Accounting Standards (&#147;SFAS&#148;) No.&nbsp;144, &#147;Accounting
for the Impairment or Disposal of Long-Lived Assets,&#148; H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo evaluates
the potential impairment of long-lived assets when events or changes in
circumstances indicate that the carrying amount of a long-lived asset may not
be recoverable.&#160; If it is determined that
the carrying value of long-lived assets may not be recoverable based upon the
relevant facts and circumstances, H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo estimates the future
undiscounted cash flows expected to result from the use of the asset and its
eventual disposition.&#160; If the sum of the
expected undiscounted future cash flows is less than the carrying value of the
asset, H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo will recognize an impairment loss for the difference
between the carrying value of the asset and its fair value.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:35.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Income Taxes.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160;&#160;
H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo<b>  </b>accounts for
income taxes under SFAS No.&nbsp;109, &#147;Accounting for Income Taxes&#148; (&#147;SFAS No.&nbsp;109&#148;),
whereby deferred tax assets and liabilities are recognized for the future tax
consequences attributable to differences between the financial statements
carrying amounts of existing assets and liabilities and their respective tax
bases.&#160; Deferred tax assets and
liabilities are measured using enacted tax rates expected to apply to taxable
income in the years in which those temporary differences are expected to be
recovered or settled.&#160; Under SFAS No.&nbsp;109,
the effect on deferred tax assets and liabilities of a change in tax rates is
recognized in income in the period that included the enactment date.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:35.3pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Jackpots and Prizes.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo has progressive slot
machines.&#160; As coins are played, the
amount available to win increases and will be paid out when the jackpot is
awarded.&#160; In accordance with industry
practice, H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo records the liability and expense related to such
progressives as incurred.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:35.3pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:35.3pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Casino Revenues and Promotional Allowances.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; In accordance with industry practice, H&#244;tel
San R&#233;mo recognizes as casino revenue the net win from gaming activities, which
is the difference between</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">77</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='77',FILE='C:\JMS\jcatlet\08-2823-1\task2822705\2823-1-fc-03.htm',USER='jcatlet',CD='Mar 28 22:40 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo Casino and Resort</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(Division of S.I. Enterprises,&nbsp;Inc.)</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-variant:normal !important;">NOTES TO COMBINED
FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (CONTINUED)</font></b></h3>

<h3 align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></h3>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">3.&#160; Summary of Significant Accounting Policies
(continued)</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">gaming wins and losses.
The retail value of rooms, food and beverage furnished to customers without
charge is included in gross revenue and then deducted as promotional
allowances.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:35.3pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The estimated departmental costs of providing such promotional
allowances are included in casino operating expenses and consist of the
following:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="50%" style="border-collapse:collapse;margin-left:1.5in;width:50.0%;">
 <tr>
  <td width="61%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:61.62%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="4%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:4.12%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="32%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:32.78%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Ten months ended</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.48%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="61%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:61.62%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="4%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:4.12%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="32%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:32.78%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">October&nbsp;31,<br>
  2005</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.48%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="61%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:61.62%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Food and beverage</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="4%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:4.12%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.76%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="30%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:30.02%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">558,702</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.48%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="61%" valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:61.62%;">

  </td>
  <td width="4%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:4.12%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="32%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:32.78%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">75,641</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.48%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>

  <td width="61%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:61.62%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>

  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>

  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="30%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:30.02%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">634,343</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.48%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p align="center" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:35.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Player Club Points.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo&#146;s Money Club slot club program
allows customers to earn certain complimentary products and/or cash, based on
the volume of the customers&#146; gaming activity.&#160;
H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo has recorded a liability for the estimated cost of the
products and/or cash earned by customers.&#160;
H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo&#146;s slot club program allows customers to redeem points earned
from their gaming activity for complimentary food, beverage, rooms,
entertainment and merchandise.&#160; At the
time redeemed, the retail values of complimentaries under the program are
recorded as revenue with a corresponding offsetting amount included in
promotional allowances.&#160; The costs
associated with complimentary food, beverage, rooms, entertainment and
merchandise redeemed under the program is recorded in casino operating
expenses.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In February&nbsp;2001, the Emerging Issues Task Force (&#147;EITF&#148;) of the Financial
Accounting Standards Board (&#147;FASB&#148;) reached a consensus in EITF Issue No.&nbsp;00-22,
&#147;Accounting for &#145;Points&#146; and Certain Other Time-Based or Volume-Based Sales
Incentive Offers, and Offers for Free Products to Be Delivered in the Future.&#148;&#160; EITF Issue No.&nbsp;00-22 requires that the
redemption of points for cash be recognized as a reduction of revenue.&#160; In accordance with EITF Issue No.&nbsp;00-22,
H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo has recorded the cost of points earned and redeemed for
complimentary services/cash rebates as promotional allowances.&#160; Such amounts totaled $89,222 for the ten
months ended October&nbsp;31, 2005.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:35.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Advertising.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; Prepaid
advertising costs are expensed the first time the advertising takes place.&#160; Prepaid advertising included in prepaid
expenses was $20,270 at October&nbsp;31, 2005.&#160;
Advertising costs included in general and administrative expenses were
$473,834 for the ten months ended October&nbsp;31, 2005.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:35.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Fair Value of Financial Instruments.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; The carrying value of H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo&#146;s cash
and cash equivalents, receivables, accounts payable, accrued expenses and debt
approximates fair value primarily because of the short maturities of these
instruments.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">78</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='78',FILE='C:\JMS\jcatlet\08-2823-1\task2822705\2823-1-fc-03.htm',USER='jcatlet',CD='Mar 28 22:40 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="letter-spacing:.3pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo Casino and Resort</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(Division of S.I. Enterprises,&nbsp;Inc.)</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-variant:normal !important;">NOTES TO COMBINED
FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (CONTINUED)</font></b></h3>

<h3 align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></h3>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">3.&#160; Summary of Significant Accounting Policies
(continued)</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:35.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Reclassifications.&#160; </font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Certain amounts
in the prior years&#146; financial statements have been reclassified to conform to
the current year&#146;s presentation.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">4.&#160; Due from Affiliates</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">At October&nbsp;31, 2005 H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo had unsecured demand notes
receivable from various related parties in the aggregate amount of $11,449,000.
These notes bear interest at variable rates, ranging from 3.4% to 5.0% at October&nbsp;31,
2005.&#160; H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo has recorded
interest income related to these notes of $346,262 for the ten months ended October&nbsp;31,
2005.&#160; The notes receivable at October&nbsp;31,
2005 are included in H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo&#146;s division equity.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Included in accounts receivable at October&nbsp;31, 2005 are related
party interest receivables and other receivables of $395,324.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In addition, at October&nbsp;31, 2005, H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo had a receivable
in the amount of $644,934 from 155.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo has a deferred compensation plan established pursuant to
Section&nbsp;401(k)&nbsp;of the Internal Revenue Code for all regular full-time
employees not covered by a collective bargaining agreement who have completed
at least three months of continuous service.&#160;
H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo&#146;s contributions to the plan are at the discretion of the
Parent Company&#146;s board of directors and cannot exceed $1,500 or 6% of the
participant&#146;s compensation.&#160; There were
no contributions made during 2005.&#160;
Amounts expensed under the plan for administrative expenses for the ten
months ended October&nbsp;31, 2005 totaled $329.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">5.&#160; Profit-Sharing Plan</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Monthly base rent payments of $125,000 were due from August&nbsp;3,
2004 until termination at October&nbsp;31, 2005. Upon certain defined events
and to the extent that H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo had available cash flow from casino
operations, Eastern&nbsp;&amp; Western was to set aside reserves of $120,000
and $55,000 each month to cover change in control payments and licensing
expenses, respectively.&#160; To the extent
that these reserves were not used, they were paid to Eastern&nbsp;&amp; Western
at the termination of the lease.&#160; On December&nbsp;21,
2005, a payment of $1,127,628 was made to Eastern&nbsp;&amp; Western by 155 for
the balance of the reserves existing at October&nbsp;31, 2005.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">79</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='79',FILE='C:\JMS\jcatlet\08-2823-1\task2822705\2823-1-fc-03.htm',USER='jcatlet',CD='Mar 28 22:40 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="letter-spacing:.3pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo Casino and Resort</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(Division of S.I. Enterprises,&nbsp;Inc.)</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-variant:normal !important;">NOTES TO COMBINED
FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (CONTINUED)</font></b></h3>

<h3 align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></h3>

<p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:normal;margin:0in 1.0pt .0001pt 0in;page-break-after:avoid;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">6.&#160; Lease Agreements</font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:normal;margin:0in 1.0pt .0001pt 0in;page-break-after:avoid;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In connection with the acquisition of H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo&#146;s real property
and non-gaming assets by 155, Eastern&nbsp;&amp; Western, as lessee, and 155
entered into lease agreements to lease back the casino and hotel property
previously owned by H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo.&#160; Upon
the receipt of gaming and liquor licensing by 155, these leases were terminated
on October&nbsp;31, 2005 and the operations of the hotel and casino were
assumed by 155.&#160;&#160; The terms of these
lease agreements are described below.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:35.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Casino Lease.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; The
casino lease between Eastern&nbsp;&amp; Western and 155 covered those portions
of the H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo containing the showroom, gaming and liquor servicing
areas, the casino floor where gaming activities occur, surveillance areas,
count rooms, cashier cages and other areas ancillary to the casino footprint.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:35.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Hotel Lease.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; The hotel
lease between Eastern&nbsp;&amp; Western and 155 covered those portions of the
H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo containing all non-casino areas including the hotel.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Minimum
lease payments due under the hotel lease consist of a minimum rent and a
percentage rent. The minimum rent was $250,000 per month. The percentage rent
was equal to 100% of all revenues received from the operation of the hotel,
less actual operational expenses (including minimum rent) and working capital
reserves which were determined and agreed upon monthly by 155 and Eastern&nbsp;&amp;
Western.&#160; No capital reserves were agreed
to for the period from August&nbsp;3, 2004 through October&nbsp;31, 2005. While
the minimum rent was paid on a monthly basis, the percentage rent was paid in
arrears to 155 on the first day of each calendar quarter.&#160; Rent for any partial month was prorated based
on a thirty-day month.&#160; Percentage rental
expense incurred for the ten months ended October&nbsp;31, 2005 totaled
$1,689,324.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Total rental expense under the casino and hotel leases was $5,439,324
during the ten months ended October&nbsp;31, 2005.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">80</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='80',FILE='C:\JMS\jcatlet\08-2823-1\task2822705\2823-1-fc-03.htm',USER='jcatlet',CD='Mar 28 22:40 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="letter-spacing:.3pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo Casino and Resort</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(Division of S.I. Enterprises,&nbsp;Inc.)</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-variant:normal !important;">NOTES TO COMBINED
FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (CONTINUED)</font></b></h3>

<h3 align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></h3>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">7.&#160; Income Taxes</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo is a division included in the consolidated federal
income tax return of the Parent Company.&#160;
Accordingly, the current federal tax liability or benefit resulting from
the taxable income or loss generated by H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo is recognized by the
Parent Company in its consolidated federal income tax return.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The components of the H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo&#146;s income tax provision (benefit)
from continuing operations for the ten months ended October&nbsp;31, 2005 were
as follows (amounts in thousands):</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 60.0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

compared to the tax provision calculated by applying the federal statutory rate
(35%) to loss before income taxes for the ten months ended October&nbsp;31, 2005,
is as follows (amounts in thousands):</font></p>

  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>

<p align="center" style="letter-spacing:.3pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.3pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
income tax effects of temporary differences between financial and income tax
reporting that give rise to deferred tax assets and liabilities at October&nbsp;31,
2005 are as follows:</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">81</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="letter-spacing:.3pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo Casino and Resort</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(Division of S.I. Enterprises,&nbsp;Inc.)</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-variant:normal !important;">NOTES TO COMBINED

  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Capitalized interest</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.36%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:13.34%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">13</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:2.12%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>

  </td>

  </td>
 </tr>

  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="11%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:11.84%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1,150</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:.52%;">
