 <tr height="0">
  <td width="435" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="15" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="10" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="75" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="7" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="7" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="10" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="75" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="3" style="border:none;"></td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 40.0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">At
October&nbsp;31, 2005, H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo had $476,831 of alternative minimum tax (&#147;AMT&#148;)
credits and $217,109 of general business credits available to offset future
federal tax.&#160; The AMT credit does not
have an expiration date.&#160; The general
business credits will start to expire in 2024.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
current payable for income taxes at October&nbsp;31, 2005 is recorded in income
taxes payable to the Parent Company in the accompanying combined balance
sheets.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On
February&nbsp;28, 2005, the Parent Company converted from a Nevada corporation
to a Nevada limited-liability company.&#160;
Effective on the date of conversion, the Parent Company elected to
retain its &#147;C&#148; corporation status for federal income tax purposes.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">8.&#160; Commitments and Contingencies</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:35.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Non-Compete.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; Under the
terms of the casino lease and the hotel lease, Eastern&nbsp;&amp; Western has
agreed that H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo will not operate a similar casino or hotel business
at any other location in Clark County, Nevada, including any location within a
hotel and/or casino property.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:35.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Litigation.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; H&#244;tel San
R&#233;mo is party to various litigation arising in the normal course of
business.&#160; Management is of the opinion
that the ultimate resolution of these matters will not have a material adverse
effect on the financial position, cash flows, or the results of operations of
H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">82</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="letter-spacing:.3pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo Casino and Resort</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(Division of S.I. Enterprises,&nbsp;Inc.)</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-variant:normal !important;">NOTES TO COMBINED
FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (CONTINUED)</font></b></h3>

<h3 align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></h3>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">9.&#160; Subsequent Events</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On December&nbsp;12, 2005, H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo received a payment of
$2,158,131 (inclusive of the payment of $1,127,628 discussed in Note 6) from
155 in additional consideration associated with the sale of the H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo
pursuant to an Amended and Restated Joint Venture Agreement and the Amended and
Restated Casino Lease Agreement with 155.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">83</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

<h2 style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-.75in;text-transform:uppercase;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></h2>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

</div>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div>

<h2 style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;page-break-after:auto;text-indent:-.75in;text-transform:uppercase;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></h2>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">
 <tr>
  <td width="10%" valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:10.94%;">
  <h2 style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-transform:uppercase;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;text-transform:none;">ITEM 9.</font></b></h2>
  </td>
  <td width="89%" valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:89.06%;">
  <h2 style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-transform:uppercase;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;text-transform:none;">CHANGES IN AND DISAGREEMENTS WITH ACCOUNTANTS ON
  ACCOUNTING AND FINANCIAL DISCLOSURE.</font></b><a name="Item9_ChangesInAndDisagreementsWi_143356"></a></h2>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<h2 style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;page-break-after:auto;text-indent:-.75in;text-transform:uppercase;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></h2>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Not applicable.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">
 <tr>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:10.94%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">ITEM 9(A).</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="88%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:88.62%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">CONTROLS AND PROCEDURES.<a name="Item9a_ControlsAndProcedures__143405"></a></font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:.44%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<h2 style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-transform:uppercase;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></h2>

<h3 style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-variant:normal !important;">Evaluation of Disclosure Controls</font></b></h3>

<h3 style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></h3>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We evaluated the effectiveness of our
disclosure controls and procedures as of the end of the 2007 fiscal year.&#160; This evaluation was done with the
participation of our management, including our Chief Executive Officer,
President, Chief Operating Officer, and Chief Financial Officer.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Disclosure controls and procedures are controls
and other procedures that are designed to ensure that information required to
be disclosed by us in the reports that we file or submit under the Securities
Exchange Act of 1934 are recorded, processed, summarized and reported within
the time periods specified in the Securities and Exchange Commission&#146;s rules&nbsp;and
forms.&#160; Disclosure controls and
procedures include, without limitation, controls and procedures designed to
ensure that information required to be disclosed by us in the reports that we
file under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 is accumulated and communicated
to our managers, as appropriate to allow timely decisions regarding required
disclosure.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-variant:normal !important;">Limitations on the Effectiveness of Controls</font></b></h3>

<h3 style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></h3>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our management does not expect that our disclosure
controls and procedures or our internal controls over financial reporting will
prevent all error and all fraud.&#160; A
control system, no matter how well conceived and operated, can provide only
reasonable, but not absolute, assurance that the objectives of a control system
are met.&#160; Further, any control system
reflects limitations on resources, and the benefits of a control system must be
considered relative to its costs.&#160; Because
of the inherent limitations in all control systems, no evaluation of controls
can provide absolute assurance that all control issues and instances of fraud,
if any, within us have been detected.&#160;
These inherent limitations include the realities that judgments in
decision-making can be faulty and that breakdowns can occur because of simple
error or mistake. Additionally, controls can be circumvented by the individual
acts of some persons, by collusion of two or more people, or by management
override of a control.&#160; The design of a
control system is also based upon certain assumptions about the likelihood of
future events, there can be no assurance that any design will succeed in
achieving its stated goals under all potential future conditions; over time,
controls may become inadequate because of changes in conditions, or the degree
of compliance with the policies or procedures may deteriorate. Because of the
inherent limitations in a cost-effective control system, misstatements due to
error or fraud may occur and may not be detected.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-variant:normal !important;">Conclusions</font></b></h3>

<h3 style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></h3>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Based on this evaluation, our Chief Executive
Officer and Chief Financial Officer have evaluated our disclosure controls and
procedures (as defined in the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 Rules&nbsp;13a-15(e)&nbsp;and
15d- 15(e)) as of December&nbsp;31, 2007, and have concluded that these are
effective to timely alert them to material information relating to us required
to be included in the reports that we file or submit under the Securities
Exchange Act of 1934.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">84</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='84',FILE='C:\JMS\jcatlet\08-2823-1\task2822670\2823-1-fe.htm',USER='jcatlet',CD='Mar 28 22:19 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Management&#146;s Report on
Internal Control Over Financial Reporting</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; The management of the Company is responsible for
establishing and maintaining adequate internal control over financial
reporting. The Company&#146;s internal control system was designed to provide
reasonable assurance to the Company&#146;s management and board of directors
regarding the preparation and fair presentation of published financial
statements.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Management assessed the effectiveness of the Company&#146;s
internal control over financial reporting (as defined in the Securities Exchange
Act of 1934 Rules&nbsp;13a-15(f)&nbsp;and 15d-15(f)) as of December&nbsp;31,
2007. In making this assessment, it used the criteria set forth by the
Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission (COSO) in
Internal Control &#151; Integrated Framework. Based on our assessment we believe
that, as of December&nbsp;31, 2007, the Company&#146;s internal control over
financial reporting is effective based on those criteria.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; This annual report does not include an attestation
report of the company&#146;s registered public accounting firm regarding internal
control over financial reporting. Management&#146;s report was not subject to
attestation by the Company&#146;s registered public accounting firm pursuant to
temporary rules&nbsp;of the Securities and Exchange Commission that permit the
company to provide only management&#146;s report in this annual report.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-variant:normal !important;">Changes in Internal Controls</font></b></h3>

<h3 style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></h3>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">There were no changes in our internal
controls over financial reporting that occurred during our last fiscal quarter,
<i>i.e.</i>, the quarter ended December&nbsp;31,
2007, that have materially affected, or are reasonably likely to materially
affect, our internal controls over financial reporting.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">
 <tr>
  <td width="10%" valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:10.0%;">
  <h2 style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-transform:uppercase;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;text-transform:none;">ITEM 9B.</font></b></h2>
  </td>
  <td width="90%" valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:90.0%;">
  <h2 style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-transform:uppercase;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;text-transform:none;">OTHER INFORMATION.</font></b><a name="Item9b_OtherInformation__143415"></a></h2>
  </td>
 </tr>

<h2 style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-transform:uppercase;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></h2>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Not applicable.</font></p>

<h1 style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">PART&nbsp;III<a name="Partiii_143435"></a></font></b></h1>

<h1 style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></h1>

  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">DIRECTORS, EXECUTIVE OFFICERS
  AND CORPORATE GOVERNANCE.<a name="Item10_DirectorsExecutiveOfficers_143440"></a></font></b></p>
  </td>

<h2 style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;page-break-after:auto;text-indent:-.75in;text-transform:uppercase;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></h2>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following information summarizes the
business experience during at least the past five years of each of our
executive officers and the members of our management board.</font></p>

  </td>

 <tr>
  <td width="34%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:34.44%;">

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><hr size="1" width="25%" noshade color="black" align="left"></div>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mr.&nbsp;DiGiannantonio is the son-in-law
of Mr.&nbsp;Ranieri.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(2)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mr.&nbsp;Sukeaki Izumi is the father of Mr.&nbsp;Toyoroku
Izumi.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Business
Experience</font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Neil G. Kiefer.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; Mr.&nbsp;Kiefer was appointed our Chief
Executive Officer in August&nbsp;2004. Mr.&nbsp;Kiefer has been involved in the
Hooters organization since its inception in 1983, when he incorporated the
original Hooters entity, Hooters&nbsp;Inc. From 1983 to 1992, Mr.&nbsp;Kiefer
served as general outside counsel to Hooters&nbsp;Inc. and its related Hooters
entities. From May&nbsp;1992 to June&nbsp;1994, Mr.&nbsp;Kiefer served as
President and Chief Executive Officer of Hooters Management Corporation, the
managing entity for Hooters&nbsp;Inc. and its affiliated companies. Since June&nbsp;1994,
Mr.&nbsp;Kiefer has served as President and Chief Executive Officer of
Hooters&nbsp;Inc. and all other Hooters corporations affiliated with
Hooters&nbsp;Inc. Mr.&nbsp;Kiefer was elected to the Hooters&nbsp;Inc. board of
directors in 1994 and continues to serve on the board.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Michael J. Hessling.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; Mr.&nbsp;Hessling was appointed to our management
board in July&nbsp;2004 and was appointed our President in June&nbsp;2006. Mr.&nbsp;Hessling
has been involved in the gaming industry since 1979 when he joined Caesars
Palace as Manager of Financial Planning. Before his departure in 1983, Mr.&nbsp;Hessling
was promoted to Assistant Vice President of Planning and Administration and,
after assisting in the opening of Caesars Tahoe, served as management liaison
between the Tahoe and Las Vegas operations. During 1983, Mr.&nbsp;Hessling
served as Vice President of Casino Operations for CSP, a management company
that operated the Dunes Hotel&nbsp;&amp; Casino. From 1983 to 1988, Mr.&nbsp;Hessling
served as general manager of several small casinos in Las Vegas. From 1989 to
2005, Mr.&nbsp;Hessling was a part owner of and served as Treasurer and a director
for Beatty Future&nbsp;Inc., which owned a casino motel in rural Nevada. From
1989 until June&nbsp;2004, Mr.&nbsp;Hessling served as Executive Vice
President, General Manager and Chief Operating Officer of the H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">86</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='86',FILE='C:\JMS\jcatlet\08-2823-1\task2822670\2823-1-fe.htm',USER='jcatlet',CD='Mar 28 22:19 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Gary A. Gregg.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; Mr.&nbsp;Gregg was appointed our Chief
Operating Officer in October&nbsp;2006.&#160;
From 1988 to 1993, Mr.&nbsp;Gregg served as President for the Flamingo
Hilton Laughlin and was responsible for the property&#146;s operations and
profitability.&#160; From 1993 to 1997, Mr.&nbsp;Gregg
served as President and Senior Vice President for the Las Vegas Hilton and
Hilton Hotels Corporation, where he was responsible for the company&#146;s overall
operations and profitability.&#160; From 1998
to 2001, Mr.&nbsp;Gregg served as General Manager for the Regency Casino by
Hyatt located in Thessaloniki, Greece, where, in addition to his operational
responsibilities, he was also responsible for overall regulatory issues
including administration of all policies and procedures.&#160; From 2001 to 2003, Mr.&nbsp;Gregg served as
General Manager for the Hollywood Casino located in Shreveport, Louisiana where
he was also responsible for the operational and regulatory aspects of the
company&#146;s business.&#160; From July&nbsp;2004
until October&nbsp;2006, Mr.&nbsp;Gregg served as President for Daily Edge, LLC
where he managed sales representatives, trade shows, and associated sales and
marketing services.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Deborah J. Pierce.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; Ms.&nbsp;Pierce was appointed our Chief
Financial Officer in February&nbsp;2005. From June&nbsp;1995 to May&nbsp;1998, Ms.&nbsp;Pierce
served as Vice President of Finance for Tropicana Resort&nbsp;&amp; Casino and
was responsible for various financial and operational aspects of the
organization&#146;s business. From June&nbsp;1998 to November&nbsp;1998, Ms.&nbsp;Pierce
served as Chief Financial Officer, Secretary and Treasurer of Palace REIT, a
real estate investment trust formed in 1998 to acquire office and industrial
properties in selected markets in the United States. From November&nbsp;1998 to
June&nbsp;2003, Ms.&nbsp;Pierce served as Vice President of Finance for
Ameristar Casinos,&nbsp;Inc. From July&nbsp;2003 to August&nbsp;2004, Ms.&nbsp;Pierce
served as Vice President of Finance for Silverton Casino, LLC where she was
responsible for various financial, regulatory and operational aspects of the
company&#146;s business. From November&nbsp;2004 to February&nbsp;2005, Ms.&nbsp;Pierce
served as Chief Financial Officer of Fantasy Springs Resort&nbsp;&amp; Casino.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">John T. Blakely.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; Mr.&nbsp;Blakely was appointed to our
management board in July&nbsp;2004. Mr.&nbsp;Blakely has been practicing law in
Florida since 1970. In 1973, Mr.&nbsp;Blakely practiced in the Tampa and
Clearwater offices of Johnson, Blakely, Pope, Bokor, Ruppel and Burns and was a
partner when he left in 2003. Since 2003, Mr.&nbsp;Blakely has been a partner
with the Naples office of Roetzel&nbsp;&amp; Andress, a national law firm based
in Akron, Ohio. Mr.&nbsp;Blakely has served as Director (1999 to 2002) and
President (2001 to 2002) of the Port Royal Club in Naples, Florida.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Gilbert DiGiannantonio.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; Mr.&nbsp;DiGiannantonio was appointed to our
management board in July&nbsp;2004. Mr.&nbsp;DiGiannantonio is one of the
original founders of the Hooters restaurant, concept and brand. He served as
the Vice President of Operations and Vice President of Hooters&nbsp;Inc. in
past years. Mr.&nbsp;DiGiannantonio is also the co-owner of one Hooters
restaurant in Las Vegas, Nevada. In addition, he is an owner of the Pete&nbsp;&amp;
Shorty&#146;s of Clearwater restaurant.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Edward C. Droste.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; Mr.&nbsp;Droste was appointed to our
management board in July&nbsp;2004. Mr.&nbsp;Droste is one of the original
founders of the Hooters restaurant, concept and brand. Mr.&nbsp;Droste
co-founded several restaurant concepts, including Pete&nbsp;&amp; Shorty&#146;s
Tavern and Adobe Gila&#146;s and was involved in the conceptual development of Dan
Marino&#146;s Town Tavern and Stumps Supper Club. Currently, Mr.&nbsp;Droste serves
as Chief Executive Officer of Provident Management Corporation, a resort
management company, which he founded (since 1989), and as a director for
Hooters Management Corporation (since 1992). In 1986, Mr.&nbsp;Droste founded
Provident Advertising&nbsp;&amp; Marketing,&nbsp;Inc., which is responsible for
coordinating the promotional activities for the Hooters restaurants and the
national distribution of the Hooters calendar. In 1995, Mr.&nbsp;Droste founded
Provident Entertainment,&nbsp;Inc., an entertainment company that produces a
two-hour radio talk show and is in talks to produce a motion picture. Mr.&nbsp;Droste
also serves on the board of directors for the Outback Bowl (since 2004), the H.
Lee Moffitt Cancer Center&nbsp;&amp; Research Institute Foundation,&nbsp;Inc.
(since 2003), and the Clearwater Regional Chamber of Commerce (since 1993).&#160; In January&nbsp;2007, Mr.&nbsp;Droste began
serving a two-year term as the Executive Vice Chairman for the H. Lee Moffitt
Cancer Center and Research Institute Foundation,&nbsp;Inc.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">87</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Sukeaki Izumi.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; Mr.&nbsp;Izumi was appointed to our
management board in July&nbsp;2004. Mr.&nbsp;Izumi was the founder of Eastern&nbsp;&amp;
Western, which was formed in 1988 to acquire, remodel, expand and operate the
H&#244;tel San R&#233;mo property. Since 1988, Mr.&nbsp;Izumi has served as the President
and Director of Eastern&nbsp;&amp; Western.&#160;
Mr.&nbsp;Izumi also serves as President and Director of S.I.
Enterprises,&nbsp;LLC (formerly known as S.I. Enterprises,&nbsp;Inc.), the
entity which wholly owns Eastern&nbsp;&amp; Western (since 1990and I&nbsp;&amp;
F Corporation, Japan (since 1973).&#160;
).&#160; He also owned Beatty Future,&nbsp;Inc.
from 1989 to 2005, which owned a casino motel in rural Nevada.&#160;&#160; Mr.&nbsp;Izumi served as President, Chairman
and Director of Hakusui Tech, Co.,&nbsp;Ltd. from 1992 to 2002. Hakusui Tech.
Co.,&nbsp;Ltd. filed an application for the commencement of civil
rehabilitation proceedings with a Japanese court in June&nbsp;2002. As a result
of such filing, the company underwent court-supervised reorganization.&#160; On January&nbsp;31, 2006, the Japanese court
has released Hakusui Tech. Co., Ltd. from its supervision, and Hakusui Tech.
Co., Ltd. is no longer involved in civil rehabilitation proceedings.&#160; Currently, Hakusui Tech. Co., Ltd. is a good
standing corporation.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Toyoroku Izumi.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; Mr.&nbsp;Izumi was appointed to our
management board in July&nbsp;2004. Mr.&nbsp;Izumi has been a director,
Secretary and Treasurer of Eastern&nbsp;&amp; Western since 1990. From 1996 to
2002, Mr.&nbsp;Izumi served as Vice President of Beatty Future,&nbsp;Inc., an
entity in which he has an ownership interest. Mr.&nbsp;Izumi also serves as
director, Treasurer and Assistant Secretary of S.I. Enterprises,&nbsp;LLC
(formerly known as S.I. Enterprises,&nbsp;Inc.), the entity that wholly owns
Eastern&nbsp;&amp; Western (since 1995), and as a director of I&amp;F
Corporation, Japan (since 1997). Mr.&nbsp;Izumi has been serving as the
President of Hakusui Tech, Co.,&nbsp;Ltd. since 2000. Hakusui Tech.
Co.,&nbsp;Ltd. filed an application for the commencement of civil
rehabilitation proceedings with a Japanese court on June&nbsp;21, 2002. As a
result of such filing, the company underwent court-supervised
reorganization.&#160; On January&nbsp;31, 2006,
the Japanese court has released Hakusui Tech. Co., Ltd. from its supervision,
and Hakusui Tech. Co., Ltd. is no longer involved in civil rehabilitation
proceedings.&#160; Currently, Hakusui Tech.
Co., Ltd. is a good standing corporation.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Dennis D. Johnson.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; Mr.&nbsp;Johnson was appointed to our
management board in August&nbsp;2004. Mr.&nbsp;Johnson is one of the original
founders of the Hooters restaurant, concept and brand. In 1994, Mr.&nbsp;Johnson
joined the corporate office of Hooters&nbsp;Inc. and was responsible for
maintaining the integrity of the Hooters trademark through quality control,
store inspections and site selections until 2002. From 1994 to 2004, Mr.&nbsp;Johnson
served as the Vice President of Hooters Management Corporation. Since 2000, Mr.&nbsp;Johnson
has served as the Vice President of Merchandise Sales. Since 1992, Mr.&nbsp;Johnson
has been a member of the Hooters Management Corporation board of directors.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">David L. Lageschulte.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; Mr.&nbsp;Lageschulte was appointed to our
management board in July&nbsp;2004. Mr.&nbsp;Lageschulte is the controlling
shareholder of the original licensee of the Hooters restaurant concept and
brand. Mr.&nbsp;Lageschulte controls and is the Chief Executive Officer of 19
Hooters restaurants which operate throughout Southeast and Southwest Florida,
and in the State of Nevada. Mr.&nbsp;Lageschulte is the Chief Executive Officer
of LTP Management Group,&nbsp;Inc., a restaurant managing entity for 32
restaurants, which he established in 1987. Mr.&nbsp;Lageschulte co-founded
several restaurant and entertainment concepts including Dan Marino&#146;s Fine Food&nbsp;&amp;
Spirits, Adobe Gila&#146;s, Ugly Tuna Saloona, Stumps Supper Club and Splitsville. Mr.&nbsp;Lageschulte
also owns several corporations, in Florida and other states, which are involved
in an array of operations including health and fitness centers, heavy equipment
sales and leasing, well drilling and real estate investments.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">William R. Ranieri.</font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160; Mr.&nbsp;Ranieri was appointed to our
management board in July&nbsp;2004. Mr.&nbsp;Ranieri is one of the original
founders of the Hooters restaurant, concept and brand and, since 1983, has
served as a director for Hooters Management Corporation, Hooters&nbsp;Inc. and
its related entities.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">88</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='88',FILE='C:\JMS\jcatlet\08-2823-1\task2822670\2823-1-fe.htm',USER='jcatlet',CD='Mar 28 22:19 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Committees
of our Management Board</font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our management board currently does not have
any committees. More specifically, our management board does not have a
compensation committee or an audit committee. The guidelines and pay levels for
the compensation of executive officers are generally established by the
management board. All the functions of an audit committee are performed by the
entire management board.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Code
of Ethics</font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Due to our limited size, we
have not yet adopted a code of ethics that applies to our principal executive
officer, principal financial officer, principal accounting officer or controller,
or persons performing similar functions.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">
 <tr>
  <td width="10%" valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:10.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">ITEM 11.</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="90%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:90.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION.<a name="Item11_ExecutiveCompensation__143738"></a></font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<h2 style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;page-break-after:auto;text-indent:-.75in;text-transform:uppercase;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></h2>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Compensation
Discussion and Analysis</font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We do not have a compensation committee or
formalized program for determining executive compensation.&#160; All decisions regarding executive
compensation for the Chief Executive Officer, President, and Chief Operating
Officer are made at the sole discretion of our management board.&#160; Our Chief Executive Officer, President, and
Chief Operating Officer have the discretion to award reasonable annual pay
increases for other executives.&#160; The
management board has not used an outside consultant in connection with making
compensation decisions.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our management board strives to award executive
compensation at a level that will attract, motivate, and retain talented and
dedicated executive officers.&#160; For the
fiscal year ended December&nbsp;31, 2007, the components of compensation for
named executive officers were base salary, paid premiums for life insurance
policies, and company contributions to our 401(k)&nbsp;plan.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In setting base salaries, the management board
considers executive experience, current position&#146;s responsibility, and certain
relevant market data. Bonuses may be awarded to salaried employees and
executive management. The bonuses are discretionary and are based on financial
achievement evaluated at the time the bonuses are granted.&#160; No bonuses were awarded for the fiscal year
ended December&nbsp;31, 2007 based on the financial level achieved by the
Company.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Executive officers are eligible to participate in
our 401(k)&nbsp;plan as are all regular full-time employees not covered by a
collective bargaining agreement who have completed at least three months of
continuous service.&#160; The Company&#146;s
contributions to the 401(k)&nbsp;plan are at the discretion of the management
board.&#160; The Company&#146;s plan allows for a
company match of 25% of each dollar contributed by the employee, not to exceed
1% of a participant&#146;s annual compensation.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">89</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Summary Compensation Table</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

we paid to the five most highly compensated employees during the year ended December&nbsp;31,

certain other most highly compensated executive officers during the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2007:</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">
 <tr>
  <td width="3%" valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:3.4%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.3%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="95%" valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:95.3%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">All other compensation
  includes $538 in premiums paid for life insurance policies insuring the lives
  of the executive officers and the Company&#146;s contributions to the employees&#146;
  401(k)&nbsp;plan.</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Employment
Contracts</font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Effective
October&nbsp;31, 2006, we signed an employment agreement with Michael J.
Hessling to serve as President.&#160; The
terms of the agreement stated that Mr.&nbsp;Hessling serve as our President for
a period of one year from the effective date of the agreement.&#160; Under the signed employment agreement, Mr.&nbsp;Hessling
was paid an annual base salary of $275,000 and was entitled to participate in a
bonus program, if a bonus program had been established for our senior
management team. Subsequent to October&nbsp;31, 2007, Mr.&nbsp;Hessling has
continued to serve as President without an employment contract, at the same
annual base salary of $275,000.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Effective
October&nbsp;30, 2006, we signed an employment agreement with Gary A. Gregg to
serve as Chief Operating Officer.&#160; The
terms of the agreement states that Mr.&nbsp;Gregg will serve as our Chief Operating
Officer for a period of three years from the effective date of the
agreement.&#160; Under the signed employment
agreement, Mr.&nbsp;Gregg will be paid an annual base salary of $250,000 and
will be eligible to </font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">90</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='90',FILE='C:\JMS\jcatlet\08-2823-1\task2822670\2823-1-fe.htm',USER='jcatlet',CD='Mar 28 22:19 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">receive an annual performance bonus based on targeted
EBITDA (as defined in the employment agreement) levels.&#160; If we choose to terminate Mr.&nbsp;Gregg&#146;s
employment without cause, Mr.&nbsp;Gregg will be entitled to receive separation
pay equal to six months of base salary at the then current rate.&#160; On March&nbsp;23, 2007, we signed a change of
control agreement with Mr.&nbsp;Gregg, which will expire on April&nbsp;30,
2008.&#160; The agreement defines a change of
control as the successful sale of a majority of our membership interests as
contemplated in the revised letter of intent that was signed by us on March&nbsp;14,
2007.&#160; Under the change of control
agreement, if employed by us at the time of a change in control, Mr.&nbsp;Gregg
is entitled to receive a change of control bonus equal to his then current
salary plus the prorated amount of any annual bonus he would have been entitled
to at the end of the calendar year under his employment agreement.&#160; If Mr.&nbsp;Gregg is terminated without cause
within twelve months after the change of control, he will be entitled to an
additional amount of up to twelve months salary.&#160; The change of control agreement lists the
circumstances under which we can terminate the agreement. The purpose of the
change of control agreement is to provide an incentive to Mr.&nbsp;Gregg to
continue employment with the Company through at least the change of control
date.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Effective
February&nbsp;1, 2005, we signed an employment agreement with Deborah J. Pierce
to serve as our Chief Financial Officer.&#160;
Under the signed employment agreement, Ms.&nbsp;Pierce will be paid an
annual base salary of $150,000 plus annual raises, and will be entitled to
participate in a bonus program for up to $50,000, if a bonus program is
established.&#160; If we choose to terminate Ms.&nbsp;Pierce&#146;s
employment without cause, Ms.&nbsp;Pierce will be entitled to receive
separation pay equal her monthly gross salary for six months after the
termination.&#160; On March&nbsp;23, 2007, we
signed a change of control agreement with Ms.&nbsp;Pierce, which will expire on
April&nbsp;30, 2008.&#160; The agreement
defines a change of control as the successful sale of a majority of our
membership interests as contemplated in the revised letter of intent that was
signed by us on March&nbsp;14, 2007.&#160;
Under the change of control agreement, if employed by us at the time of
a change in control, Ms.&nbsp;Pierce is entitled to receive a change of control
bonus equal to one half of her then current salary.&#160; If Ms.&nbsp;Pierce is terminated without
cause within six months after the change of control, she will be entitled to an
additional amount of up to six months salary on the condition that she
continues to assist us in finalizing our records for a reasonable period.&#160; The change of control agreement lists the
circumstances under which we can terminate the agreement. The purpose of the
change of control agreement is to provide an in incentive to Ms.&nbsp;Pierce to
continue employment with the Company through the change of control date and to
a reasonable period beyond. In 2007, in recognition of the additional work
involved with duties associated with the Asset Purchase Agreement between the
Company and Hedwigs Las Vegas Top Tier, LLC, the Company signed a bonus
agreement with Deborah J. Pierce awarding a bonus of $40,000 at the time the
transaction is consummated or a $20,000 bonus if the transaction is not
consummated.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Effective
October&nbsp;27, 2004, we signed an employment agreement with Kim L. Tyler to
serve as our Senior Vice-President of Food and Beverage.&#160; Under the signed employment agreement, Mr.&nbsp;Tyler
will be paid an annual base salary of $150,000 plus annual raises, and will be
entitled to participate in a bonus program for up to $50,000, if a bonus
program is established.&#160; If we choose to
terminate Mr.&nbsp;Tyler&#146;s employment without cause, Mr.&nbsp;Tyler will be
entitled to receive separation pay equal his monthly gross salary for six
months after the termination.&#160; On March&nbsp;23,
2007, we signed a change of control agreement with Mr.&nbsp;Tyler, which will
expire on April&nbsp;30, 2008.&#160; The
agreement defines a change of control as the successful sale of a majority of
our membership interests as contemplated in the revised letter of intent that
was signed by us on March&nbsp;14, 2007.&#160;
Under the change of control agreement, if employed by us at the time of
a change in control, Mr.&nbsp;Tyler is entitled to receive a change of control
bonus equal to one half of his then current salary.&#160; If Mr.&nbsp;Tyler is terminated without cause
within six months after the change of control, he will be entitled to an
additional amount of up to six months salary.&#160;
The change of control agreement lists the circumstances under which we
can terminate the agreement.&#160; The purpose
of the change of control agreement is to provide an incentive to Mr.&nbsp;Tyler
to continue employment with the Company through at least the change of control
date.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">91</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='91',FILE='C:\JMS\jcatlet\08-2823-1\task2822670\2823-1-fe.htm',USER='jcatlet',CD='Mar 28 22:19 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Compensation
of Management Board</font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The members of our management board currently
do not receive any separate compensation for serving on our management board.
All members of our management board are reimbursed for air, meal, and other
travel expenses incurred in connection with attendance at board meetings.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Options,
Long Term Incentive and Other Benefit Plans</font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We do not maintain a stock option plan or any
similar employee benefit plan.&#160;
Accordingly, during the last fiscal year, we have not issued any options
or stock to any of its executive officers or directors.&#160; In addition, there have not been any
exercises or re-pricings of stock options or stock appreciation rights held by
any of our executive officers or directors.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Management Board
Interlocks and Insider Participation</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Gary A. Gregg, our Chief
Operating Officer, participates in discussions regarding compensation for
executive officers and other employees.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:35.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">THE FOLLOWING REPORT OF THE
MANAGEMENT BOARD SHALL NOT BE DEEMED TO BE SOLICITING MATERIAL OR TO BE FILED
WITH THE SEC UNDER THE SECURITIES ACT OF 1933 OR THE SECURITIES EXCHANGE ACT OF
1934 OR INCORPORATED BY REFERENCE IN ANY DOCUMENT SO FILED.</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Management
Board Compensation Report</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our management board has
reviewed and discussed the above Compensation Discussion and Analysis with our
management and determined that the Compensation Discussion and Analysis be
included in this annual report.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<h2 style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-.75in;text-transform:uppercase;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></h2>

<h2 style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-.75in;text-transform:uppercase;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;text-transform:none;">ITEM 12.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;text-transform:none;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;text-transform:none;">SECURITY OWNERSHIP OF
CERTAIN BENEFICIAL OWNERS AND MANAGEMENT.</font><a name="Item12_SecurityOwnershipOfCertain_170809"></a></h2>

<h2 style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-.75in;text-transform:uppercase;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></h2>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following table shows information
regarding the beneficial ownership of our membership interests as of December&nbsp;31,
2007, and sets forth the number of and percentage owned by:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 54.7pt;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">each person
known to own beneficially more than 5% of any units of our membership
interests;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 54.7pt;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 54.7pt;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">each of the
members of our management board and named executive officers; and</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 54.7pt;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 54.7pt;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">all of our
management board and executive officers as a group.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 54.7pt;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">A person is a &#147;beneficial owner&#148; of a
security if that person has or shares &#147;voting power,&#148; which includes the power
to vote or to direct the voting of the security, or &#147;investment power,&#148; which
includes the power to dispose of or to direct the disposition of the security.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="99%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:99.98%;">
 <tr>
  <td width="65%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:65.14%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Name of Beneficial Owner</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:3.06%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:12.84%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Number of Units<br>
  Beneficially Owned</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:3.06%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>

  Units<br>
  Owned Beneficially</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:3.06%;">

  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:3.06%;">

  </td>
  <td width="12%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:12.84%;">

  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3.33</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:3.06%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:12.84%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3.33</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:3.06%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">%</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="65%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:65.14%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">All Management Board and
  Executive Officers as a group </font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(11 persons)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:3.06%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:12.84%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">96.04</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:3.06%;">

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="1" width="25%" noshade color="black" align="left"></div>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 30.25pt;text-indent:-30.25pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The membership interests of Florida
Hooters LLC are owned 50.1% by Hooters Gaming LLC and 49.9% by Lags Ventures,
LLC.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-30.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-30.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(2)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">By virtue of his 49.474% ownership
interest in Hooters Gaming LLC, Mr.&nbsp;DiGiannantonio is deemed to
beneficially own 16.52% of our membership interests.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-30.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-30.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(3)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">By virtue of his 19.789% ownership
interest in Hooters Gaming LLC, Mr.&nbsp;Ranieri is deemed to beneficially own
6.61% of our membership interests.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-30.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-30.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(4)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">By virtue of his 11.885% ownership
interest in Hooters Gaming LLC, Mr.&nbsp;Droste is deemed to beneficially own
3.97% of our membership interests.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-30.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-30.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(5)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">By virtue of his 1.979% ownership
interest in Hooters Gaming LLC, Mr.&nbsp;Johnson is deemed to beneficially own
0.66% of our membership interests.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-30.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-30.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(6)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">By virtue of his 5.000% ownership
interest in Hooters Gaming LLC, Mr.&nbsp;Kiefer is deemed to beneficially own
1.67% of our membership interests.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-30.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-30.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(7)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">By virtue of his sole ownership and
control of Lags Ventures, LLC, Mr.&nbsp;Lageschulte is deemed to beneficially
own all of our membership interests beneficially owned by Lags
Venture,&nbsp;LLC.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-30.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-30.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(8)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The membership interests of EW Common LLC
are owned 90% by Eastern&nbsp;&amp; Western and 10% by Michael Hessling.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-30.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-30.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(9)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Eastern&nbsp;&amp; Western is wholly
owned by S.I. Enterprises,&nbsp;Inc.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-30.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-30.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(10)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">S.I. Enterprises,&nbsp;Inc. was converted into a
limited-liability company on February&nbsp;28, 2005 and is now known as
S.I.&nbsp;Enterprises,&nbsp;LLC. The interests in S.I. Enterprises,&nbsp;Inc.
are owned 93% by Toyoroku Izumi and 7% by Sukeaki Izumi. By virtue of its sole
ownership of Eastern&nbsp;&amp; Western, S.I. Enterprises,&nbsp;Inc. is deemed
to beneficially own all of our membership interests beneficially owned by
Eastern&nbsp;&amp; Western.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-30.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-30.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(11)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">By virtue of his 7% ownership of S.I. Enterprises,&nbsp;Inc.,
Mr.&nbsp;S. Izumi is deemed to beneficially own 2.10% of our membership
interests.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">94</font></p>
